Su esposa es modista, comenta que tiene muy buena clientela ya formada a quienes les confecciona ropas por pedido. Tienen 3 hijas de 23,16 y 8 años respectivamente. Todas están estudiando y la mayor de ellas ya está por culminar una carrera universitaria. Blas comenta que se inició en la actividad hace aproximadamente 25 años aprendiendo la profesión con un tío que le enseñó todo lo que sabe. Elabora muebles de todo tipo como roperos, cómodas, sillas, etc., todos sobre pedido. Cuenta que siempre tiene trabajo porque se esfuerza para que sus productos sean de la mejor calidad y que su clientela salga siempre satisfecha, también fabrica muebles para clientes mayoristas. Con el fruto de su esfuerzo logró construir su casa propia. En dicho lugar funciona actualmente su carpintería que está equipada con todas las herramientas necesarias para desarrollar su actividad. Cuenta con orgullo que su profesión le ha dado la posibilidad de hacer estudiar a sus tres hijas. Debido a que no tuvo ningún hijo varón que le siga en la profesión debe redoblar esfuerzos para que las mismas, el día de mañana, puedan tener la posibilidad de terminar una carrera universitaria para poder ganarse el sustento diario. Hoy está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más maderas, pues uno de sus clientes mayoristas ha solicitado una gran cantidad de sus muebles y para cumplir con el necesita la madera.

loans.use: Compra de madera al por mayor

loans.name: Taikoke

texts.en: Tiakoke has to wake up extra early every day. Her home is quite a distance from town, where her flea market business has been for almost a decade now.  One of the oldest members of Luatuanuu center, Atikoke has managed to expand her handicraft business by opening another stall. With her next loan she’s hoping to look at the overseas market to export her goods.

loans.use: To restock her inventory

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Mrs. Matilde J. Olmedo is a 52-year-old widow and mother of two living in San Ignacio, Paraguay. Her two daughters are ages 18 and 16 respectively. Both daughters are currently in high school and help their mother when they are not studying. Matilde is thankful for the help of her daughters, as maintaining her business and family has been difficult since the death of her husband in 2001. Mr. Olmedo died of cancer at the age of 45. This was a tremendous loss for the family and also left Matilde with the debt incurred due to the operations and treatment her husband undertook to try and cure him. For this reason Matilde works extremely hard to cover the debt she has as a result of her husband’s death.

Her store, a small grocery, is very well-stocked and well-managed due to the time and effort Matilde dedicates to it. She sells rice, noodles, oil, sugar, flour and eggs. Having had this store for 14 years, she understands how to make things run smoothly. She has asked for a loan to buy articles of clothing. She wishes to expand her store to also sell clothing. It is her hope that with the summer months and added inventory she will be able to increase her sales. By expanding her store Matilde wishes to pay off her debt faster.

loans.use: To buy articles of clothing

loans.name: Mayra Alejandra

texts.es:
My house has a wooden roof, but it is quite damaged due to the weather. My house is very damp during this rainy season, so I would like to knock this roof down and build a concrete roof in order to prevent my family from getting sick. I am requesting $1,200.00 to build a concrete roof for my house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo un techo de madera en mi vivienda pero ya esta muy dañado por el tiempo y en estas temporadas de lluvia mi casa esta muy húmeda, me gustaría tumbarlo y construir un techo de concreto para evitar que mi familia enferme debido a tanta humedad” Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para construir el techo de concreto en mi vivienda.

loans.use: Construction of concrete roof

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
Mavluda was born in Dushanbe. She is not married. Currently she lives with her parents. She has a stable business and she has been doing it for the past 10 years. Her shop is close to the market “Sahovat”. She began her business with a small inventory, slowly increasing her turnover. After a while, Mavluda was able to save money and opened her own shop. In 2003, she rented a stall (in the picture). Currently, she has wide range of products: baked goods, which she purchases in the local bakeries and confectioners shops as well as soft drinks and juices from local manufacturers. The rest of her goods she purchases at local wholesale markets. Her inventory is worth $1000 and she is applying to KIVA with a request for a loan of $1200 (5000 Somoni) for 6 months for the purchase of her next batch of products.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Мавлюда родилась в Душанбе,незамужем.В настояшее время живет с родителями. Имеет стабильный бизнес и занимается этим делом на протяжении 10 лет.Её магазин расположен около рынка "Саховат".Она раньше продавала не большую партию товара.Постепенно она расширила свой ассортимент и смогла накопить деньги на магазинюВ 2003 году она арендовала магазин где вы сейчас можете её увидеть.В данное время она имеет широкий выбор товаров.Мучные продукты она закупает в местных кондитерских цехах, напитки привозят с лиманадных цехов и заводов.Остальной товар она закупает на оптовом рынке.Она имеет в обороте $1000 и в данное время она обратилась в КИВА с просьбой на 5000сомони на 6 месецев для заукпки очередной партии товара.

loans.use: Buying food porducts.

loans.name: Trik

texts.en:
Mrs. Trik H., 48, is a farmer and owns a plot of land growing a variety of vegetables. She makes approximately three dollars per day. Her husband, Mr. Ang Savon, 47, works in a rice field.. He earns about two dollars each day. This couple has three children. Two of the children work at a factory and have an income of $70.00 a month.

Mrs. H. will use this loan to purchase a motorcycle to transport rice and vegetables from the field to the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to transport rice and vegetables from the field to the market.

loans.name: Milka

texts.es:
Mrs. Milka is 34 years old and the mother of 4 children. She works every day in a small location offering an enormous variety of products to her customers. She sells cookies, sweets, soft drinks and other food products that are the fascination of all the local children. Her work has enabled her to better manage her home. She has decided to ask for a loan so that she can set up a better sales location. She would like to have her workplace ready for the beginning of the school year, as the children are her main source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

La señora Milka de 34 años de edad, tiene 04 hijos, su labor diaria la desempeña en un pequeño espacio en el que oferta una inmensa variedad de galletas, dulces, gaseosa y demás comestibles que son la fascinación de los más pequeños. Con esta labor ha podido extender las satisfacciones en su hogar y decidido solicitar un préstamo para implementar y acondicionar mejor su espacio de ventas a fin de iniciar una buena faena en cuanto inicie la labor escolar, fuente de sus ingresos diarios.

loans.use: To set up a proper sales location

loans.name: Plong

texts.en:
Mrs. Plong N. is 54 and is married with ten children. Five of her children are married, two are farmers who breed cows and grow rice, and the rest cook food for their household. Mrs. Plong N. is a widow. Since her husband passed away many years ago, Plong N. has to carry the burden of covering all of her family’s expenses by herself.

She has a stand at a market selling various kinds of vegetables and she, normally, she can make about $1 to $2 of net income each day. She has humbly requested a loan to expand her vegetable booth. With the leftover money, she will purchase another plot of farmland to expand her family’s crops.

loans.use: To expand her vegetable booth and purchase another plot of farmland

loans.name: Ongaroi Jua Kali Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Rosemary I. is an average woman aged 30 with 3 children. She also lives with 1 orphan child of her late brother who perished 2 years ago.

Rosemary started her business 3 years ago after accumulating savings from her former work place in a local hospital located in Busia town. She currently deals in ladies' shoes but would like to diversify to include children's and men’s collections as well. Being the bread winner for her family, it would enable her to support both her children and her husband, who has a low-paying job. With the little profit that she gets from the business, Rosemary still struggles to pay her house rent and to feed and clothe her children. But with the help of her loan, Rosemary will be able to add more stock of second-hand shoes and increase her monthly sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand shoes for re-sale

loans.name: Chon Erm Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-one people in Preak Thom Village make up one Village Bank and Mrs. Chon E. is the Village Bank President. She grows different kinds of vegetables in the village.

Her plantation business activity now is not performing very well because the field is infertile. In order to make her plantation crop more productive, Mrs. Chon E. would like to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizers to support the field.

Her husband, Mr. Yang Sam, is a vegetable farmer. Mrs. Chon E. is the mother of two children, both of whom are attending a local school. Mrs. Chon E. now has a swollen leg and she spends unforeseen expenses. People who stand at the right are not in these Village Bank members.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers to support the field.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan S., 20, is single with no children. She has many years of experience in the elei business making Samoan screen-printed material. She sells to the general public and villages 4 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 430 Tala (~179 USD). SPBD loans are Joan’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will be able to use it for the business.

loans.use: Purchase fabric clothes, paints, brushes and threads.

loans.name: Rosas Rojas Group

texts.es:
Hello.  We are part of a group called Rosas Rojas, or Red Roses.   We all work selling everyday household items and groceries from two shops we run.    Guadalupe del Carmen D. sells her snacks in the neighborhood.  Her customers appreciate the high quality of her products and the reasonable prices.    Marta G. sells merchandise from the shop.  As it's located on a main street, she benefits from a good customer base and is well known in the community.  And Ciriaca G. also works in the shop.  As a single mother, this income from this business helps her take of her 3 children.  

 They are all requesting financial help to continue to grow their respective businesses and improve the quality of life for their families.  


hola nosotras somos el grupo Rosas Rojas, nuestra actividad es el comercio, vendemos mercaderia y tenemos dos pulperias de ventas de productos de consumo popular.

nuestras activiades son:
Guadalupe del Carmen D.: mi actividad principal es el comercio, en la cual vendo oro enchape de manera ambulante, mis clientes me prefieren por la atencion que les brindo y por la buena calidad de mi producto a un bajo costo.

Marta G.: la actividad de ella es la venta de productos de consumo popular, dicha pulperia esta ubicada en la calle principal de la comunidad de sartenejas, jamastran. ella cuenta con un local muy agradable para sus clientes ya que por ello es muy reconocida por todos los habitantes de nuestra comunidad.

Ciriaca G.: cuenta con una pulperia que esta ubicada en la comunidad de sartenejas, jamastran, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, dicho negocio le ayuda a salir adelante con su familia.

todas nosotras solicitamos ayuda para que nos permitan crecer con nuestros negocios y mejorar nuestras condiciones de vida.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for their respective businesses, increase their income and continue to improve the quality of life for their families.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba is 45 years old and divorced. She owns and runs her own shop and she has been a soup seller since 2000. Every day, she works from 9AM to 6PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Habiba now hopes for a loan to buy more items to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to expand her business.

loans.name: Vaeula

texts.en:
Vaeula M., 27, is married with 5 children. She has many years of experience growing cabbages, cucumbers, pumpkins, beans, and tomatoes. She sells to the public and to villagers 3 days per week.

She has taken 2 previous loans from South Pacific Business Development (SPBD). She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 410 Tala (~$170 USD). SPBD loans are Vaeula's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from the traditional banks. She will also use the loan to buy iron roofs to repair the roof of her home. Her husband is working to help with the family's needs and funding the business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, chemicals and vegetables seeds

loans.name: Inomdjon

texts.ru: Каримов Иномджон житель города Турсунзаде. Возраст 21 год, женат и имеет одного ребенка. Уже один год занимается такси. Имеет свой автомобиль , который использует в качестве транспорта. Ему необходим кредит для того , чтобы сделать ремонт автомобиля. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 8 месяцев.
texts.en:
Inomdjon K. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 21 years old, married and has a child. He has been in a taxi business for one year and owns a car. Inomdjon needs a loan in order to make repairs on his car. He will be able to repay the loan within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car repairs

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia baji is the wife of M. and lives in Riwind, Pakistan. She has been living in a two room brick house for the past 20 years. Shazia baji is a mother of five children: three daughters and two sons. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Shazia baji’s husband has owned an animal food selling business for the past ten years.  Shazia baji owns a milk selling business. She gets milk from her buffalo and sells it at different milk shops. Her elder daughter helps her by filling the milk in milk pots. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to help buy more animal food for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To buy animal food

loans.name: Majed

texts.en:
Majed A. is a hard-working man who strives to provide for his wife and seven children. Majed sells a variety of goods from his small store. He also works as a messenger at the governmental office earning about $200 per month - an amount insufficient to meet basic family expenses.

Majed wishes to take a loan of $1200 to increase his inventory in order to increase sales. With your help this will be possible.

loans.use: To increase the inventory in his store.

loans.name: Maria Martha

texts.es: Doña Maria es gerente de una tienda desde hace cinco años, tiene 57 años de edad, y reside en  barrio de Memorial Sandino, tiene una hija de 23 años de edad, que esta en la universidad, anteriormente se desempeñaba en ventas pero con su buen desempeño la promovieron a gerente, lo cual se siente sastifecha por sus logros, su esposo trabaja en una empresa privada de asesor administrativo y siempre ha tenido su apoyo, la Sra. Martha ha hecho tres préstamo en Afodenic en los cuales ha invertido en las mejoras de la vivienda, con este préstamo va a comprar materiales de construcción para construir la cocina  y estar cómoda y gozar de una vivienda digna.  Sus objetivos es segur remodelando su casa para dejarle un buen patrimonio a su hija, a si como seguir apoyándola con sus estudios
texts.en:
Doña Maria has been the manager of a store for the past 5 years. She is 57 years old, and she lives in the neighbourhood of Memorial Sandino. She has a daughter who is 23 years old who is in university. Previously, she worked as a saleswoman, but her good work promoted her to manager, which makes her feel happy for her achievements. Her husband works in a private business of administrative consultants and she always has his support. Sra. Martha has had three loans with AFODENIC in which she invested in improving her home. This loan would go to buying construction materials to construct a kitchen and to be more comfortable and to enjoy a dignified home. Her objectives are to remodel her home to give a good patrimony to her daughter, and so continue to help her with her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials for the kitchen

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Mambo ("Hello!") from Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Jessie M. from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She is single and has no children. However, she is responsible for supporting one dependent, because his parents cannot care for him. Jessie has been running a hair salon since 2008. Her salon is a place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair or blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or braided, and made to look like your own. She works at her business for 5-8 hours per day, seven days per week, and is assisted by two employees. Jessie currently earns about $100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients for making food. In the future, she plans to open another business. Jessie thanks you for her support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making food

loans.name: Charles

texts.es: Charles de 23 años de edad, es casado y  tiene una hijita de 4 años la cual está estudiando. Él es un hombre muy trabajador que siempre se ha dedicado a trabajar, da todo de sí en las labores que realiza, desde hace 4 años se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, es propietario  de un motocarro, con el cual se moviliza por las calles de su ciudad en busca de pasajeros, gustándole el conocer varios lugares y relacionarse con muchas personas, porque es muy amistoso y su gran carisma ha hecho que su servicio gane fama, siendo muy cotizado por las personas del lugar, lo que le es muy rentable. Charles administra su dinero separándolo para comprar cosas para su familia y para hacerle algunos arreglos a su principal herramienta de trabajo, porque él quiere seguir creciendo en el negocio del transporte y para ello tiene que tener en muy buenas condiciones a su moto. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP y le gusta mucho  trabajar con su grupo ya que son muy unidos. Con el dinero que solicita quiere comprar repuestos para mandar a reparar su mototaxi en lo que gastará un aproximado de1000 soles, y que gracias a ello pueda lograr mayores ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, el resto del dinero lo invertirá en pequeño taller de soldadura que atiende en sus ratos libres.
texts.en:
Charles is 23 years old, married and has a small daughter aged 4 who is already studying. He is a very hard-working man who has always devoted himself to his work and gives his all in the labours he undertakes. For the last four years he has worked transporting passengers, as he is the owner of a motor-bike which he drives through the town's streets looking for passengers. He likes knowing different places and interacting with many people, because he is very friendly and his great charisma means that his services have become famous, and he is much sought-after by people in the area. This means his business is very profitable. Charles manages his money, dividing it to buy things for his family and for making some repairs to his main tool of trade, because he wants to continue expanding his transport business and for that he need to keep his motor-bike in excellent condition. This is his 3rd loan with MFP and he likes working with his group very much, as they are all very united. With the money that he has asked for he wants to buy spare parts to make repairs to his taxi, which will cost around 1000 soles. Thanks to this he will be able to increase his income and improve his family's quality of life. He will invest the rest of the money in a small soldering workshop which he deals with in his spare time.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Neftalí

texts.es:
El señor Neftalí C. actualmente vive en el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de Leñon donde se dedica a su actividad economica de ganadería con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de su familia compuesta por su esposa y su pequeño hijo para brindarles un techo digno donde vivir y haya seguridad.

Es importante destacar que hoy en día ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de un novillo y por esto es que espera que su crédito sea otorgado y así salir adelante en su actividad ganadera que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Mr. Neftali C. currently lives in the municipality of El Sauce in the city of Leñon where he raises livestock with the purpose of bettering the living conditions of his family. His family consists of his wife and young son and he wants to give them a decent place to live where there is security.

It is important to emphasize that today he has asked for the support of Ceprodel in order to obtain a loan for the purchase of young bull; for this purpose he hopes that his loan will be granted and then he will be able to forge ahead in his business that very much requires your support.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for the purchase of cattle

loans.name: Valentine

texts.fr:
G. Valentine est née le 14/02/1970 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Valentine est célibataire avec cinq enfants dont quatre scolarisés. Valentine vend du maïs, de la farine de manioc, du haricot, de l'huile de noix de palme, de galettes d'arachide, de charbon de bois, du riz et de savons. Valentine est dans le commerce depuis quinze (15) ans environ mais c'est avec les prêts qu'elle a eu de ALIDé que Valentine a vu son activité grandir. Pour renforcer son activité afin de mieux satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants Valentine sollicite un nouveau prêt auprès de ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
G. Valentine was born on February 14, 1970 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is unmarried and has five children, four of whom are in school. She sells corn, cassava flour, beans, palm nut oil, peanut galettes, charcoal, rice, and soap. She has been in this business for about fifteen years. And with the Alidé loans she had, she's seen her business grow. To bolster her business, so as to do better in supporting herself and her children, Valentine is requesting a new loan from Alidé.

ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. ALIDÉ offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, corn, peanuts, and beans, and boxes of soap

loans.name: Fredelyn

texts.en:
“Success is the fruit of sacrifice” says Fredelyn D., an electronic load retailer in the village of Manamtam, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Michael and they have a three-year-old daughter named Regielyn Rose. Fredelyn believes that one must really experience pain and difficulties for life to become successful. The couple is trying to start saving something to send their child and future children to school.

The couple strives to provide a better life for their family. Engaging in the electronic load business is quite easy because Fredelyn can sell loads to her customers while taking care of their daughter and doing household chores. Her husband is planting vegetables and root crops. She started the business with a small capital and she generates a monthly income of PHP1,500. In this regard, she wants to improve and strengthen her enterprise. She now wants to borrow a loan of PHP 5,000 for her retailing business. She believes that through the financial assistance, she will become successful in her venture.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Sadaqat

texts.en:
Sadaqat A. is a married man and the father of one son. Together with his wife, he has been raising cattle for more than 20 years. This is the business that produces the income which allows him to feed his child and his wife.

As well as caring for his livestock, he also works as a teacher in the local school, which helps with the family's basic needs and provides additional income.

Sadaqat has asked for this loan to buy three young calves in order to obtain a better profit. His greatest wish is to be able to improve his farm by constructing enclosures and establishing better grazing for his livestock.

loans.use: To purchase three calves

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
With strong faith and determination, Melody is hoping to achieve her goals in life. She aims to become a successful dressmaker. She pursued her vocational studies in dress making, which is now of great help to her family.

She is happily married to Antonio and blessed with three children. They live in Barangay Nagcuartelan, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. The couple is providing for the needs of their family and in sending their youngest child to college. Two are already college graduates.

Melody's husband is a passenger driver. She is asking for financial support amounting to PHP10, 000.00 for her tailoring business. With the loan she hopes to make uniforms and pants. Melody wants to improve her business, but she has inadequate capital. She hopes to strengthen her business with financial assistance and with her strong determination will grow and become a successful dressmaker.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen manages a sari-sari store business (typical village store) in her village. She is 34 years old and married to Rico. They are blessed with two children; the eldest is Christian Mark - 16 years old, fourth year high school and Lourie Joy - 15 years old, third year high school. She is thankful because even though she was spending a lot for their allowances, projects and tuition fees, she was able to maintain her store. However, she needs additional capital to buy enough stock of merchandise and requests a loan of PHP5, 000 from Kiva lenders.  She also hopes to engage in the vegetable vending business.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Aqdam

texts.en:
Aqdam B. is a 29-year-old single man. Aqdam owns a grocery store and provides for his extended family with the revenue generated by it.

He is requesting a loan to increase his stock. Aqdam is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: purchase more food items

loans.name: Essomassina

texts.fr: Cette femme est veuve et a ses 04 enfants à sa charge. Elle exerce le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, c’est avec le revenu de cette activité qu’elle subvient aux charges de sa famille, elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de lomé. Voulant reconstituer son stock, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter  divers produits d’alimentation générale.
texts.en:
This woman is a widow and is raising her four children by herself. She has a general store, and it is with the income from that business that she supports her family. She buys her supplies at the big market in Lomé. Wishing to replenish her stock, she is asking WAGES for a loan to buy various grocery products for resale.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of groceries for re-sale

loans.name: Rabeca Nhancale

texts.pt:
Rabeca nasceu em Gaza tem 41 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 5 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 12 aos 23 anos, somente os três mais novos é que vão à escola.

Não responsabiliza se por ninguém e conta com ajuda do seu segundo filho nos trabalhos, consegue poupar por mês um valor de 1.000.00MT porque faz os seus trabalhos numa capoeira de aluguer pagando 1.000.00MT em cada fase.  

Rabeca sai de Gaza para Município da vila de Namaacha (Fronteira da Suazilândia) quando tinha apenas 2 anos de idade com sua mãe, esta que andava a procura de emprego. Inicia os estudos muito tarde devido à falta de condições e quando frequentava a 4ª classe a mãe fica desempregada, e ela teve que abandonar os estudos e trabalhar na empresa estatal como criadora de pintos durante 5 anos, para ajudar nas despesas da casa. 

Anos depois junta se com seu esposo que lhe deu um fundo para iniciar com seu próprio negócio de criação e venda de frangos. Tem metido uma media de 2x100 pintos em cada fase, pois ela tem vendido alternadamente para não perder a clientela. Gastando em cada fase um valor de 14.000.00MT obtendo de lucro um valor de 4.000.00MT quando vende a grosso para revendedores, e de 6.000.00MT quando vende por unidade a consumidores locais. Mas, mais tarde, devido a enormes encomendas do seu produto ela aproxima se a hluvuku e Kiva solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00MT para aumentar a sua criação (comprar mais pintos e ração) e satisfazer as necessidades dos seus clientes a tempo.

Este é o terceiro empréstimo de Rabeca na Hluvuku e primeiro com kiva. O primeiro de 9.200,00MT e o segundo de 7.000,00MT foram usados para a mesma actividade. Está confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir novos empréstimos para construir a sua própria capoeira.
texts.en:
Rabeca was born in Gaza. She is 41 years old, married, and is the mother of five children with ages ranging from 12 to 23 years. Only the three youngest go to school. She has no dependents, and relies on the help of her second son in her work. She manages to save 1,000 MT per month because they run their business in a rented chicken coop that costs 1,000 MT for each phase. Rabeca left Gaza when she was only two years old for the town of Namaacha (at the border of Swaziland) with her mother, who went there looking for work. She began her schooling very late due to their financial situation. When she was in fourth grade, her mother lost her job and she had to abandon her studies and work in a state-owned company as a chicken keeper for five years to help with household expenses. Years later, she married her husband, who gave her funds to begin her own business raising and selling chickens. This involves an average of 2x100 chicks in each stage, which she has sold both wholesale and retail so as not to lose her clientele. Spending 14,000 MT in each phase, she earns 4,000 MT in profit when she sells wholesale to dealers, and 6,000 MT in profit when she sells chickens singly to local consumers. But later, due to enormous orders for her product, she approached Hluvuku and Kiva, asking for a loan in the amount of 10,000 MT to increase her livestock (to buy more chicks and feed) and to satisfy the needs of her customers on time. This is Rabeca's third loan with Hluvuku and her first loan with Kiva. The first loan of 9,200 MT and the second of 7,000 MT were used for the same purpose. She is confident that she will repay the loan before it comes due and will ask for new loans to build her own chicken coop.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicks and feed, to raise and sell chickens

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.es: Miguelina tiene 43 años, vive con su esposo, quien trabaja como chofer de motocarro y tienen un hijo de 14 años que es estudiante de nivel secundario. Desde hace 11 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo a pedido, además en su casa cuenta con una pequeña vitrina donde exhibe los productos que tiene en stock y puede vender al momento, sin necesidad de hacer el pedido por la revista. Adicionalmente, su esposo trabaja con un motocarro (propio) realizando transporte de pasajeros y ella es quien se encarga de administrar los ingresos diarios de este negocio. A Miguelina le gusta mucho su trabajo porque conoce a muchas personas, hace buenas relaciones y eso la ayuda a incrementar su lista de clientes, de esa manera sigue incrementando sus ventas. Para un futuro cercano, le gustaría tener una tienda de ropa y accesorios, donde también pueda seguir vendiendo sus cosméticos. Con MFP ya tiene 13 préstamos y ella menciona que lo que más le gusta de su banco comunal es que no es un grupo muy numeroso, trabajan bien organizados y con mucha responsabilidad en sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita, Miguelina comprará más productos de belleza, en un monto de 1000 soles, con lo que resta comprara materiales de construcción para mandar a refaccionar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Miguelina, 43, lives with her husband. He is a driver of a “motocarro” (three wheeled motorized cart). They have a 14 year old son who is in secondary school. For 11 years she has been selling beauty products by catalog order. Also, she has a small display case in her house where she displays the products she has in stock. She can sell these products immediately without having to place an order from the catalog. Additionally, her husband works with his own motocarro transporting passengers. She is the one who manages the daily income from this business. Miguelina likes her work very much because she meets lots of people, makes nice relationships, and this helps her increase her list of customers. This way she keeps increasing her sales. In the near future, she would like to have a clothing and accessories store where she could keep selling her cosmetics. She has had 13 loans with MFP. What she likes best about her community bank is that it is not a large group. They work in a well organized manner and are very responsible about their payments. With the money she is asking for Miguelina will buy beauty products for 1,000 PEN. She will use the rest of the money to buy construction materials to have her house refurbished.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Léontine

texts.fr: K. Léontine est née vers 1973 à PIN. Léontine est mariée à AGBEZOUNNOU Pierre.  Léontine est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés mais, seulement trois sont encore à sa charge. Léontine vit avec ses enfants dans le troisième arrondissement de Porto-Novo. Léontine a fait le cours primaire mais depuis quinze ans Léontine est dans la restauration. Léontine vend les pâtes de maïs, de causette d’igname et de manioc, du riz, etc. C’est Léontine seule qui supporte les charges de ses enfants.
texts.en:
K. Léontine was born around 1973 in PIN.  She is married to AGBEZOUNNOU Pierre and is the mother of four children who are all in school, but only three of them are still in her care.  She lives with her children in the 3rd District of Porto-Novo.  Léontine has completed primary school. And since she was 15 years old, she has been in food service.  She sells pâtes de maïs (different kinds of polenta), yam and cassava chips, rice, etc.  She is the only one supporting her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, cassava flour, yam chips, and sauce condiments

loans.name: Suhbaatar

texts.en: L. Sukhbaatar is 30 years old and lives with his wife and two young children, ages 1 and 3, in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His oldest son already attends kindergarten, and his wife, a photographer, stays home with the little one. Sukhbaatar operates a vegetables trading business in his town. He provides a large selection of vegetables, some of which he harvests himself, to his customers. This year, he wasn't able to harvest carrots and must purchase them. Sukhbaatar started his grocery business in 2006 with working capital of 500,000 tugrugs (~350 USD). After several years of successful business activity he has used his earnings to provide for his family and was recently able to purchase a car. Today, his working capital exceeds 5,000,000 tugrugs (~3500 USD). For the future, he hopes for continued success and says, " My only wish is to provide for my children's future edcucation." He is requesting a 1,400,000 tugrug (~980 USD) loan to purchase carrots for his grocery business.

loans.use: to purchase carrots for his grocery business

loans.name: Quirwin

texts.en:
Quirwin E. is from the village of Lacapp, Acad Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur in the Philippines. He is 37 years old, married, and has 7 school-age children. To make a living, Quirwin owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. Specifically, he buys and sells "uling" charcoal to local community members. Quirwin has been engaged in this business for over 3 years, and he earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2009, Quirwin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services and to thereby improve his living situation as well as his ability to engage in business activities. Notably, Quirwin has already successfully repaid a prior loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Quirwin is now requesting a second loan from GDMPC in the amount of 6,000 PHP ($150), which will be used to expand the business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of this loan to improve his family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices, covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen, and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To expand and improve his charcoal sales business

loans.name: Klod

texts.en: Klod S., 29, is married with two school-aged children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her husband (pictured) and children. To make a living she grows rice, earning approximately $6 per day. The family is mainly supported by her husband who is a skillful fisherman.  He earns about $5 per day and this income pays for the education of their two children. Mrs. S. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a $700 loan to purchase a machine for her husband’s fishing boat. By doing so, her husband will be able to more easliy transport his fishing traps to the lake to go fishing.

loans.use: buy a machine for the fishing boat

loans.name: Sesay United Group

texts.en:
This is Foday S., Idrissa K., and Isatu S.. They are local entrepreneurs in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They named their group S. group, after the surname of the group’s leader. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, they will be able to make enough profit to repay the loan, feed their children, pay their school fees, and save some money for unforeseen situations.

Foday S., shown in the middle of the photo, is the leader of the group. Foday was born in a village called Batkanu, in northern Sierra Leone. He is forty-one years of age. He is married to a businesswoman and they have three children. Two of their children are in primary school and the last is in nursery school. Foday sells local produce like palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), rice, soap and so on. Foday has been a businessman for two years now.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The purchase of food goods

loans.name: Isaidel

texts.es: E señor Isaidel es un cliente que ha demostrado ser muy puntual en sus pagos anteriormente su expareja obtuvo un crédito con nosotros y se tuvo que ir de la ciudad y el asumió la responsabilidad del crédito, lo cual demuestra el gran sentido de responsabilidad que tiene, por ello se le esta tramitando este crédito para la compra de un automóvil para su negocio de taxi. Ya que además de este ingreso, percibe uno más ya que labora para una empresa desde hace 5 años.
texts.en:
Sr. Isaidel is a customer who has proven to be very punctual in his previous payments. His ex-wife obtained a loan with us and she had to go to the city and he assumed the responsibility for the loan, which demonstrates the great sense of responsibility that he has. He is applying for this loan in order to buy a car for his taxi business. Now with this income, he will receive one more since he works for a company for five years.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in the purchase of a car for his work as a taxi driver

loans.name: Margarita De Los Santos

texts.es: La señora Margarita de los Santos C. C., tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y el esposo trabaja como conductor apoyando a los gastos del hogar ellos tiene 4 hijos de los cuales tres de ellos estudian la escuela primaria, el mayor logro de la familia seria el poder tener los recursos necesarios para ofrecerles los estudios profesionales a todos sus hijos. Ellos se dedican desde hace 21 años, a la agricultura al cultivo de la piña con el tiempo planean diversificar sus cultivos con otros rentables, de manera que para lograr esto, solicitaron un préstamo con el objetivo de comprar fertilizantes y brindarle las condiciones apropiadas al siembra de la piña y de esta forma venderla a un buen precio por ser piña de calidad y así poder diseminar otros tipos de frutas que se vendan a un buen precio y que logren una mejor estabilidad económica para la familia.
texts.en:
Margarita de los Santos C. C. is 37 and married. Her husband works as a driver, and he helps with the household expenses. They have four children. Three of them are in elementary school. The greatest achievement of the family would be to be able to have the necessary resources to give all of their children the education to become professionals. They have been growing pineapples for 21 years. In time they plan to diversify their crops with other profitable crops. In order to do this they are asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. That will provide the appropriate conditions for planting pineapple. This way they will sell it for a good price because it will be good quality pineapple. Then they will be able to disseminate other types of fruits and sell then at a good price. This will give them more economic stability for the family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers for crop maintenance

loans.name: Afua

texts.en:
Afua is married and mothers four children who are all in school. The 44-year-old woman lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in one of the mining towns in Ghana. 

Afua works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells a local dish called banku, from corn dough. It is served hot with soup. 

Afua sells on a tabletop by the roadside in her community. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Mrs. Sarom Long Village Bank Group

texts.en: A village bank loan which consists of twelve people is located in Kbal Chrouy village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sarom L. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members who will all use the loan for different purposes. She is a vegetable seller in the local village and her husband, Mr. TO. Sorn, is an ice crE. seller who can earns little income to support his family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Sarom L. decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to sell. She is a mother of five children who are enrolled in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Katumba

texts.en:
Katumba is 40 years of age and married with five children between the ages of 3 and 18. All her children go to school. The family resides in and owns a two-roomed house, where she stays with seven  people. She takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water at home. The family has three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include utility bills, school fees for the children, medication and feeding the family. 

Katumba has a food stall in Kanyanya, where she sells cassava, sweet potatoes, banana clusters and fruits like oranges, mangoes and pineapples. She buys these foodstuffs from Kalerwe market, one of the busiest markets in Kampala city, and so she incurs transport costs. She receives an average of 30 customers a day. She has done this business for over 20 years. 

Her main challenges are defaulters, the rainy season (because she works from a muddy place), and the ever increasing prices of foodstuffs  She sells on a retail basis only. She has been with MCDT, a Kiva partner, for over five years and is servicing her 10th loan, working all this time with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas and sacks of cassava, sweet potatoes and pineapples. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and to start selling wholesale only.
.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas and sacks of sweet potataoes, cassava and pineapples

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 53 años, es una mujer muy sencilla que a lo largo de su vida siempre ha trabajado muy duro por sobresalir. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Antonio de 59 años, quien es el compañero de toda su vida y lo que más desean es tener una vejez tranquila.

Las chacras que con tanto esfuerzo ha cultivado siempre les han brindado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia. Ella cultiva zanahorias, papas y gladiolos (flores), las cuales luego con la ayuda de su esposo lleva a vender hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde mejores precios le dan por sus productos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucha paciencia; lleva 29 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden aquejarlos. Para más adelante, espera poder ampliar sus tierras para poder sembrar más.

Este es el octavo préstamo de Julia con MFP, ella ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y desea serlo también ahora. A su vez, en su banco comunal es una socia muy comprometida con el desarrollo de su grupo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más semillas de alverja, además de abono e insecticidas.
texts.en:
Julia, 53, is a simple woman who has worked hard most of her life to stand out. She lives in her own home with her husband Antonio, 59, her life-long companion, and what they want the most is a tranquil old age. The farmlands they have cultivated with so much hard work have provided the income necessary to maintain their family. She grows carrots, potatoes, and gladiolas (flowers), which then, with her husband's help, she takes to sell in the main market of the city of Tarma, which is where she can get the best prices for her produce. What she enjoys the most about her work is planting seeds in the land, which she does with great patience. She has been doing this for 29 years, and the hardest part is guarding her crops from the pests that can afflict them. In the future she hopes to increase her lands so she can grow more. This is the eighth loan Julia has had through MFP, she has repaid her previous loans very punctually and intends to do so this time. As a member of her communal bank, she is very committed to the development of her group. With the $550 she is requesting, she will purchase additional pea seeds as well as fertilizer and insecticides.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seed, fertilizer, insecticide

loans.name: Dong's Group

texts.en:
Đồng Thị Hoàng was born in 1959. Presently, she is living in X. Non, Dong Anh, Hanoi with her husband and her two children. The elder son has been employed and the younger one is still at school. Unsurprisingly, she farms to scratch out a living but that only source of income does not meet her needs. Sometimes Dong also has a part-time job as an assistant builder to aid her husband in his work. All those jobs generate a total monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND per month. Noticeably, six years is such a long period that she has been identified with SEDA program. More importantly, she has never been late to pay off her debts. In this credit cycL., she keeps on being willing to take out a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy equipment and tools.

Along with her, there are also four other peopL.: 

 Hiên Thị Nguyễn is 27 years old. She wants to take out a loan of 4,142,000 VND to raise pigs and cows. 

 Hương Xuân Thị Nguyễn is a 34-year-old farmer. She needs to borrow 4,142,000 VND to buy more piglets to raise. 

 Thúy Thị Lê is 28. She also wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND to invest more in raising chickens. 

 Oanh Thị Nguyễn is 33 years old. She would like to take out a loan of 5.014.000 VND to finance her plan to raise pigs.

loans.use: To buy equipment and tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries and rechargeable phone cards to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine S. is 42 years old and is married to a village head man in Tokeh: a rural community in Waterloo. She has 3 children: 2 sons who are in secondary school and one daughter who is in primary school.

 
She is raising 7 other children who are her nephews. They depend on her and they are all in secondary school. Josephine owns a fishing boat and has several young men who fish for her. She has been in this business for 10 years.


With this loan of 3 million Leones she intends to hire more fishermen and to buy more fishing nets. It is her hope to be a model in the fishing industry.

loans.use: to hire more fishermen and to buy more nets.

loans.name: Calixto

texts.es:
Calixto actualmente cuenta con 49 años de edad y vive junto a su esposa de 45 años en su propia casa, la misma que comparte con su hijo de 12 años. Calixto es operador de lijadora de terciados en la empresa 
maderera de la provincia, también alquila parte de su casa donde vive. No existe competencia ya que Calixto es empleado antiguo, fijo y seguro en dicha empresa maderera. Según informe verbal del Calixto el préstamo lo invirtió en la curación de su hijo, quien estuvo internado en el hospital de la ciudad por más de 21 días, ya que tuvo un accidente y fue parte de la cabeza la más comprometida. Este es el tercer crédito de Calixto, cabalmente tiene sus atrasos en su crédito anterior por problemas de salud de su hijo. No tiene ningún crédito en  otra institución financiera.
texts.en:
Calixto is 49 years old. He lives with his 45 year old wife and their 12 year old son in their own house. Calixto operates a medium-size sander in the wood company in the province. He also rents part of the house where he lives. There is no competition because Calixto is a long time employee. He is set and secure in this wood company. Calixto says that he will use the loan to heal his son. His son was in the city hospital for over 21 days because he had an accident. Part of his head was the most compromised. This is Calixto’s third loan. If truth be told, he made some late payments on his previous loan due to his son’s health problems. He does not have a loan with any other financial institution.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for healing his son

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba K.’s husband is a farmer and together they look after their four children.  Araba has received junior high education.  She cooks wheat into porridge to sell at Abura. 

Araba helps her husband with her sales to provide clothing, food, shelter, and educate her school-going children.  Araba will use the loan to purchase extra wheat to cook and also to get a nicer table. With the new profits from her expanded business, Araba plans to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: purchase extra wheat to cook and get a nicer table

loans.name: Tsongo

texts.en:
U. is a married woman with two children. One child attends school and the other one is preschool age.. Her spouse is a driver by profession and he meets the family basic needs out of his earnings.She has been selling kikoi (fabric), door to door for the last ten years to her neighbors, especially women. U. also does farming and sells maize as another source of income. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. During rainy seasons, it becomes difficult for her to move from one house to another.

U. hopes to own a shop and sell in wholesale. In the future she wants to live in rental house with electricity and piped water.She decided to work with Yehu because it is simple to join with no pressuring of clients in terms of payments. She cites electricity as her greatest monthly expense.

loans.use: To purchase Kikoi fabric for resale

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie L. is from the village of Benhaan, Mambajao, Camiguin. She is 44 years old, married, and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, she runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $150 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Tessie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosa Esmerencia

texts.es:
Rosa de 42 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, rodeada del estero de Guayaquil), ella tiene una tienda pequeña en la parte delantera de su casa. 

Rosa tenia una tienda pequeña donde antes vivía Coop. Paraíso pero como sus ingresos no eran tan buenos decidió ir a vivir a otro lugar y comprar un terreno para construir su casa. Poco a poco comenzó a vender papelería, desde ese tiempo hasta ahora ella trabaja desde las 06:00am hasta las 22:00pm todos los días.   

Para surtir mas su tienda ella quiere comprar con el préstamo una vitrina, papelería, portarretratos, etc. En el futuro quiere arreglar su negocio, y su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa, 42, lives in on the outskirts of Guayaquil (a semi-urban zone surrounded by the Guayaquil swamp). She has a small shop at the front of her house. Rosa used to have a small shop where she used to live in Coop. Paraíso but as her earnings weren't very good she decided to live in another location and purchase a plot of land to build her house. Little by little Rosa began selling stationery, and from this time until now she has worked from 6am until 10pm every day. To stock her shop more Rosa wants to buy a glass display cabinet, stationery, photo frames etc. In the future she wants to repair her shop and house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a display cabinet and stationery

loans.name: Mujeres Adelante Al Progreso 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Julia is the coordinator of her group Mujeres adelante al Progreso 3 & 4 (Forward to the progress women). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and 3 children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to work hard to help her family (her children and husband).  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying cooking for them.

Julia is excited to be taking her 7th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for over 4 years, starting with her first loan in Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying flour, oil, chicken, some vegetables and other meat. She has a fried food stand. She will use the profits to invest in her business, and for the future she is planning to have her home and a restaurant.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us because she needed money to invest in her business and her  story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in San Pedro D. Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activities are a free traD. zone, a cement factory, and others. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, flour, oil, etc.

loans.name: Similie

texts.en:
Similie M. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Similie owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing mechanical services like repair to local community members. Similie has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Similie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Similie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. Similie is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Similie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a mother of three children who go to school.  She is a 32-year-old member of Blessed Kawaida group, registered under Faulu Kenya where she saves her money.  Since 2007, she has been selling charcoal together with her husband.  Besides, she runs a grocery store.  She has requested a loan of 50,000 KES which she will use to add to her stock of charcoal.  She sees herself owning real estate in the future.

loans.use: To add to her stock of charcoal

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es: Teofilo, de 37 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su esposa Janeth de 30 años, y sus 2 pequeños hijos menores que estudian en el colegio, juntos y con muchas ganas de salir adelante habitan en un populoso barrio ubicado al norte de la ciudad. Cada día es una lucha constante para salir adelante en la vida de este trabajador hombre. Y desde hace 2 años, se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi, y afirma que le gusta mucho su labor pues el tiempo le ha permitido adquirir clientes fijos que lo llaman cuando necesitan que los movilice, esto le permite obtener buenas ganancias seguras. Trabaja por las calles de la ciudad de día, pues el horario nocturno no le agrada mucho,  ya que es algo peligroso, y como el auto es propio no tiene inconvenientes para establecer sus horarios y su ruta. Además paralelamente a esta labor, también tiene una tienda de venta de discos en un gran emporio comercial de la ciudad, y con la ayuda de un empleado atiende el negocio, pues le genera regulares ganancias. Así transcurren los días de este hombre, siempre en busca del bienestar de su familia, y como siempre piensa en el futuro, tiene planeado ampliar su tienda de venta de discos y adquirir un puesto propio, pues el actual  es alquilado. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete cumplir puntualmente con sus cuotas ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este préstamo que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Teofilo tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de discos para abastecer mejor su negocio, además una parte también la destinará en brindar mantenimiento a su auto, pues en los últimas semanas ha presentado algunas averías.
texts.en:
Teofilo, age 37, lives in his own home with his wife Janeth, age 30, and their 2 small children who are in school. They live together in a densely populated neighbourhood in the north of the city, and have a great desire to get ahead. Every day is a constant fight to get ahead in life for this hard-working man. For 2 years, he has offered a taxi service. He says that he likes this work very much, and the time he has spent in this work has allowed him to acquire loyal customers who call him when they need to go somewhere. This has allowed him to have a steady income. He works in the streets of the city in the daytime, but he does not like the night schedule much, since it is dangerous. Since the car is his own, he has no problems setting his schedule and his route. Along with this job, he also has a store in a large commercial centre where he sells cds. He is helped by an employee who tends to the business, and it generates him regular income. This is how his days go by, always looking out for his family's well-being. He is always thinking of the future. He plans to expand his cd store and acquite his own location, since his current location is rented. This is his first loan with MFP, and he promises to repay his quotas punctually, since he does not want to lose face with the people who have provided the loan that will allow him to continue working in the search of progress. Teofilo plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of cds to better stock his business. Another part will be used for maintenance for his car, since in the last few weeks it has had some breakdowns.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: technical maintenance for his vehicle

loans.name: Felipe Francisco

texts.es: Felipe Francisco B. A. es un ganadero de 34 años de edad y junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos, reside en la comunidad de Las Minas, Dulce Nombre de Culmi, Olancho.  Don Felipe se dedica a la ganadería desde que era un niño, y aprendió este oficio de su padre. Actualmente Felipe cría ganado de leche y tiene su propio establecimiento donde la vende, además produce otros productos como queso y mantequilla. Una de las dificultades que enfrenta es que en temporada lluviosa aumenta la producción de leche en la región y los precios de los productos bajan por el exceso de oferta y eso hace que sus ganancias disminuyan; pero su ventaja es que puede destazar algunos de esos animales y vender su carne. El préstamo solicitado lo necesita para comprar terneros de cría y espera que con financiamiento pueda aumentar el número de su ganado lechero, y tener más ganancias para seguir sosteniendo a su familia y apoyando a sus hijos en el estudio. Es su primer ciclo en FAMA y espera cumplir con el  pago puntual de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Felipe Francisco B. A. is a cattle farmer, 34 years old, and together with his wife and their three children he lives in the community of Las Minas, Dulce Nombre de Culmi in Olancho. Felipe has been a cattle farmer since he was a boy, having learned the trade from his father. Felipe raises milking cows and he has his own establishment from where he makes his sales, he also makes other products such as cheese and butter. One of the difficulties he faces is the rainy season when the milk production in the region increases and the price of the products drops for the abundance and this decreases his earnings. But to his advantage is that he is able to sell some of his livestock for meat. The loan he requests is to purchase calves to increase his herd of milk cows and improve his earnings, to still be able to support his family and his kids that are in school. This is his first loan cycle with FAMA (Kiva Field Partner) and he is committed to the payment terms.

loans.use: To purchase livestock.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en: Armine K. is married and lives with her mother-in-law. Both Armine and her husband are university graduates, but as they were unable to find a job in their fields, they have started their own business. Armine has been in the clothing trade business since 2004. Her husband helps her by taking care of the bookkeeping. Armine has applied for the loan to purchase autumn clothing stock.

loans.use: Purchasing autumn clothing stock

loans.name: Jovens

texts.en:
Jovens B. is from the city of Labo Ozamiz City. He is 31 years old. Jovens is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Jovens owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a tricycle transport services. Jovens has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jovens joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovens is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jovens from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: María Elvidia

texts.es: María Elvidia C. D. C. D. 60 años D. edad, vive junto a su hijo menor D. 16 años D. edad, y junto a un nieto D. 4 años D. edad. Ella resiD. con su familia en Santa Tecla, en el departamento D. La Libertad. Para salir adelante y D. esta forma contar con todo lo necesario para vivir, María posee una venta D. sandalias para hombre, mujeres y niños, las cuales comercializa en el mercado D. Santa Tecla, en donD. desD. hace dos años realiza esta actividad. Ella es madre soltera y debe sacar adelante a su hijo y nieto, por lo que solicita un préstamo con el enorme deseo D. invertir en su venta, comprando mayor cantidad D. sandalias en diferentes estilos, D. manera que llame la atención D. más clientes y así mejorar sus ganancias lo cual es objetivo principal.
texts.en:
María Elvidia C. D. C. is 60 years old and lives with her 16-year old son and her 4-year old grandson. They live in Santa Tecla, in La Libertad department. So that she can make progress in life and proviD. the basics for her family, María has a stall in the Santa Tecla market selling sandals for men, women, and children. She’s been doing this work for two years.

María is a single mother and needs to support her son and grandson. For this reason she is seeking a loan to buy a greater number of sandals in different styles so that more customers will be attracted to her stall. This way she will fulfill her main objective: to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy sandals for her stall

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Phen

texts.en:
Phen S., 38, is married and lives with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. 

S. sells used clothes, earning an income of about USD 15 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of USD 0.5 per day. S. spends USD 35 on food, USD 5 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 30 on other necessary expenses every month.  

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more used clothes to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy used clothes to resell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina B. is from the village of Cabisera 25, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 38 years old. Gina is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Gina plants and harvests corn for sale. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2007, Gina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Gina is requesting a new loan of 29,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Gina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: Gladis tiene 57 años de edad, es socia de la Alcancía Comunal “Nueva Esperanza” es casada y tiene 4 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, pero se hace cargo de un nieto suyo como si fuera su hijo  el cual tiene 12 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de desayuno como ambulante además de eso prepara dulces para las distintas fechas de fiestas como: chocolates, mazamorra, gelatina y turrones, con los ingresos de su pequeño negocio ayuda a cubrir los gastos de su casa y los estudios de su menor hijo. Ella solicitó el préstamo a EDAPROSPO para comprar  un exprimidor  y un pelador de naranjas para poder vender jugo de naranjas durante el verano. En la foto podemos apreciar que las socias están contentas en compañía de sus hijos.
texts.en: Gladis is 57 years old and a member of the “Nueva Esperanza” ["New Hope"] communal bank. She is married and has four grown children. She is also in charge of a 12 year-old grandson who is like her own son. Gladis sells breakfasts in an ambulatory manner, and she also prepares sweets for the various holidays. She prepares sweets like chocolates, mazamorra [corn pudding], gelatin, and nougat. With the income from her small business, she helps cover her family's household expenses and helps send her youngest son to school. She is requesting this loan through EDAPROSPO in order to buy a juicer and an orange peeler so that she can sell orange juice during the summer. In the photo above, we can see how happy the members of this group are in the company of their children.

loans.use: to buy a juicer and an orange peeler

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: She wants to make her beauty salon larger

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita G. is from the village of Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 38 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Lita owns and operates a business providing rice processing to local community members. Lita has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Lita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Lita is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Lita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand

location.town: Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome L. is from the town of Banga. She is 52 years old, married and has 9 children. Salome owns & operates an agricultural business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. She hopes that her harvest will increase.

Salome joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Salome is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. This will be her second loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to support her family.

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Hoeun

texts.en: Hoeun K. is 48 years old, married, and has five children.  She owns a small shop in the local market where she sells food, plastic products, and other items for people who come to buy things in the market. She typically earns $3 a day, which is used to meet her family's needs. Her husband is a taxi driver around the village in Battambong province. Presently, his motorbike is broken. Hoeun K. does not have enough money to help her husband purchase a new one. Therefore, she is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase a secondhand motorbike to replace the broken one. With this loan, her husband can continue with his motor taxi service.

loans.use: To purchase a secondhand motorbike

loans.name: Esperance

texts.fr: Esperance M. a un restaurant, et elle est client d’ACB depuis 2010.  Elle est mariée, née au Burundi, et elle a 7 enfants entre 8 ans et 22 ans, et une personne en charge.  Tous ses enfants vont à l’école, et Esperance a fini 6 ans d’école secondaire (au niveau A2).  Ce prêt est son premier cycle avec ACB, et elle va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat d’un frigo, 2 douzaines d’assiettes, 4 chauffes, et 30 gobelets pour son business de restaurant.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’améliorer la capacité de l’affaire, en augmentant la quantité, ainsi que la qualité de son business.  Elle voudrait devenir une grande femme d’affaire, et bâtir sa propre maison commerciale.  Elle veut aussi assurer le bien-être de sa famille, et payer les frais d’études pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
