Esperance M. has a restaurant and is a member of ACB since 2010. Born in Burundi, she is married with seven children ranging in age from 8 to 22 years old. She also has another person in her care. Esperance completed six years of secondary school (A2 level) and all her children attend school. 

This is her first loan cycle with ACB, and she plans to use the credit to buy a refrigerator, two dozen plates, four hot plates, and thirty cups for her restaurant. Her business growth strategy is to bolster her activity by improving both in volume and quality. 

She wishes to become a great businesswoman, and build her own commercial property. She also wants to ensure her family’s well-being and pay for her children’s tuition.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, two dozen plates, four hot plates and thirty cups for her business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a widow with two children, both of whom are married. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mariam has been operating a retail shop business for the past five years, selling to her neighbours and friends. Her major challenge in the business is theft because of insecurity in the area. She dreams of becoming a wholesaler in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase six bundles of wheat flour, sacks of tomatoes and fish for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: purchase wheat flour, tomatoes and fish to resell

loans.name: Yhonni

texts.es: El señor Yhonni trabaja con su movilidad, es taxista independiente y esta actividad es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener  a su familia. El crédito lo necesita para la compra de llantas nuevas para su movilidad. Es casado tiene un hijo y vive en alquiler ubicada en la zona de las San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz. El cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos que se le otorgaron ya que pudo mejorar la calidad e vida de su familia. Ya obtuvo un crédito anterior a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Yhonni is an independent taxi driver; he uses his own car.  This activity is his source of income to support his family.  He needs the loan to buy new tires for his car.  He’s married and has a son.  He lives in a rented unit located in La Paz’s San Martin zone.  He is very satisfied with the loans he’s been granted in that they allowed him to improve his family’s quality of life.  He has had a previous Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy tires for his taxi.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph G. W. is a married man. His wife stays at home to take care of the household chores while Joseph goes out everyday to run their charcoal business. They have two children, aged twenty years old and eighteen years old. They hope to give their children a good education to the university level. 

Joseph's business is located at South B estate in Nairobi and he is served by the Kitengela branch. He runs a charcoal business and sells to the local people. He has been in this business for eleven years now. He says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge he has is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of KES 50,000 to add stock of charcoal to grow his business and to meet the demand of his customers. He sees himself becoming the next charcoal supplier in South B. In the future, he hopes to build rental houses. He describes himself as hardworking, honest and punctual.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: Hugo, es natural de la ciudad de San Francisco, tiene 32 años de edad es un hombre alegre y trabajador con ganas de triunfar en la vida, vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es obtener mejores ingresos para así darle una estabilidad económica a su futura familia. Hugo, es un joven centrado en sus responsabilices y trabaja con mucho esmero para sobresalir adelante con sus plantas de cacao, café achiote, las cuales después de cosecharlos los lleva a vender hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, en donde ya tiene diversos compradores, que sabiendo de la calidad de su producto no dudan en esperarlo para comprarle todos lo que cosechó. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles y productivas, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus chacras de la plaga, ya que tiene que hacerlo con mucho cuidado por que los productos químicos causan reacciones y teme por su salud posteriormente. En adelante, espera seguir ahorrando sus ingresos por lo que desea comprar nuevas tierras. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. Agradece a la institución por concederle el préstamo. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, contratará jornaleros para que lo apoyen en el mantenimiento respectivo de sus cultivos como: la poda, el desmonte y la fumigación.
texts.en:
Hugo is from San Francisco he is 32 years old.  He is a happy man and a hard worker who wants to succeed in life. He lives in his own home and what he most wants is to get better income to provide economic stability for his future family.  

Huge is a young man focused on his responsibilities and his job. He works very hard to get ahead with his cocoa plants and coffee achiote, which after harvesting takes them to sell to the city of San Francisco.  This is where he already has several buyers who knowing the quality of his product do not hesitate to wait to buy all that is harvested.  

What he most enjoys about his work is planting and making his land productive and fertile.  He has been doing this work for 10 years and believes that hardest part is spraying the fields to get rid of pests and that he has to be careful because the chemicals can cause reactions and he fears for their long-term health.  

In the future he hopes to continue saving so that he can buy new land.  This is his first loan with MFP, he knows that this opportunity will be very beneficial for developing his work.  He thanks the institution for granting the loan.  With the 2,000 soles, he will hire laborers to help him maintain their respective crops such as pruning, clearing and fumigation.

loans.use: To hire laborers that will assist him in pruning plants, pulling weeds, and spraying.

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es: Aydee tiene 35 años, vive en compañía de su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Hace más de 3 años posee una ferretería, instalada en una parte de su casa. Ella considera muy favorable tener éste negocio, ya que en su zona hay muchas casas se están construyendo y por tal demandan de materiales para ser edificados. Es así que todos los días atiende su establecimiento y esta pendiente de las necesidades de sus clientes, ya sea en los diversos materiales de instalaciones eléctricas, así como de agua y desagüe, que son los que más vende. Su esposo, es quien más la ayuda en el trabajo, él se encarga de comprar al por mayor estos materiales, pero al mismo tiempo se dedica también en la agricultura, cultivando papa y maíz sobre terrenos que le fue heredado, por lo que significa un ingreso extra más para el hogar. Para Aydeee, la venta de artículos ferreteros es muy rentable por lo que desea en adelante implementar su tienda con más mercadería y que sea de calidad, por ello pide de su apoyo para que pueda concretar su anhelo y así mejorar su calidad de vida de ella y de su familia. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, en esta ocasión trabaja de manera individual y agradece por la oportunidad de acceder a un crédito en su primer momento que le ha servido para mejorar su negocio, se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos en este nuevo ciclo de crédito. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más mercadería para su ferretería en tuberías de diversas medidas y fierros de construcción.
texts.en:
Aydee, 35, lives with her husband and two children.  She’s had a hardware store for over three years installed in part of her house.  She considers having this business as being very favorable because in her area there are a lot of houses under construction so demand for building materials is high.

She, therefore, tends to her establishment daily and is always aware of her customers’ needs be they in electrical installations or plumbing and drainage which are what sell the most.  Her husband, who is her greatest help at work, takes care of buying materials at wholesale but he’s also a potato and corn farmer on land passed down to him which means extra income for the home.

For Aydee, sale of hardware is very profitable so she wants to stock her store with more merchandise later on that is of good quality.  Because of this she’s asking for support so that she can reach her goal and improve her and her family’s quality of life.

This is her second loan with MFP.  On this occasion, she’s taking out an individual loan and she is grateful for the opportunity to access a loan at the first moment that has served to improve her business.  She commits to be punctual with her repayments in this new loan cycle.  She will use the requested loan to buy more merchandise for the hardware store: various size pipes and metal building items.

loans.use: to buy various size pipes and metal construction supplies.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is 47 years old. She sell lotus fruit with her husband, and they get $4 per day. They have three children, 14, 12, and 8 years old. Two are working as construction workers and one is studying. 

Every month, she has to spend $85 on food, $5 on electricity and $20 on the school fees of her child. 

She explains that growing lotus fruit requires water to support it, but it is hard for her to carry the water to fill in her lotus farm, so a pump machine is the only way to help her. Because she doesn’t have enough money, she would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a pump machine to make this career run well. She plans to enlarge her career if she can get it to run successfully.

loans.use: To buy a pump machine

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en:
Fidel is 35 years old, married, and has two children ages 3 and 7. He sells charcoal, timber, frames, firewood, basins, and tyres to local people in a busy area of town. Fidel has been running this business for 3 years and employs one person. Fidel hopes to use his loan to purchase more timber and machines for cutting timber. 

Fidel hopes to expand his business by opening a timber yard. He also hopes to pay for his children’s education using the proceeds from his business. Fidel describes himself as humble and spiritual.

loans.use: to purchase more timber and machines for cutting timber

loans.name: Mam

texts.en: Mam is a sixty-one-year old who lives in the Baray district of Kompong Tom Province. She has been working in a farming business since she was young. She and her husband help one another to support their whole family and to feed their kids. The couple has two married children living separately who are employed in different occupations, while the others are school-aged. Mam is currently requesting a loan to purchase rice seed to plant and a pumping machine to pump water into her farm field.

loans.use: to purchase rice seed to plant and a pumping machine to pump water into her farm field.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita  tiene 35 años de edad, está casada, tiene tres hijos menores, vive en su propia casa, en la Ciudad de Caacupé.
La misma se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir y calzados en general. Por medio de este trabajo ella ha logrado generar un poco más de ingresos, con lo que ayuda a su marido. Ella está feliz ya que por medio de su trabajo puede ayudar a su familia y de esa forma ofrecerles un mejor estilo de vida. Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos sigan una carrera universitaria y así se conviertan en buenos profesionales. Quiere, algún día poder tener una tienda donde poder ofrecer sus productos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de temporadas, para satisfacer la demanda de su clientela, esto le permitirá obtener más ingresos a su unidad familiar.
texts.en:
Margarita is 35 years old, married, and has three young children. She lives in her own house in the city of Caacupé.
She works selling clothes and shoes. By means of this work, she has been able to generate a little more income with which she helps her husband. She is happy that, by working, she can help her family and offer them a better quality of life. 
Her greatest dream is that her children will go to the university and become good professionals. One day, she wants to have a store where she can sell her products. 
She is requesting a loan to puy seasonal clothes to supply the demand from her customers. This will enable her to gain more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy seasonal apparel.

loans.name: Wael

texts.en:
Wael is a 28-year-old married man, a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Wael wants to purchase a new kitchen table and chairs, a fridge and a washing machine but with the salary he earns, he will not be able to pay for the mentioned items so he needs to take a loan from FATEN.

By getting FATEN's loan,which is repaid on a monthly basis, Wael can  easily pay the price of the items and will meet the family needs and live in better, more healthy home conditions.

Wael is photographed in FATEN's branch office. 

About this loan product:

 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. 

The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture, a fridge and a washing machine.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina, de 24 años, es una mujer luchadora. Su familia lo conforman, su esposo Denis y sus 3 hijos, a quienes ama. Juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en comunidad de Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). En todo este tiempo de casada, ella se dedicó a varias actividades, hace poco cerró su negocio de carpintería por problemas económico. Pero con el esfuerzo conjunto de su familia, está segura que muy pronto abrirán. Ahora ella se dedica al negocio de embolsado de plantitas de café, con el que se realiza germinados en los viveros para el trasplantado de los cafetales malogrados, logrando vender en sus mejores días, mil plantitas de café. Asimismo su esposo Denis, se dedica a la agricultura junto con ella, hace ya 8 años; sus principales sembríos constan de café, plátanos y palta; vendiendo el grano de café en la ciudad de Villa Rica. Según cuenta este año, obtuvo buenas ganancias en la comercialización de los granos, pues el incremento del precio de venta en el mercado es muy bueno; por eso está trabajando duro para aprovechar la subida. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Prestatarios de unión palomar” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde asegura podrá salir adelante con el trabajo duro y el apoyo financiero de todos ustedes. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Dina de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales, semilla de café y bolsas para comenzar con el germinado de café, que muy pronto realizará.
texts.en: Dina, 24, is a fighting woman.  Her family consists of her husband, Denis, and their 3 children, whom they adore.  They live in their own house in the Unión Palomar community (central Peruvian jungle).  Since she’s been married she has done several types of jobs.  A little while ago she  closed the carpentry business because of money problems.  But with family effort, she is sure that soon it will reopen.  Now she sells  coffee plants that she grows in the greenhouses to transplant in the coffee fields.   She is able to sell, on her best days, 1000 coffee seedlings.  Her husband, Denis, has also farmed with her for the past 8 years.  Their main crops are coffee, bananas, and avodados, selling  the coffee beans in Villa Rica.  As she tells us, this year she had the best income from the coffee bean sales because the increase in price in the market is very good.  That’s why she is working hard to take advantage of the increase.  She belongs to the communal bank “Prestatarios de Unión Palomar  and this is her second loan with MFP.  She is sure that she will get ahead with hard work and the financial support of all of you.  She also promises to be punctual with her payments.  She will use the money requested to buy natural fertilizers, coffee seeds and sacks to begin growing the coffee that she will soon start.

loans.use: To buy coffee beans, fertiizer and bags.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies and to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Zenaida Yessenia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres De Lucha se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a La señora Zenaida Tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 3 hijos de 20, 15 y 11 años los mismos que estudian en Universidad, colegio y escuela, todos aun  viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y también artículos de plástico. Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres días a la semana más que todo por las mañanas ya que a estas horas sus hijos están en clases además porque a esas horas el día es más fresco y realiza mejor sus recorridos, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana. Empezó con su negocio hace más de 15 años y siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que cuenta con muchos clientes. 
 
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños y productos plásticos. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal hace 43 ciclos y le gusta por la oportunidad que le dan para acceder a los créditos.
  
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y en un futuro tener un almacén.
texts.en:
The Mujeres de Lucha [Women of Struggle] Communal Bank meets twice a month in the parish of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for being a commercial zone and for its traditional Saint Peter and Saint John festivals and for the happiness of its people.

In this place we meet Zenaida who is 37 years old, married, with 3 children who are 20, 15, and 11 years old who are studying at university and attending schools. They all live with her. Her husband is a businessman. 

She is a great housewife and to earn her own income she sells all types of clothing and plastic articles. She sells from door-to-door working 3 days a week, mostly in the mornings because her children are in school, it’s cooler, and she can make better time. People buy on credit and pay her on the weekends. She began this business more than 15 years ago and she always has done well and she has many clients.

This loan is to buy pants, shirts, blouses, children’s clothing and plastic products. She is a founding member of the communal bank, in its 43rd cycle, and she likes the opportunity that it gives her to borrow money. She dreams of a better future and of having the own store.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses, children’s clothing and plastic products

loans.name: Mean

texts.en:
Mean, 57, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Mean is a farmer, earning an income of $3 USD per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of $4 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $40 USD on food and $50 USD on other necessary expenses. 
Mean is requesting a loan of $300 USD to purchase a new motorbike with a tuk-tuk (auto rickshaw) to improve her husband’s transportation business. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike with a tuk-tuk to improve her husband's  transportation business.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is from the village Vachnadziani, Kakheti Region, East Georgia. He is 37 years old, married and lives with his family: wife – Tea, two daughters (16 and 9 years old) and 62-year-old mother. Both children go to school. 

Davit is the only income provider in the family. He is leading the agricultural business of the family. They grow strawberries and peaches on a family-owned 0.5 hectare plot of the land. Fruits are sold by Davit. Along with the farming activities, Davit is busy with trade as well. He has a minibus and uses it for transportation and sales of greengroceries. The total average monthly income of the family is 900 Laris (approximately 540 USD). 

Davit requested credit to increase his stock in trade. He will purchase more greengrocery products for resale. With a wider assortment, he will attract new clients and increase revenue from sales. Davit plans to save the additional income for his elder daughter’s education as she is entering a high-school next year.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Zama Zama Group

texts.en:
Joyce is a 50-year-old widow whose husband passed away ten years ago. She lives in Gweru with her five children, aged 25, 23, 21, 20 and 16. Three children are still at school. She doesn't have any other dependents.

She is a cross-border trader who has been operating for ten years now. Joyce trades in South Africa and specializes mainly in seat covers and chair backs. The business is mainly affected by changing government regulations, high import duty and transport costs. 

She sees herself opening a shop in Zimbabwe in the next five years and starting other projects.

loans.use: To buy materials to make seat covers and chair backs.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
After his father's death, Ahmad, a 22-year-old guy, was left with a shop to manage with few employees.

The shop is basically a four-room store for selling frozen meat and other food items like cheese, noodles, etc. Although Ahmad is still new in the business himself, he is managing the business in a very good way.

Now Ahmad has applied for a loan because he wants to buy another showing fridge for his store as a way of expanding.

loans.use: to buy another refrigerator for his store

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel has operated his workshop business in Naivasha town for the last 12 years.  He is 47 years old, married to Roda and they have five school going children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of its field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan to buy more timber, nails and seat fabric for his workshop.

In the future, Samuel hopes to open a furniture showroom and become one of the leading furniture traders in Naivasha town.

loans.use: to buy more timber, nails and seat fabric for his workshop.

loans.name: Saruul

texts.en:
Saruul is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia.  Her husband is a production manager of a small factory and their two kids are school students. 

She started her beverage wholesale business in 2008 by renting a container in the market. Her business district's population is increasing rapidly, therefore she needs to sell a broad range of products and has to have more supplies in order keep up in the market. She is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to buy more juice.

loans.use: To buy more juice to sell

loans.name: Martha Rosa

texts.es: Doña Martha, es habitante del municipio de Nindirí, junto a su esposo e hijos, ella es una pequeña agricultora de piña , la mayor afectación que se le presento fue la enfermedad de su esposo , ya que estuvo hospitalizado por dos meses y el cultivo quedo solo , sin limpieza , ni fertilizantes , ni cuidos , lo cual provoco que gran parte de la producción se perdiera , ahora ella quiere renovar el cultivo y salir adelante ; pero las condiciones económicas no se lo permiten , pero ella se siente muy contenta por el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atravez de los fondo ya que con el dinero que se le beneficie va a comprar , urea, hijos de piña, exfoliantes, herbicidas y otros productos para proteger el cultivo .
texts.en:
Martha lives in the Nindirí municipality with her husband and children. She is a pineapple grower on a small scale. 

The greatest concern that has arisen was her husband's illness, as he was hospitalized for two months, and the crop was left on its own, without clearing, or fertilizing, or being looked after, which caused a large part of the production to be lost. 

Now she wants to renew the crop and move forward; but her financial situation does not allow her to do so. So she is very happy about the support that Afodenic is providing her through the loan. 

With the money granted her, she is going to buy urea, pineapple plants, exfoliants, herbicides, and other products to protect her crop.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Ankadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  six membres du groupe  ANKADI sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles polygamiques à SANOUBOUGOU I,  un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame  AWA  debout en deuxième position à partir de la droite fait le commerce de colliers en perles.
Elle compte investir tout son prêt, une grandes variété de perles avec lesquelles elle fera des colliers  qui seront revendus à la maison et au grand marché de Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The six  members of the  Ankadi group are all married women averaging  39 years of age with  five children. They live mainly in polygamous families in Sanoubougou I, a working class district of the town of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali). They are on their fourth loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the goal of meeting customer demand.

Mrs. Awa, the second one standing from left to right, sells pearl necklaces.   She plans to use her loan to purchase  a large variety of pearls from which she will make necklaces to be sold out of her home, at the big market of Sikasso as well as in customers’ homes, mainly  to female customers, for cash.
She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 30,000 West African francs, a part of which will be used to repay her loan with interest and the rest put away as savings. Her goal is to increase her sales volume and better meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy pearls

loans.name: Sop Ch Serigne Mokhtar Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité Sop Serigne Mokhtar est créé le 29 mars 2008, il est composé de huit femmes qui habitent le même village et l'embouche est leur activité principale.

Madame Awa la responsable est âgée de 39 ans, femme mariée elle est mère de six enfants et mène une activité d'embouche et a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.Sur la photo elle est debout à droite habillée en tissu wax marron blanc avec un châle bleu sur les épaules.


Elle achéte des béliers maigres qu'elle engraisse et revend à l'approche des remboursements de ses prêts.

Son prêt lui servira à acheter des béliers pour renforcer davantage son activité.

Elle aide son mari pour l'entretien de la famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Serigne Mokhtar was created on March 29th, 2008. The group is composed of eight women who live in the same village and share the fattening of livestock as their main business.

Awa, the person in charge, is a 39-year-old married woman as well as the mother of six children. She manages a livestock fattening business, and has had a good track-record in this domain.

In the photo, Awa is standing on the right dressed in brown & white wax [pagne cloth] with the blue shawl over her shoulders. She purchases skinny rams, which she then fattens and resells before her loan repayments. 

Her loan will allow her to buy rams in order to continue to strengthen her business. She helps her husband to support their family.

loans.use: to purchase sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is 21 years old and single. She sells foodstuffs, and she has requested the loan to buy more foodstuffs to sell. With the profits, she will reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Isabel Robertina

texts.es: La Sra. Isabel es una cliente que pertenece al Banco de Emprendimiento TUNKA  de la institución ella tiene cuatro hijos 2 de ellos se encuentran en la  Universidad, 1 en el colegio y el otro en casa , la señora Isabel se dedica a hacer prendas a pedido y también ella confecciona, vive en la zona de Villa Victoria en la casa de su suegro, pero se trasladaran muy pronto ya que están acabando de construir su casa, su negocio se encuentra en la zona de Achumani muy lejos de su domicilio, por tal  motivo la Sra. Isabel se levanta muy temprano para hacer los que aceres de la casa y luego trasladarse a su negocio,   el crédito que esta solicitando es para la compra de telas e hilos ya que en esta época hay mucho movimiento y necesita confeccionar prendas al por mayor y así de esta manera poder incrementar su capital ya que sus clientes le hacen pedidos y tiene trabajo que entregar.
texts.en:
Isabel is a client of the institution and member of the communal bank "TUNKA".  She has four children, two of which are in college, one in school, and the other at home.  Isabel sews on an order basis and also makes her own designs.  She lives in the Villa Victoria area in her father-in-law's home, but as soon as her house is finished they will be moving.  Her business is located in the Achumani area, quite a distance from where she lives.  Therefore Isabel gets up very early to do her housework before going off to work.  

She is requesting a loan to buy fabric and thread because there is much demand during this time of year and she will begin sewing wholesale garments.  This will allow her to increase her capital for the orders her customers have already placed and which she must deliver.

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread to make clothes.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José es un joven de 19 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus padres e hijos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar para apoyar a sus padres y solventar sus gastos, José no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Gastronomía, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música para relajarse y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Seco de Res para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día José trabaja brindando atención al público en un restaurante de su ciudad, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su empeño y por  el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
José se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de medicinas que necesita para calmar las dolencias y mejorar la salud de su Madre, ya que hace muy poco tiempo ella sufrió un penoso accidente, así pues José seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante y desea poder cumplir si gran sueño de tener su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
José is nineteen years old and unmarried. He lives in the city of Nazca with his parents and siblings. 

He is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to succeed. Unfortunately, due to the need to work to support his parents and cover expenses, José was not able to study a professional career to become a chef, as he would have liked.

In his free time, he likes to listen to music to relax, and he occasionally cooks a delicious Seco de Res (a Peruvian beef stew) to share with his family.

With plenty of effort and dedication, José works day in and day out serving customers at a restaurant in his city. Starting in the early morning, he works for about 8 hours per day. He feels comfortable in his job, and he believes that it is going well because of his effort and the friendly service he gives customers.

José is very grateful for the Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help he will be able to buy the necessary medications to calm his mother's ailments and improve her health, as she suffered a painful accident very recently. José will continue working and striving to succeed. He hopes to make his greatest dream come true by having his own restaurant.

loans.use: to buy the medications his mother needs.

loans.name: Kokoe Philomène

texts.en:
Manager of a cafe, Madam Philomène Kokoe A. was born in 1954 at Aného (P/Lacs). She manages her own shop at Tabligbo. Widowed with four dependant children, Philomène succeeds well to manage her shop. Very active and dynamic, she masteries well all the aspects of her trade. Despite her solitude, she is always friendly and shows good character. Philomène is a woman full of confidence in whom, and we are certain will use the credit wisely and ensure its prompt repayment. The credit of $ 850 she is requesting will serve to supply her shop with general food produces (milk, tomatoes, beauty products, beer etc). The end result of this project will provide her a substantial income allowing her to improve the family well-being and assure the education of the three orphaned children.

Translated from French by Farron BLANC

Gérante d’une buvette, Madame A. Kokoe Philomène est née en 1954 à Aného (P/Lacs). Elle gère sa propre boutique à Tabligbo. Veuve avec quatre (04) enfants à charge, Philomène arrive bien à gérer sa boutique. Très active et dynamique, elle maîtrise bien tous les aspects de son commerce. Malgré sa solitude, elle est toujours accueillante et jouit d’une bonne moralité. Philomène est une femme pleine de confiance en qui, l’on doit faire confiance pour une utilisation saine du crédit et s’assurer de son prompt remboursement. Le crédit de $ 850 qu’elle sollicite servira à approvisionner sa boutique de produits d’alimentation générale (lait, tomates, les produits de beauté, les bières etc.). La parfaite réalisation de ce projet pourra lui procurera un revenu substantiel lui permettant d’améliorer le bien-être de la famille et assurer la scolarisation des trois enfants orphelins.

loans.use: to supply her shop with general food produces

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a place for her food vending business

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice started her business in 2005.  She sells manufactured goods.  She has not undertaken any formal training. She is an active member of her community’s H.I.V/AIDS awareness campaign. Through her business, she has brought services closer to the community as well as been an inspiration to others in her area. With a loan from PEMCI, she plans to increase her shop’s stock and be able to provide a variety of goods to her customers.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Adalinda

texts.en:
Business Description

Adalinda is a schoolteacher. Her sister put Analinda in charge of her own store. Little by little, she started saving and set up a business of miscellaneous items. She works every day from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m.

Loan Use

She will invest the loan in purchasing goods for supplying her location. She already has orders from people in the area.

Personal Information

Adalinda is a single mother. She is 32 and a has a 6 year old son that is currently attending school. Her little house is made of cane. Thanks to her hard work, she has been able to start building a cane fence in order to give it more security. She is hoping to save money and provide a better environment for her business to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Adalinda es maestra de escuela. Su hermana tiene una tienda la que le dio a ella para que la administre. Poco a poco fue ahorrando y puso un local de artículos varios. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 7 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de mercadería para surtir su local. Ya que tiene pedidos de gente del sector.

Información Personal

Adalinda es madre soltera. Tiene 32 años. Y un hijo de seis que estudia. Su casita es de caña. Ella gracias a su trabajo ha podido irle haciendo un cercado de caña y de esta manera darle seguridad. Espera poder ahorrar y darle un mejor ambiente donde crezca.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Ferolini

texts.en: Ferolini is a 31 year old married woman of Falevao who runs a retail shop at Falevao. Her retail shop is a product of the assistance that SPBD gives women like herself from across S.. She now reaps the fruits of this assistance and she hopes to continue utilising this assistance as needed. Her family now has another source of income that can assist not just with the needs of the family members, but more so for meeting the church and village obligations which they need to provide as members of this village community.

loans.use: To restock her shop and for school fees

loans.name: I Wayan Yudi Cahyana

texts.id:
Yudi Cahyana likes to participate in counseling sessions in his village. From those sessions, he knows how to raise cow so that it grows fast. He found it very interesting and decided to raise Kereman cow (cow which is raised in the barn). For the initial capital, he borrowed money from Dinari. He bought 2 male cows that cost Rp. 2,500,000 (about $276). The rest of the loan was used to built the barn for the cow and to purchase cow food for 4 months. He feeds the cow twice a day, in the morning and in the evening. In the afternoon, he feeds the cows with grass and leaves as supplements. He bought food concentrate from the merchants in his village. The food concentrate cost Rp. 1,500 (about $0.16) per kg. The Kereman cow is given 1 kg food concentrate with sugar cane liquid, salt, and some water. After 4 months passes, the cow with 400 kg of weight can be sold for Rp. 16,500 (about $1.8) per kg. With this business, Yudi Cahyana hopes to improve his quality of life.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Yudi Cahyana rajin mengikuti penyuluhan-penyuluhan yang diadakan di desanya. Dari situlah Yudi Cahyana tahu bagaimana cara memelihara sapi yang cepat menghasilkan dan mudah memeliharanya. Yudi Cahyana tertarik dan memutuskan untuk pelihara sapi Kereman ( sapi yang dikandangkan ). Untuk modal, Yudi Cahyana meminjam dari Dinari sebagai modal awal untuk mencoba menerapkan ilmu yang diperolehnya. Yudi Cahyana membeli 2 sapi pejantan yang sudah cukup besar dengan harga Rp. 2.500.000,- Sisa modalnya dipergunakan untuk membuat kandang sapi dan untuk modal pakan selama 4 bulan. Setiap hari Yudi Cahyana memberi makan 2 kali setiap pagi dan sore. Untuk siang hari diberi hijauan sebagai makanan tambahan. Yudi Cahyana membeli konsentrat di pedagang yang ada didesanya. Per kg harganya Rp.1500,-. Sapi kereman diberi makan 1 kg konsentrat dicampur tetes tebu ( cairan dari pembuatan gula ) dan garam, lalu diisi air secukupnya. Setelah 4 bulan sapi bisa dijual dengan berat sapinya mencapai 400 kg dengan harga per kilo Rp.16.500,-. Dengan usaha beternak sapi yang ditekuninya sekarang, Yudi Cahyana berharap akan semakin meningkat kesejahteraan hidupnya.

loans.use: To purchase cow, cow food, and to build better barn

loans.name: Braulia

texts.es:
Mrs. Braulia G. de Gayoso is 38 years of age and is married to Mr. Hugo Gayoso. Together they have two school age children: a boy and a girl.

They own a shop in the Municipal Market of San Lorenzo, where they have been selling clothing such as sweaters, shirts, pants, and children’s apparel for the past 14 years.

Braulia would like a loan for the summer season in order to buy a greater amount of merchandise such as tank tops, sweaters, shorts, and skirts so that she may meet her customer’s demands.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Braulia G. de Gayoso tiene 38 años, esta casada con Don Hugo Gayoso, tienen dos hijos, un varón y una nena menores en edad escolar.

Hace 14 años poseen un puesto en el Mercado Municipal de San Lorenzo donde se dedican a la venta de ropas como remeras, camisas, pantalones, ropas para niños, etc.

Braulia desea adquirir el crédito ya que en esta temporada de verano desea comprar mercaderías en grandes cantidades como camisillas, remeras, shorts y faldas para poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes

loans.use: Purchase of sweaters, shorts, tank tops, skirts, etc.

loans.name: Nansana West I B(Ii) B Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Harrisa is divorced with six children. She has a retail shop and mainly sells household items. With the extra business profits, she wants to pay school fees for the children and to provide other necessities like food and medicine.

loans.use: To add stock in her shop

loans.name: Mursati

texts.en: Mursati, a 51 year old widow whose husband passed away a long time ago. She has to work by herself to support her family and needs to sell cosmetics and snacks door to door, earning $10 a week with very small profit. She is a member of MBK and now is asking for a loan of $175 to add to her business capital so she could earn more income for her family. She agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria lives on the outskirts of the capital of Santo Domingo in the Dominican Republic. She sells mobile phones, and has applied for this loan so that she can expand her inventory of cell phones, prepaid phone cards, and phone products. Because mobile phones and mobile phone products are expensive, she is looking forward to taking this loan out and being able to invest in her business on a greater scale.

Her dream is to continue growing her business every day, and to be able to support her children and their families with some of the extra income she earns. She also says that she hopes to live for many more years, and continue to grow as a business woman, mother, grandmother, and person.

In her free time, Gloria loves to read the Bible and spend time with her family. On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, thank you for your interest and time in supporting Gloria!

loans.use: Purchase cell phones, prepaid phone cards and phone accessories

loans.name: Leone

texts.en: Leone A., 29, is married and has four children. She has over three  years of experience in growing taro and bananas. Leone sells her produce on Fridays. Her loan will be used to purchase a weed-killing sprayer, pesticides, fertilizer, four bow knives, five filings, and an axe.

loans.use: Purchase of a weed-killing sprayer and pesticides

loans.name: Iris María's Group

texts.en:
Iris María is a well experienced entrepreneur who has been carrying on businesses for more than fifteen years in the San Luis community of Santo Domingo.  She has five children, two of whom live with her.  
Iris María is operating a small store and people of the community visit her regularly to purchase different kinds of goods such as beauty products, perfumes, clothing and the like.
The entrepreneur plans to invest more capital in the business in order to add more varieties to her stock and attract new customers.  She says that at her age, she can walk no more all along the streets, and therefore will be operating the business from her house.
Iris María hopes that her business will allow her maintain a comfortable lifestyle for her family.  Iris will receive the funds with the following entrepreneurs:
Ana Teresa C. L., to purchase beauty products
Clara María C., for a small cafeteria
Yohanna B. C., to buy products for a beauty parlor
Angelica C. P., to buy clothing for her store.
Picture: Left to right: Iris María, Ana Teresa, Clara María, Yohanna B. and Angelica.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of beauty products, clothing and perfumes for a small business.

location.town: San Luis, community of Santo Domingo

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Awa B. is 36 years old, widowed with 3 children in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Colobane Fass in Ziguinchor for 2 and a half years. She has always respected her obligations. She would like to buy oil, salt, and other products to make traditional hand-made soap in Ziguinchor for resale at the weekly market in Yarang. Her income will allow her to support her family. Awa is asking for a loan which will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Awa B., 36 ans, veuve 03 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Colobane Fass à Ziguinchor depuis 2 ans et demi. Elle respecte ses engagements. Elle veut acheter de l'huile, du sel et autres produits pour préparer du savon artisanal à Ziguinchor et revendre au marché hebdomadaire de Yarang. Ses revenus lui permettent d'entretenir sa famille.Awa sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To produce and sell traditional hand-crafted soap

loans.name: Pompilio José

texts.pt:
Pompilio José A. is 38 years old and was born in the province of Zambesia, in the district of Inhassuque. He is married and the father of 4 children aged between 12 and 7, whom he had with 2 different women. The 2 older ones are already in school. Pompilio supports his children and his two wives.

Pompilio completed the 7th grade, after which he had to stop because he was drafted into military service. That is how he left his birthplace in the province of Zambezia and move to the province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique, where he began his family.

Pompilio is now living in his own house. When the peace accord was reached, he was demobilized and now receives a pension. Besides that, he earns some extra money by doing small clothing repairs, which he learned to do in 1999.

Pompilio is not able to save any money and states that his income is far from his needs. This is his second loan with Hluvuku and his first through Kiva. His first loan was for 8,000.00 MT that he used for building materials. He intends to use this second loan for the same purposes. Pompilio’s greatest dream is to have a house to shelter his family with dignity.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer.

Pompilio José A. tem 38 anos de idade, Nasceu na provincia da ZAmbezia distrito de Inhassuque , casado maritalmente e pai de 4 filhos com idade entre 12 anos, 7 anos e dois sendo de mães diferente ambos com três anos. Os dois mais velhos já vão a Escola. Ninguem fora dos filhos e as duas esposas que é sustentado por Pompilio.

Pompilio estudou até 7ªClasse e deixou de continuar por ter ingressado nos serviços militar obrigatório. Desta forma permitiu ao Pompilio sair da Provincia da Zambezia terra natal para provincia do Maputo ao Sul de Moçambique onde veio a constituir a sua familia. Neste momento vive numa casa própria.

Pompilio com acordo geral de paz foi desmobilizado e assim recebe pensão da reforma. Para alem da pensão faz pequenos serviços de concertos de roupa por conta própria e este trabalho não é rotineira depende da sua solicitação. Aprendeu em 1999 aqui no distrito em que mora neste momento. Pompilio não faz poupança nenhum alegando que os rendimentos estão longe das sua necessidades.

Para pompilio este é o segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku e Primeiro no Kiva o primeiro foi de 8000,00mt qual usou para compra de material de construção e este também usara para o mesmo fim.

Pompilio tem como grande sonho ter uma casa digna para albergar a sua família.

loans.use: To buy materials to build family house

loans.name: Mohammad Raman

texts.en:
Mohammad R. is 20 years old, unmarried, and runs a shop where he repairs cars. He has done this work for three years and is very good at it and has many clients, despite the fact that he has not been able to get much formal schooling. Before getting his job in Kabul, R. worked at a shop in Iran, but he likes his current position better because he is able to work with his brother.

Mohammad wants to enlarge his shop, and has applied for a loan to make this possible. He will repay the loan in 18 months, and plans to hire two or three new workers as a result of the increased business.

R. is happy to have microloans available in Afghanistan, and wants to thank AFSG, Kiva and the people whose funds make the loan possible.

loans.use: To expand his inventory

loans.name: Unanani

texts.en:
Unanani is 28 years old. She is divorced with one eight year old child. Since 2007, she has been running her own beauty salon. She works every day at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Unanani is requesting a loan of $275 to buy more salon items to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more salon items to expand her business.

loans.name: Legatasi

texts.en:
Legatasi P. is 46 years old and married with five children. She has many years of experience selling bananas and taro. She sells her fruits and vegetables in her village and to the public two days a week.

Legatasi has benefited from two previous successful SPBD (South Pacific Business Development) loans. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400Tala (~$166 USD). SPBD loans are Legatasi's only access to capital, because she is not able to qualify for a traditional bank loan. She will use her loan to improve her banana- and taro-selling business by purchasing seeds and pesticides. Her husband will also help her to operate the business.

loans.use: To improve her banana- and taro-selling business by purchasing seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Mwanakhamis

texts.en:
Mwanakhamis J. has been selling charcoal in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She works daily from 8:00am to 6:00pm and is able to earn a profit of approximately $70 each month. She is requesting her first loan through BRAC Tanzania to buy more charcoal to increase her sales and profit.

Mwanakhamis is 28 years old, married, and has 5 children. In addition to her children, she cares for five dependents.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.ru: Улчаев Али живет в районе Турсун-Заде. Возраст 48 лет, женат  и имеет пятерых детей. Образование среднее . Работает на алюминиевом заводе. Хочет получить кредит для того, чтобы сделать ремонт у себя дома. Планирует купить доски и шифер. Погасить кредит в течение 16 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ali U. lives in the Tursun-Zade District. He is 48 years old, married, and has five children. He completed secondary school. He works at an aluminum plant. He wants to take out a loan to make repairs to his house. He plans to buy wood boards and slate. The loan will be repaid over 16 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repairs

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị Sơn Group

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị S. năm nay 29 tuổi Ms 020211030007 là một phụ nữ trẻ rất nhanh nhẹn, tháo vát. Hiện nay chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con nhỏ, gia đình chị có rất nhiều hoạt động kinh doanh như: Bán quán, bán hàng khô, hang ăn chin, nước giải khát và hoa quả. Ngoài việc bán hang vợ chồng chị còn chăn nuôi 8 con lợn, vì vậy thu nhập của gia đình chị khá ổn định, trung bình khoảng từ 150.000VNđ đến 160.000VNđ/ ngày. Cả nhóm chị đã tham gia vay và hoàn trả rất tốt qua 2 chu kỳ. Chu kỳ 3 này chị vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để mua thêm hang về bán trong dịp tết.
 Trong nhóm chị có các thành viên sau:
 Chị Nguyễn Thị D. năm nay 27 tuổi Ms 020211030014 vay mức 2.912.000VNđ để chăn nuôi gà.
 Chị Nguyễn Thị C. năm nay 61 tuổi Ms 020211030009 vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để làm nghề gò hàn.
 Anh Nguyễn H. T. năm nay 34 tuổi Ms 020211030011 vay mức 2.464.000VNđ để mua lợn giống.
 Chị Phạm Thị B. Thuỷ năm nay 32 tuổi Ms 020211030016 vay mức 3.808.000VNđ để phát triển nghề mộc.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi Son, 29 years old, is a quick and resourceful woman. She lives with her husband and two young children. Her family has many entrepreneurial businesses such has running an eatery, selling dried goods, prepared and cooked food, refreshment and fruit stands. Additionally, her family also raises eight pigs. Because of that, her family's income is stable, averaging from 150,000 VND to 160,000 VND. Her loan group has repaid its loan successfully for the past two loan cycles. For the third loan cycle, Mrs. Nguyen would like to borrow 4,704,000 VND to buy additional goods to sell during the incoming New Year celebrations. Her group includes the following members: Mrs. Nguyen Thi Dung, 27 years old, would like to borrow 2,912,000 VND to raise chickens. Mrs. Nguyen Thi Chat, 61 years old, would like to borrow 4,704,000 VND for her welding/repairing business. Mr. Nguyen Huu Thang, 34 years old, would like to borrow 2, 464,000 VND to buy stud pigs. Mrs. Pham Thi Bich Thuy, 32 years old, would like to borrow 3,808,000 VND to expand her carpentry business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Mr. S., 45, is a rice farmer who lives in Phsarleu Village in Pursat Province, Cambodia. And his wife is a poultry raiser. They both work hard every day at farming rice because it is the main source of income for their family. They have three children, all of whom are teenagers and are enrolled in school. S. often faces difficulties with lacking labor to use for farming, so he rents buffaloes from his neighbors. To avoid rental costs, S. needs a loan to purchase two buffaloes.

loans.use: to purchase two buffaloes to plow his fields

loans.name: Triphonia

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 44-year-old Triphonia K. from Dar es Salaam Tanzania. She is widowed with three children between the ages of 13 and 17. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent because she is an orphan. Triphonia has been running a cow business since 2004. Her business is to keep dairy cows and then sell the milk. She works at the business 5-8 hours per day, seven days per week and is assisted by one employee. Triphonia currently earns about 300 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to buy feed for her animals. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Triphonia thanks you for her support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy feed for dairy cattle

loans.name: Diana Del Pilar

texts.es:
Diana  es socia del Bancomunal Unidas Triunfaremos.
Diana es casada, tiene 38 años, dos hijos de 15 y 13 años que estudian en la escuela estatal. 
 Diana estudió cosmetología y cosmiatria, actualmente enseña en un centro educativo por las mañanas, tiene un salón de belleza que lo abre por las tardes. 
Necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles,  para la compra de una maquina cortadora de cabello y también para la campaña escolar, comprar zapato, maletines, cartucheras. 
 El sueño de Diana es abrir una escuela de cosmetología.
texts.en:
Diana is a member of the "Together we will Succeed" Community Bank. She is 38 years old and married. Diana is the mother of two children, ages 15 and 13, who are still in school. Diana studied cosmetology, and currently teaches a morning class in an education center and operates her beauty salon in the afternoons. She is requesting a loan of 2000 soles to purchase a hair-cutting instrument as well as school materials such as backpacks and pencil containers. Diana's dream is to open her own cosmetology school.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a hair-cutting instrument, as well as school supplies.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es: Amelia tiene 30 años de edad, vive con su madre, con su pareja y su único hijo, quienes le incentivan a seguir adelante. La casa donde viven es de su madre. Se dedica a vender comidas regionales, como juanes (pollo con arroz, aceitunas y huevo envuelto en una hoja), tacacho (plátano aplastado mezclado con aceite), patarashca (pescado asado envuelto en una hoja) y otras variedades de comidas de la selva. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 3 años en forma continua, vende solo por las noches en las afueras de su casa por encontrarse en un buen lugar para el comercio. Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque conoce a muchas personas y se relaciona bastante, además le es muy rentable porque muchas personas degustan de su comida regional y les encanta su buena sazón. Más adelante Amelia quiere tener un restaurante solo de comidas típicas de su región, la selva. Este es su 2do préstamo con MFP,  y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque son personas honestas y de mucha responsabilidad. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá para comprar los productos para la preparación de sus comidas, y una mínima parte para arreglar algunas estructuras de su casa.
texts.en:
Amelia is 30 years old. She lives with her mother, her partner and her only son, who she encourages to continually improve himself. The house where they live belongs to her mother. She is dedicated to the sale of regional foods, like juanes (chicken with rice, olives and egg wrapped in a leaf), tacacho (banana crushed and mixed with oil), patarashca (roasted fish wrapped in a leaf) and other varieties of foods of the area. She has performed this activity continuously for 3 years. She only sells in the evenings outside her house, it being located in a good place for commerce. She likes her work a lot because she has come to know many people and she relates well to them. Besides this, the business is very profitable because many people taste their regional food and its good flavor charms them. In the future Amelia wants to have a restaurant of only typical foods of her region, the forest. This is their second loan with MFP. She likes to work with her communal bank because they are honest people with much responsibility. The money that she requests will be invested to buy the products for the preparation of her foods. A small part wil be used to fix some parts of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make her regional foods

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas B. is 43 years old. She is a married woman with four children. Through the support of her husband she is taking care of two children who are pursuing degree programs at the university. The other two are also in school. She lives with her family at Twifo in the central region of Ghana.

For the past seven years until now, Dorcas has been baking bread and other pastries like cake, doughnuts etc. In taking care of her household, and in spite of the challenges she faces, she bakes sugar bread, wheat bread, etc. and retails them to her customers. She says she makes sure her food quality meets her customer’s expectations. Her customers book their order in advance and before they come their order is ready. She also retails to individuals for their morning breakfast through hawking (that is house-to-house selling).

She says the price of commodities is increasing which is making it difficult to buy more raw materials from the market and the daily demand for bread is high. Dorcas needs the loan to buy more bags of flour, sugar, margarine, milk and firewood etc. She said your assistance would be much welcome. Dorcas belongs to a group called Amen. With the loan she believes she can save more to support her husband in taking care of the children's educational needs.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood etc.

loans.name: Shakhnoza

texts.ru: Вместе с матерью Шахноза продолжает заниматься предпринимательством. После получения прошлого займа она как и планировала приобрела довольно много товара и получила хорошую прибыль. Сейчас она подала новую заявку и планирует и дальше развивать свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Together with her mother, Shakhnoza continues to do business. After receiving her last loan, she purchased a lot of goods, as was planned. She received good profit. Currently, she completed an application for a new loan and she plans to further develop her business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: ля расширения бизнеса

loans.name: Glafiro

texts.es:
El señor Glafiro I. vive con su esposa, son una familia unida y trabajadora que lucha día a día para salir adelante. El señor Glafiro tiene su propio negocio de pulga en venta de aparatos electrónicos, herramientas, etc. 
Pero requiere de la compra de más mercancía para su venta y seguir así atrayendo a más clientes, motivo por el cual  esta solicitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Glafiro I. lives with his wife. They are a solid, hardworking family who are struggling day by day to get ahead. Glafiro has his own flea market selling electronics, tools, etc. But he needs to buy more merchandise for sale in order to continue attracting more customers. And that is why he is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for sale.

loans.name: Jelilat

texts.en:
Jelilat A. is 32 years old and married with three children. She offers rental services, renting out canopies and chairs.

She is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more chairs and canopies. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more canopies and chairs to rent

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth B. is thirty-four years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: two sons and two daughters who are currently in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Her husband is a security officer.

Elizabeth is a trader. She trades in cereals such as maize, beans, etc. She buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices and sells at the market square in her community. She supplies to food vendors and retailers. Elizabeth also treks to other markets to sell. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and sponsor all her children in school to the apex.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Edwige

texts.en:
Edwige H. lives with her husband in Cotonou, Bénin. Their eight children (three boys and five girls), are already grown. Her husband makes a living as a welder.

For a long time, Edwige has been selling various goods in a small boutique in front of her home. Her home is close to a busy Cotonou street, which helps her sales. She started off selling only flour and corn but, in order to increase her revenues, she added charcoal to the list. As the primary fuel for cooking, charcoal is a highly sought after item in Bénin.

With the help of a loan, Edwige would like to buy twenty sacks of charcoal at the Dantokpa Market, the largest market in Cotonou. She hopes that by replenishing her supplies, she will be able to increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en: Nidal is a 25-year-old single man who lives in Gaza City, Palestine. Nidal manages a poultry farm. Now he is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy chicken feed for his poultry business. Nidal thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed for his poultry

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El señor Luís M. tiene 43 años de edad, habitante de la comarca Nandayosi, casado su esposa ama de casa tiene dos hijos que están cursando en la universidad. Sus metas son que sus hijos se preparen y que tenga un mejor provenir. Como planes a corto plazo es las mejoras de su vivienda ya que necesita unos retoques. Trabaja para la Alcaldía de Villa del Carmen con el cargo de conductor desde hace ocho meses, anteriormente trabaja por cuenta propia. Ha encontrado dificultades para realizar sus planes la falta de financiamiento es unos de las primordial dificultad. Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, piso y zinc. Obteniendo como resultado unas paredes seguras y con la comodidad, protección de lluvias y una casa digna. a futuro espera seguir con el crédito ya que es el mas viable por los plazos y a si seguir haciendo las mejoras necesaria.
texts.en:
Sr. Luís M. is 43 years old and lives in the region of Nandayosi. His wife is a homemaker and they have two children who are enrolled in college. His goals include making sure his children are well-prepared so that they will have a better life than he did. His short-term plans include making improvements around the house that require retouching. Sr. Luís has been working in Villa del Carmen for the past 8 months as a truck driver. He was self-employed previously.

He has encountered difficulty completing his home improvement projects because of a lack of funding. Thanks to the loan from AFODENIC, he will be able to buy construction materials such as cement, flooring, and zinc. He will build security walls that will provide comfortable conditions, protection from the rain, and the appearance of a decent home. In the future, he looks forward to being able to access credit again if more improvements are necessary.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to build concrete security walls

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Adela es socia del Banco Comunal Kausachun que significa ¡Que Viva! En quechua.
Adela es casada, tiene 53 años y 3 hijos, Adela tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. su esposo.
Adela necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. gas, azúcar y arroz.
Los sueños D. Adela son educar a sus hijos y mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Para la compra de gas, azúcar y arroz.

loans.name: Felechina

texts.en:
Felechina is a member of the Dodoma borrower group in Kihesa, Iringa. She is 40 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 5 children. Her children are 29, 25, 20, 17, 10 years old. She also cares for other 1 dependent.

Felechina has owned a Business selling local beer for 3 years, she works 4hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Felechina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more maize for making local beer.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Felichina hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more  maize

loans.name: Isa

texts.en:
Isa T. is a 63-year-old woman living in the town of Vaimea.  She is married and has 10 adult -aged children.  To make a living, Isa owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a tailoring business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general  alteration & tailoring services to local community members.  Isa has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 650 WST a month from these activities.

Isa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Isa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1750 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles & threads.  Isa is now requesting a new loan of 2000 WST which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Isa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Gardimo

texts.ru: Гардимо Шарипова проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст 33 года. Свободна, детей не имеет. Гардимо более 6 лет проработала по специальности "учителем". В данный момент она более 2 лет занимается торговлей. Она имеет торговую точку на рынке, где торгует национальными материалами. Кредит просит для закупа нового ассортимента.
texts.en:
Gardimo S. lives in the city of Kulob. She is 33 years old, single and has no children. Gardimo had worked as a teacher for over 6 years. Currently, she has been involved in retail sales for over 2 years. She has a retail outlet at a market, where she sells traditional fabrics. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of new merchandise selection.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new merchandise selection

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok B., 28, is married with a young child. She resides in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia, with her husband (pictured with his father) and her child.

To make a living, B. is engaged in the business of opening a dental clinic in her home, earning an income of approximately US$3 per day. The family is also assisted by her husband who is a taxi driver, providing his transportation services in the province and from the province to the city. He is able to earn an income of US$2 per day to help cover the household expenses.

Mrs. B. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, B. is asking for a loan of US$800 to purchase supplements for her dental clinic.

loans.use: To buy supplements for her dental clinic

loans.name: Judith Adhiambo

texts.en:
Judith Adhiambo is 29 years old, married to Alphonce and a mother of two children, aged seven and one. She sells cereals in Kondele, an open air populous market in the outskirts of Kisumu City.

Judith went into this type of business seven years ago, when both of her parents died in quick succession (within a period of 3 months). She had to drop college in her final year for there was no one to pay for her college fees. She used the funds contributed by mourners as her initial capital.

Judith was introduced to KADET Ltd by a friend from the market, who encouraged her to join her group. This is her sixth loan. She intends to use the money to purchase more stock of beans, groundnuts, millet and cassava during this harvest season for stocking.

She aspires to go back to college and complete her diploma course in Management Information Systems because she had only one unit left when she dropped out. She also aspires to see her children get a good education, because she feels that this is the best gift she can offer them.

About KADET

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their families across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase stock of cassava, beans and groundnuts.

loans.name: David

texts.es: El Sr. David, hace 4 años que se dedica al transporte publico con su propia movilidad auto, sale muy temprano a trabajar, desde las 6 de la mañana comienza a preparar su automovil  lavandolo para posteriormente salir a trabajar. Su esposa es ama de casa y es qiien atiende la unica hija que tienen, ella se dedica a la venta de material escolar pero solo a principios del año escolar. Él necesita el credito para hacer mejoras en su automovil;  todos los días sale a trabajar con su automovil en las diferentes calles y avenidas de nuestra ciudad. Él esta muy orgullosos del trabajo que esta haciendo porque sabe que de esta manera esta siendo un buen ejemplo para su familia, por lo que esta muy contento de contar con el apoyo que le brinda la institucion y esta muy comprometido en no fallar, para ser un ejemplo para su familia.
texts.en:
Señor David has been driving his own taxi for the last 4 years. He leaves very early in the morning for work. From 6 o-clock he begins to get his car ready, washing it before later leaving for work. His wife works in the house, caring for their only daughter. She sells school materials but only during the beginning of the school year. He needs a loan to make improvements to his car. Everyday he leaves for work in his taxi on the different roads in the city. He is very proud of the job he is doing because he knows that in this way he is being a good example for his family. For this, he is very content counting on the support Emprender provides and is committed to not defaulting so as to be a good example for his family.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase his business capital, improve his taxi

loans.name: Zaida Martha

texts.es:
La Sra. Zaida Martha A. C. tiene 36 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Jesus Quispe Pozo por 14 años, tienen 2 hijas y un hijo, los cuales acuden a la escuela de la zona. viven en una casa propia donde realizan su actividad.

Se dedican a la lecheria desde hace mas de 15 años, toda la produccion de leche entregan una empresa que elabora toda clase de productos lacteos. 

Solicitaron el credito para comprar mas alimento (cascara de soya), asi no tendrar escases de alimento para su ganado lechero. lo que mantendra su produccion en un buen nivel.
texts.en:
Mrs. Zaida Martha A. C. is 36 years old, she has been married to Mr. Jesus Quispe Poza for 14 years. They have 2 daughters and one son who attend the local school. They live in their own house which is also their workplace.

They have been dedicated to milk production for more than 15 years and the entire production is delivered to a company that makes all kind of dairy products.

They requested the loan to buy more food (soy shell) so they will not have food shortage for the milking cows and be able to maintain a profitable production.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soy (food for milking cows)

loans.name: Aurelia Guadalupe

texts.es:
La venta de fritanga es el negocio al que se dedica la señora Aurelia H. desde hace quince años en el departamento de León ofreciendo todo tipo de alimentos como hot dogs y las riquísima fritanga elaborada y comercializada por ella misma.
El crédito que está solicitando lo utilizará para la compra de la materia prima como los platanos, yuca, pan, entre otros. Ella espera que su crédito sea otorgado satisfactoriamente para así continuar manteniendo su negocio que tanto le ha costado y generar utilidades para su familia.
texts.en:
Aurelia H. has sold fried food for the last 15 years in León department. She offers all kinds of food llike hot dogs and the delicious fried up meals she makes and sells herself. The funding she is asking for will be used to buy ingredients like bananas, yucca and bread, among others. She hopes her loan will be approved so that she can continue maintaining her business, which she has struggled so hard to set up, and producing profits for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bananas, yucca, bread.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is married and has given birth to one child who is currently in school. The 36-year-old woman lives with her husband and child in a rented apartment in one of the mining towns in Ghana. She works hard to help her husband provide for the family. Juliet is a trader. She prepares all kinds of cereals and supplies them to retailers and food vendors in her community. Juliet buys her goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort A. sells frozen fish at Elmina.  Comfort has received no formal education.  She is married and has four children. Her husband is a plumber. Comfort has been selling frozen fish for some time now. She helps her husband in the payment of school fees and some other family expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to be frozen for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to help her husband with the building of their family house.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to be frozen for sale

loans.name: Sebastian Castillo

texts.es: Sebastian castillo D. 61 de edad, reside en Lourdes Colón, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. El señor Sebastian vive solo en casa propia, lugar en el cual se encuentra su negocio, el cual es una tienda en la que comercializa productos de primera necesidad como: pan, jugos, leche, huevos y otros más. Desde hace tres años que Sebastián posee este tipo de negocio el cual nació por la necesidad de poder contar con una fuente de ingresos fijos, la cual le permitiera contar con todo lo necesario para vivir de una manera aceptable.
