Sebastián solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en su negocio, comprando productos como: embutidos, sodas, medicinas y otros productos más los cuales son de mucha  necesidad y que hasta ahora no poseía, razón por la cual perdía algunas ventas. Para él es de mucha importancia poder mejorar su negocio, ya que de esta manera podrá tener una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Sebastian Castillo D. is 61 years old. He lives in Lourdes Colon, located in the department of La Libertad. Sebastian lives alone in his own home, where is business is located. This is a store that sells primary products such as: bread, juice, milk, eggs and others. For three years, Sebastian has had this business which started out of the need to be able to have a steady source of income. This allows him to have everything necessary to live an acceptable life. Sebastian is asking for a loan with which he will have enough money to invest in his business, buying products such as: sausages, sodas, medicine and other products that are really needed and that he doesn't have yet. This has caused him to lose sales. For him it is very important to improve his business, since this way he can have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perishable products.

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Rosa Francisca

texts.es: La señora Rosa Francisca posee un negocio que es una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, realiza sus compras de contado y sus ventas son al crédito y de contado. Las compras las efectúa en el mercado oriental y a camiones repartidores. Ella inicio de una manera muy sencilla pues tenía muy capital lo que le impedía comprar  una amplia variedad de productos. Es por este motivo  la señora está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio  ya que se aproxima la temporada en donde vende más. Ella sueña con mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa Francisca runs her own in-home general store. She accepts both cash and credit. She obtains her goods from the oriental market and from supply trucks. She started out with a simple business because she did not have that much capital, which impeded her from offering a wide selection of products. For this reason, she is now requesting a new loan, which will be invested in her business because her busy season is approaching. She dreams of improving her home.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kigando Tubingye Group, Kyenjojo

texts.en:
T. Zefulino, shown at the top left in a small photo, also appears in the group photo and he is the leader of his group in Kyenjojo. He is 47 years old and married with five children aged 17 to 5 years. He also takes care of a sister.

Zefulino has operated a business selling produce in Kigando trading centre for five years and he says that the business is doing well. He is able to make 30,000/= as profits every week and he hopes to have good quality products as well as to have a fully-stocked store always.

Zefulino hopes to have a stable and self-sustaining family and this is why he needs a loan to be able to purchase more stock like maize grains, beans and rice for increased stock and hence more sales.

Zefulino is a friendly and determined man with a strong drive to succeed.

loans.use: To buy more produce like maize grains, beans and rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Seydou Koné  est un homme marié de 32 ans, monogame, il est père de sept  enfants et vit à Soromana dans une famille traditionnelle dans la sous-préfecture  de Fakola, préfecture de Kolondièba (troisième région administrative  de la république  Mali. 
Seydou fait le commerce de céréales dans lequel il est très sollicité.
Pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il adhère au programme  crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec  lequel il est à son premier  prêt.
Avec ce prêt, il compte acheter, 400  kilogrammes de grains d’arachide, 1000  kilogrammes de mil qu’il stockera pour revendre à une période où le cours sera plus élevé.
Il s’approvisionne sur le marché de Soromana les jours de foire et dans les villages environnants. Il revend à Bamako aux revendeurs et  aux consommateurs, au comptant.
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  40.000FCFA. Le bénéfice prendra en charge les frais scolaire, de santé,  de nourriture et le reste sera  réinvesti dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Seydou Koné is a married man who is 32 years old, monogamous and father to seven children. He lives in a traditional family in Soromana, which lies in the sub-prefecture of Fakola in the prefecture of Kolondièba (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Seydou sells cereals and is very much sought after. In order to satisfy his customer base, which is growing markedly, he has joined Soro Yirwaso's loan program and is taking out his first loan. With this loan he is planning on buying 400kg of peanut grains and 1000 kg of millet, which he will stock to resell at a time when the price will be higher. He gets his supplies on the market in Soromana on fair days and in surrounding villages. He resells to retailers and consumers at Bamako, for cash. He envisages making an average motnhly profit of 40,000FCFA. The profit will cover school fees, as well as health and food expenses, and the rest will be reinvested in his business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cereals

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady D. est une femme de 38 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis le 02 avril 2007 et a 6 fois eu l'expérience du crédit avec l'institution de micro-finance CAURIE-MF. Elle a toujours respecté ses engagements en matière de remboursement. Elle vend des céréales (mil et maïs) et de la pâte d'arachide. Avec son prêt actuel elle va renforcer son approvisionnement en marchandises et prétendre à des bénéfices plus importants qui lui permettrons de mieux participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Khady D. is a 38 year old married mother of 3. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois since the 2nd of April 2007 and has received 6 loans from the Caurie-MF microfinance association which have always been successfully repaid. She sells cereals (millet and corn) and peanut paste, and aims to use her loan to boost her stock levels and increase profits, which will enable her to work towards improving her family's standard of living.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Managing and promoting her cereals and peanut paste business

loans.name: Neyci Monserrate

texts.es:
La señora Neyci forma parte del banco comunal Los Corrales en una localidad ubicada en los bajos de la ciudad de Montecristi cuna del viejo Luchador Eloy Alfaro en la bella y productiva provincia de Manabí, la señora Neyci mantienen una relación de 30 años con el padre de sus hijos, está dedicada a su hogar y a una pequeña tienda que tiene en su casa, apenas lleva 3 meses su negoció y le va muy bien, se siente contenta con él, por ello con este nuevo crédito podrá incrementarlo de frutas y víveres en general, todas las semanas le toca viajar hasta la ciudad de Manta a comprar en los grandes mayoristas para que le quede algo de ganancias.

El esposo de la señora Neyci es chofer al igual que tiene un negocio de tagua considera que les va muy bien, ella empezó con su tienda vendiendo plátanos, queso y arroz y de a poco la ido surtiendo ahora ya es una tienda completa, desde las 6 de la mañana abre hasta las 6 de la tarde que cierra, el sueño de nuestra socia es poder remodelar su casa.
texts.en:
Sra. Neyci is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Corrales” (The Corrals) which meets in an area in the lower section of the city of Montecristi, the birthplace of the “Old Warrior” Eloy Alfaro (former Ecuadorian President). The city lies in the beautiful and fruitful province of Manabí. Sra. Neyci has maintained a relationship with the father of her children for 30 years. She is dedicated to managing her household and a small store that she has in her home. Her business has been open for three months and is doing very well. She feels happy with it and will use this new loan to increase her inventory of fruits and other general provisions. Every week she travels to the city of Manta and buys her products from the large wholesalers so that she will have a better profit margin.

Neyci’s husband works as a chauffeur and also runs a business processing “tagua” (a substitute for elephant ivory derived from palm nuts) which is doing very well. She started her store selling bananas, cheese, and rice, and then gradually increased her inventory until her store was complete. Her business opens at 6am and closes at 6pm. Neyci’s dream is to remodel her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, rice, oil, eggs, and fruit

loans.name: Shohnazar

texts.en:
S. Shohnazar, a 34-year-old married father of two children, has been selling household goods such as kettles, pails, basins and many other items for the past seven years in order to support his family. The business is quite successful, carrying goods that meet client demand, thereby generating a stable income that allows Shohnazar to improve the living conditions of his family and make his children happy. A recipient of two previous loans from IMON, he is now requesting $3000 USD to enlarge the range of goods he carries. Be an important part of the growth of Shohnazar’s business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new household goods to enlarge his range of goods.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim K. has been spending her life cultivating crops since she was young. This is a skill she learned from her grandparent who died of senility year ago. Sim K. is now married and has two school-aged kids. Her husband frequently works alongside her in the farm fields.

Growing crops is an annual action with which Sim K. has had great success. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons.

The coming rainfall is good for growing but Sim K. doesn’t have capital yet to use on her farm. So she is looking for a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizer, insecticide, a water pump, and green bean seeds for planting.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, insecticide, a water pump, and green bean seeds for planting

loans.name: Koffi Jean

texts.fr: A. koffi jean est âgé de 42 ans, il a ouvert sa propre boutique  de vente de matériaux de construction, il a appelé cette boutique "Ets merlin electrique". sa clientèle est composée en majorité d'entrepreneurs. il fait ce commerce depuis  plus de 10 déjà, il doit approvisionner une maison en construction c'est pour cette raison qu'il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 10 rouleaux de fil TH 25, 10 rouleaux de fils TH 15, 4 rouleaux de fil 4M et divers autres materiaux. il est marié et père de 2 enfants.
texts.en:
Koffi Jean A. is 42-years old. He opened a shop called “Ets Merlin Electrique” where he sells construction materials. His clientele consists primarily of contractors, and he has been running this business for over ten years already. In order to supply a house under construction, he is seeking a loan from WAGES to purchase 10 rolls of TH 25 wire, 10 rolls of TH 15 wire, 4 rolls of 4M wire and various other materials. He is married with two children.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Eliel

texts.es: Eliel, de 23 años, es un joven emprendedor, que vive en una casa alquilada en la ciudad de Lima con su pareja Diana de 21 años y sus dos pequeños hijos. Desde hace 4 años, se dedica a distribuir papa a los grandes restaurantes y pollerías de lima.  Labora en la ciudad de Lima, comprando varios sacos de papa que luego lava, pela y corta con maquinarias modernas, en el que luego son repartidas a sus clientes. En este negocio labora en compañía de su pareja, y siente que por fin puede darle a su familia una adecuada calidad de vida, pese a que el trabajo diario es sacrificado, por ello tiene que estar pendiente de la administración. Por otro lado, posee campos de cultivo en donde siembra arveja, es así que recibe ingresos adicionales a su economía. Él siempre fue un joven emprendedor y visionario, su mayor desea es implementar su negocio con mejores maquinarias que agilicen su trabajo. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP,  y como siempre está seguro de poder pagar puntualmente cada cuota, de su deuda, pues le gusta ser responsable, por eso le gusta trabajar con los integrantes de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de arveja y 15 sacos de papa que procesará para vender.
texts.en:
Eliel, 23, is a young businessman who lives in a rented house with his partner, Diana, 21, and their two young children. For the past 4 years he has been selling potatoes to the big restaurants and the chicken rotisserie restaurants of Lima. He works in the city of Lima buying sacks of potatoes, washes them, and peels and cuts them up with modern machinery and then they are distributed to his customers. His partner works with him in this company and he feels that finally he can give his family an adequate quality of life, despite the fact that they have to sacrifice with the daily work by being careful with the managine. Besides, he has farmland where he grows beans, and thus gets additional earnings. He was always a hardworking young man with foresight, and his biggest dream is to start his own business with better machinery that will make his work easier. This is his fourth loan with MFP, and as always, he is sure to make each loan repayment on time. He likes to be responsible, and that is why he likes to work with the members of the communal group. With the loan that he is requesting he will buy a bag of bean seeds and 15 sacks of potatoes that he will process to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 15 sacks of potatoes to process and then sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria A. is from the village of Calamagui 1st. She is 42 years old and married with 3 school-aged children.

To make a living, Gloria runs a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Gloria joined ASKI to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI which she used to purchase additional products to sell.

She is requesting her 8th loan, for 17000 PHP, which she will be use to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support her family.

About ASKI

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Orliete Jose

texts.pt:
Orliete José T. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província de mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, mãe de 3 filhos de 3, 7 e 11 anos de idade, o mais velho vai a Escola. Fez somente 6ª classe, não continuou devido a gravidez precoce e depois do primeiro filho não voltou a Escola. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta ninguém para além da sua família.

Nunca saiu da sua cidade natal, é negociante ha mais de 10 anos, vende roupa nova diversa que adquire na Republica da Africa do Sul. Não possui nenhum empregado e consegue em media um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum em sua casa, mas pretende abrir uma conta bancaria para assegurar a sua economia.
 
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de vizinhas que também são clientes da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar peças de roupa nova diversa para aumentar quantidade do seu stock.

No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para desenvolver ainda mais o seu negócio e adquirir um terreno para construir uma residência para os seus filhos.
texts.en:
Orliete José was born in Maputo, in the Province of same name, South of Mozambique. She is the mother of three children who are 3, 7 and 11 years old. The oldest son goes school. She only went to school until 6th grade and didn't finish due to a teenage pregnancy. She never went back to school after her first child. She lives in her own home with her family and doesn't support anyone other than them. She has never left her hometown. She has had a business selling assorted new clothing which she buys in South Africa for more than 10 years. She doesn't have any employees and has an average income of 5,000 meticais per month, which is spent in household expenses. She also manages to save some money at home but plans to open a bank account to protect her savings. She has never had loans from other banks. She became familiar with Hluvuku through neighbors who are also partners of this institution. This is her first loan, in the amount of 10,000 meticais. She intends to buy assorted new pieces of clothing to increase her inventory. She intends to request more loans in the future to further develop her business and to purchase a lot to build a house for her children.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of assorted new pieces of clothing

loans.name: San Juana

texts.es: San Juana R. N. se dedica a la venta de gorditas de diferentes rellenos como lo son de frijoles, guisado, rajas con queso y mas, este negocio es llamado “Gorditas Hym” que ya lleva 1 año, es del cual le genera ingresos para cubrir sus gastos. La señora necesita de un crédito para comprar mercancía para el negocio.
texts.en:
San Juana R. N. works selling “gorditas” (a small thick tortilla made from corn flour) with different fillings such as beans, stew, peppers and cheese, and others. Her business is called “Gorditas Hym” and it has been in business for one year. This is how she makes money to cover her expenses. She needs a loan to purchase merchandise for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
Marisol C., 44, is a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Roy C. and is the mother of three young hard-working teens. By the grace of God, Marisol has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marisol operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5-worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns income by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling them at the piece rate.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, Marisol is requesting a PHP 26,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Marisol dreams of being able to renovate her house soon using what she has earned with all her work in the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To expand her product inventory

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
La Asociación  Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” está iniciando su tercer ciclo, en el Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación.  Está compuesta por ocho mujeres.  Las señoras  se reunirán cada quince días, durante cinco meses para capacitarse  y pagar sus cuotas.   La mesa directiva está compuesta por la señora  Geovanna como presidenta, la señora  Dolores como tesorera y como secretaria de actas la señora Soledad.

La señora  Geovanna es una mujer joven de 24 años de edad, como presidenta de su asociación tiene la tarea de controlar que la Mesa Directiva, Jefes de Grupo y socias de bases cumplan con los reglamentos acordados  al inicio del ciclo de crédito.  Ella tiene cinco años de experiencia como cliente de Pro Mujer, ingresó a una asociación gracias a la invitación de un grupo de señoras.  Con respecto a su negocio, ella vende en el bazar que comparte con su madre.  Su primer crédito fue de $us 150.-, actualmente ha solicitado Bs.5000.- y piensa invertirlo en la compra de su propia mercadería para el bazar.

Con respecto a los negocios  que llevan adelante el resto de integrantes de la asociación la mayoría son de comercio.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Emprendedoras” community association, part of the Villa Exaltación focal center, is starting its third loan cycle. It is made up of 8 women, who meet every 15 days over 5 months to receive training and make loan payments. The directors committee consists of Geovanna, the president, Dolores, treasurer, and Soledad as secretary.

Geovanna is a young 24 year old woman. As president, she has the task of making sure the directors committee, group leaders, and members comply with the rules agreed upon at the beginning of the loan cycle. She has 5 loan cycles of experience as a Pro Mujer client. Geovanna was invited to join a Pro Mujer association by one of the groups of women. With respect to her work, she and her mother are vendors at the bazaar. Geovanna's first loan was for US$150. She is currently applying for a Bs.5,000 loan and plans to invest it in the purchase of her own merchandise to sell at the market.

The majority of the rest of the members works in small business.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for Bazaar (office supplies, decorations, etc.)

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.en:
Zoraida P., from the village of Western, Wao, Lanao del Sur, is 54 years old, married, and has four grown children. To make a living, Zoraida owns and operates a water-refilling station offering various-sized containers in the local community. She also runs a sari-sari store selling snack foods. Zoraida has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Zoraida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI that was used as working capital and to purchase additional inventory, she is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP to invest in expanding the business and buy tools for the maintenance of the water station. This will be Zoraida's fifth loan from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business and to buy tools for the maintenance of the water station

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Elena; tiene 36 años de edad, y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de enseñanza a niños del nivel inicial, ella es profesora y por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere tener una tienda de abarrotes. La  socia solicita el préstamo para pagar la fiesta y el viaje de promoción de su hija.

La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: This is Señora Elena.  She is 36 years old and a member of the communal bank "Los Lideres" (The Leaders) located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco.  She lives with her partner and has 2 children.  She is a pre-school teacher and with this job she is able to provide for her children.  She would like to open a grocery store.  She is requesting a loan to pay for her daughter's graduation trip and party.  She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's graduation trip and party

loans.name: Rv - Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 37 years old and is married with three children between the ages 13 and 21 years old.  Currently she is the only member of her family who works.  She works hard to provide for all the needs of her children.  Chantal owns a small business selling decorations.  She has had her business for 1 year and her store is open from 8 am until 8.30pm.

Chantal has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to expand her business and to increase the materials she requires for decoration. With the extra profits, Chantal will keep reinvesting in her business for the purpose of being financially stable and she will also start saving for her future.

loans.use: To increase stock for a decoration shop

loans.name: Ireneo's Group

texts.en:
Ireneo B. is from the village of Del C., Cabatuan, Isabela. He is 59 years old. Ireneo is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Ireneo is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, he raises pigs for fattening and sale. He has been engaged in his business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $92 when he sells a raised animal.

In 2010, Ireneo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI.

Ireneo is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be his 2nd loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Celinda Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Luz De América.

En este lugar conocimos a Celinda, tiene 59 años  de edad,  está soltera y vive con su hermana y una sobrina. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 4 años y le gusta Ya que le han ayudado mucho y porque los créditos son rápidos sin tantos requisitos.

Ella se dedica al comercio,  vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, aunque también vende en su casa, nos cuenta que lo que más vende es ropa de mujer y de niñas.  También prepara comida para vender por lo general prepara hasta 10 almuerzos al dia solo para entregar. Trabaja todos los días  desde las 8h30 hasta las 16h00. Su mercadería la compra en Guayaquil una vez al mes o cuando necesite.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa sobretodo de mujer y de niñas, además de ingredientes para preparar los alimentos. Sus sueños son agrandar su casa.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Luz De América' community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí.  This city has been known for many years as the 'City of the Royal Tamarind Trees'.

Here we meet 59 year-old Celinda.  She is single and lives with her sister and a niece.  She has been a member of her community bank for 4 years and she likes it because it has helped her a lot and because the loans are quick and don't have too many requirements.

Celinda is a saleswoman.  She sells all kinds of clothes.  She makes her sales door to door although she also sells clothes from her home.  She tells us that what she sells most of are women's and girls' clothes.  Celinda also makes meals to sell.  She generally makes up to 10 meals a day which she delivers to her customers.  She works every day from 8.30am to 4.00pm.  She buys her goods in Guayaquil once a month or whenever she needs to.

Celinda will use this loan to buy clothes, especially women's and girls' clothes.  She will also buy ingredients for making her meals.  Her dream is to extend her house.

loans.use: To buy women's clothes, girls' clothes and ingredients for making meals

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn A., is from the barangay of Malaubang, Ozamiz City. She is 48 years old, married and has three children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a seaweeds production and fish selling activity. She has been in business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Evelyn joined PMPC to access financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Evelyn is now requesting a loan of 13,000 PHP to purchase a fishing net. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Evelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the living conditions of her family.


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.



*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy a fishing net

loans.name: Chrin

texts.en:
Mr. Chrin N. and his wife, Mrs. Oun Prach, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  They have been married since 1993 and have two children – one son and one daughter, all of whom are in school. 

Chrin drives a Tuk Tuk taxi in Phnom Penh. His wife is a weaver. In December 2008, he asked for a Kiva loan to buy a second hand Tuk Tuk. Unfortunately, because it was old, it has now broken down again.  Therefore, he is asking for another loan of $600 to buy a new Tuk Tuk (not second hand).

loans.use: To purchase new Tuk Tuk.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne, 60, is married with 2 children who are now adults. She has been farming in the town of Murang'a in central Kenya for ten years. She employs two farmhands and sells her products to the local market. 

Anne has requested a loan of 60,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo for poultry farming. She says that the proceeds from her farm will increase her income and ensure that she is financially independent. Her major challenge has been the high cost of animal feed.

loans.use: poultry farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair their taxi

loans.name: Hemazro  Folly

texts.fr: Monsieur Folly a 24 ans. IL est née à Lomé et habite quartier Bè.  Il exerce comme  activité  l’Info-graphisme.  En  effet   il a commencé cette activité en 2007  et  a son atelier  à côté de la station Bè.  Il s’approvisionne à la société NEACOMPS. Il  demande  un  crédit pour  acheter un ordinateur et de ce fait  satisfaire plusieurs  clients.
texts.en:
Mr. Folly is 24 years old. He was born in Lomé and lives in the district of Bè. 

He works as a computer graphics technician. He started this activity in 2007 and keeps a studio near the Bè station. He buys his supplies from NEACOMPS. 

He is seeking a loan to buy a computer, which will allow him to serve more customers.

loans.use: to purchase a computer

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.ar: اشرف عمره 24 سنة اعزب يعمل في بيع الأدوات المنزلية له في عمله 5 سنوات يحب عمله وله تاريخ جيد فيه له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة للمصلحة وتقوية العمل له تاريخ جيد في عمله وهو يطور نفسه يعاني من صعوبة في المنافسة لكن ما ينقصه هو المادة يحلم بأن يمتلك محل اكبر وان يصبح صاحب مؤسسة وان يؤمن مستقبل جيد
texts.en: Ashraf is 24 years old and unmarried. He works in the business of selling household goods. He loves his business, which has a good reputation. He has customers from amongst his neighbours and locA. residents. With this loan he wants to purchase new stock for his store and thereby strengthen his business. He faces a lot of competition and what is holding him back is lack of financiA. capitA.. He dreams of owning a bigger store and securing a good future for himself.

loans.use: to purchase new stock for his store and strengthen his business against competition.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 27 years old.  He started running his mobile-phone money transfer business two years ago.  He has been able to sustain his business because of his hard work.  He has also set up some space for photocopy services in the same business premises.  Joseph also does farming for extra income.  He hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future.  He has requested 20,000 Kes to add E-float to his business.

loans.use: To add E-float to his mobile-phone money transfer business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is 55 years old. She is married and has four children. Lolita works very hard to provide for them. She runs a gasoline retail business in the Philippines and requested a 10,000-Philippine-peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more gasoline to sell. Lolita has been in this business for 26 years. In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more gasoline to sell

loans.name: Enna Marisela

texts.es:
Enna, resiD. en San Francisco Gotera, departamento D. Morazán, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, posee una tienda D. productos D. primera necesidad, está ubicada en su casa D. habitación ofrece arroz, maíz, frijoles, boquitas, dulces y por las tardes venD. pupusas.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. granos básicos, aceite, embutidos; esta compra le ayudara a mantener mayor variedad en su tienda y brindar un mejor servicio a los clientes.
Su objetivo es trabajar para sus hijos, que estos estudien y se superen.
texts.en:
Enna lives in San Francisco Gotera, in Morazán department, together with her husband and two children.  She has a store where she sells essential household products which is located in her home.  She sells rice, corn, beans, snacks, sweet treats and, in the afternoons, she sells pupusas.

Enna is requesting a loan to buy basic grains, oil and cold meats.  This purchase will help her to maintain a variety of products in her store and proviD. a better service to her customers.

Enna's goal is to work for her children.  She would like them to study and improve themselves.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, oil and cold meats

loans.name: Sareoun

texts.en:
Sareoun, age 30, is married and resides with her children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. 

Sareoun is employed at the factory, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband, who is a construction worker, earning an income of $5 per day. 

Their standard of living has been improved since the family has had these businesses. 

She is requesting a loan of $400 to finish her construction of her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of her house.

loans.name: Moussodjeton 1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe MOUSSODJETON 1  est composé  de femmes mariées du village de DJALAKORO  de SAN région de SÉGOU quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et au moins 5 enfants.
Elles cultivent  de l’arachide du fonio et du haricot.  Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel de TENIMA, qui est la première debout à gauche avec une écharpe bleu, sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semences d’arachide, de haricot, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au grand marché de SAN. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 15000 à 65000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Moussodjeton 1 group is made up of married women from the village of Djalakoro in San, which lies in the Ségou region (the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region). They live in traditional families, average 34 years of age with at least five children each. They grow groundnut, fonio and beans. With a view to making their farming activities profitable, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program two years ago. Having repaid their previous loans without difficulty, they are now on their second farming loan.

Tenima, who is standing on the left of the photo and wearing a blue scarf, is going to use her loan to buy a sufficient quantity of groundnut and bean seeds, as well as small equipment and agricultural inputs at the large market in San. After the rainy season, the crops are stocked for a certain period of time in order for them to gain value before being sold at the large market in Kimparana and the surrounding markets, on a retail basis (but often wholesale too), for cash to a customer base coming generally from large towns. 

The group members are expecting to make a profit of 15,000 to 65,000FCFA each once their produce has been sold; this will be used to repay interest on their loans and cover household running costs.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small equipment

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 22 years old and a hard-working businessman. He is married and the proud father of one child.

He has been selling shoes for five years. He gets additional income from his rental houses. He would like 40,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy stocks of fashionable shoes.

In the next five years he wants to expand his business into wholesale. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for educating him financially.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fashionable shoes

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is an aggressive 31-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with a two-year-old child. He has been selling secondhand clothes for the last eight years. He hopes to open another business stall selling clothes within five years. Since Benson joined Faulu Kenya, he has become more knowledgeable on how to run his business and he has learned how to save his money.  He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy shirts to sell.

loans.use: To buy shirts to sell

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es: María es socia del Banco Comunal Sarita, tiene 40 años y vive con cuatro de sus cinco hijos. Hace tres años su marido falleció y María tuvo que enfrentar el desafió de criar a sus hijos completamente sola. Ella solicita el préstamo para su negocio de venta de lozas.  Ella compra ollas, platos y cucharas por mayor y las vende como ambulante.  Dice que siempre trata de tener una selección surtida de sus productos.  María lleva mas de 15 años con FINCA Perú pero cuando falleció su esposo se salio por un año y luego volvió cuando pudo superar la soledad.  Aunque la ausencia de su pareja le causo mucho sufrimiento ella nunca cayó en deuda. Lo que mas le gusta a María de las reuniones de su Bancomunal son los valores de la puntualidad y la responsabilidad que le han inculcado y las amistades que ha creado con las socias. Su hijo mayor esta en Huancayo sacando su titulo para ser profesor y María esta ahorrando para pagar lo ultimo que le queda de estudio. En FINCA Perú ella ahorra para sus hijos y dice que gracias a ese apoyo nunca le hace falta comida en su hogar o para los pasajes de sus hijos. María siempre tiene presente que lo mas importante es siempre trabajar con alegría y amor, y que con esa perspectiva todo sale bien.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Sarita community bank.  She is 40 years old and lives with four of her five children.  Three years ago María's husband died and she had to face the challenge of raising her children completely on her own.  She is requesting this loan for her business selling kitchenware.  She buys pans, plates and spoons wholesale and then sells them as an itinerant vendor.  She says that she always tries to have a selection of products in stock.  

María has been working with FINCA Peru for more than 15 years.  When her husband died she took a year out and then returned when she was able to overcome her loneliness.  Although the absence of her partner caused her a lot of suffering, she never fell into debt.  What María most enjoys about her community bank meetings are the values of punctuality and responsibility that are instilled into everybody and the friendships that she has with her fellow group members.

María's eldest son is in Huancayo, finishing his degree so that he can become a teacher.  María is saving up so that she can cover the last remaining payments for his studies.  Through FINCA Peru, María saves for her children and says that, thanks to this support, she is always able to provide food for her household and cover her children's transport costs.  María always bears in mind that the most important thing is to always work with happiness and love and that, with this outlook, everything turns out well.

loans.use: to buy pans, plates and spoons wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a mobile phone money transfer business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of compost and manure.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima Group

texts.es:
La Alcancía Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima” es un nuevo grupo la cual está formado por 07 integrantes entusiastas y con deseos de empezar a trabajar con el Programa- Prosperidad.
Jaqueline fue elegida tesorera por los miembros del grupo, ella es conviviente tiene 38 años de edad con 2 hijos menores en etapa escolar, Jaqueline como la gran mayoría del pueblo de Huariquiña se dedica a la agricultura de la siembra de alfalfa la cual luego las vende en los mercados de su comunidad, ella comenzó esta actividad siguiendo el ejemplo de sus padres quien se dedicaba a dicha actividad, con su esfuerzo Jaqueline a podido aportar con los gastos del hogar y superarse es por ello que hace 6 meses nos cuenta que aperturo una pequeña tienda donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad, su ultimo crédito lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, leche, azúcar, fideos ente otros. El deseo de Jaqueline es de terminar de construir su vivienda para así brindar hospedaje la cual tendría un ingreso mas para su hogar. La Alcancía Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima” están muy agradecidos ya que hacen posible su progreso.
texts.en:
The “Santa Rosa de Lima” (St. Rose of Lima) communal bank is a new group composed of seven enthusiastic members with the wish to start working with the Prosperidad Program.

Jacqueline was elected Treasurer by the group members.  She has a spouse and is 38 years old; she has two minor, school age children.  Jacqueline, like most of the residents of the town of Huariquiña, is a farmer growing alfalfa that she later sells in her community’s markets.  She started this activity following in her parents’ footsteps that were also in this occupation.  With her efforts, Jacqueline has been able to contribute towards household expenses and to improve herself.  Because of this, she relates that six months ago she opened a small grocery store where she stocks basic need items.  She’s going to use this most recent loan to buy rice, milk, sugar and pasta, among others.

Jacqueline’s wish is to finish building her house so that she can offer room and board thus having an additional source of income.  The Santa Rosa de Lima communal bank is very grateful because you make their progress possible.

loans.use: to buy pasta, milk, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
La señora Dolores tiene la edad de 36 años, estudio la primaria, se encuentra casada con el señor Trinidad se dedica al campo, ellos tiene  2 hijos, ya solo un hijo depende de ellos economicamente. Ella y su familia vivien en una cominidad que se caracteriza por estar ubicada en un zona cañera.

Ella nos platica que desde hace 2 años dedicio apoyar a su esposo con los gasto del hogar es por eso que decidio vender tortillas de mano y asi ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y familia
Ella realiza sus tortillas desde muy temprano todos los dias se levanta a las 4:30 de la mañana para ir al molino y despues iniciar a elaborar sus tortillas, un dia antes ella les ofrece sus tortillas a sus clientes o vecinos y al dia siguiente despues de terminar de hechar sus tortillas sale a entregarlas, tambien nos dice qu coo ya la gente sabe que vende van a su casa ha comprar.

Doña Dolores necesita este credito para la compra de maiz, cal y leña para realizar sus tortillas. 

Ella espera que este credito le ayude a mejor su negocio para salir adelante dia a dia. Se encuentra muy agradecida con la fundacion por la ayuda que le a otorgado.
texts.en:
Dolores, age 36, has an elementary school education.  She is married to Trinidad, who works in the fields.  They have two children, but only one child is economically dependent upon them.  She and her family live in a community in a sugarcane zone.

She tells us that she has been helping her husband with the household expenses for two years.  That is why she decided to sell handmade tortillas.  By doing this she gives her son and her family a better quality of life.

She starts making the tortillas very early every day.  She gets up at 4:30 in the morning in order to go to the mill.  After that she begins making her tortillas.  She offers her tortillas to her customers or neighbors one day ahead of time.  The next day, after she finishes making the tortillas, she leaves to deliver them.  She also says that because people know that she sells, they go to her house to buy.

Dolores needs this loan to buy corn, lime water, and firewood to make her tortillas.  She hopes that this loan will help her improve her business in order to get ahead day to day.  She is very grateful to the Fundación for the help that was given to her.

loans.use: to make and sell tortillas.

loans.name: Ümmügülsüm

texts.en:
Ümmü is married and has one 15-year-old child. 

Before she began to sell jewelry, she was a housewife. But when her sister went to Mardin, they decided to sell the jewelry of Mardin in Istanbul. So her sister began to send jewelry to Istanbul and helped Ümmü to buy a shop.  

Now, Ümmü is selling the jewelry coming from Mardin in her shop.  

Ümmü wants to use her loan from Maya to sell more products. She thinks that if she buys different kinds of jewelry with the loan, she will be able to appeal to more customers.  

In the future, she wants to be known around Eskişehir for her jewelry from Mardin.  

Finally, Ümmü is a very ambitious and resolute woman, and her son is the most valuable person in her life.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Ümmü Hanım, evli ve 15 yaşında bir çocuğu var.  Bu işe başlaman önce ev hanımıydı.Fakat ablasının Mardin'e tahininin çıkması ile ,Mardin takılarını İstanbul'da satmaya karar verdi.  Bu yüzden ablası takıları İstanbul'a göndermeye başladı ve ona dükkan tutuldu.  Şimdi Ümmü Mardin'den gelen takıları dükkanında satıyor.  Ümmü Maya'dan aldığı bu kredi ile daha fazla ürün satmak istiyor.  Maya'dan almış olduğum kredi ile farklı takılar alırsam, satışımın artacağına inanıyorum.  Gelecek için planları ise,Eskişehirde Mardin yöresel takılarıyla tanınmak.  Ümmü Hanım,istikrarlı ve hırslı bir kadın,oğlu onun için bu hayattaki en kıymetli şey.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of jewelry.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 33-year-old Lebanese, married man living with his wife and five children. He has been working in car furnishing for the past 18 years. His business income is very important in supporting his family and handling their high living expenses. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase car textiles and sponges to help with his business. In the future, he plans to further expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase car textiles and sponges

loans.name: Yola

texts.es: La señora Yola es empleada del sector público y trabaja como abogada. El crédito lo requiere para cancelar un curso a nivel superior en derecho civil. Vive en casa de sus padres políticos misma queda ubicada en la zona de 14 de septiembre en la ciudad de La Paz; es casada  y tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que Yola obtiene un crédito en IMPRO, y como es un crédito para educación superior se lo canaliza por Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Yola is employed in the public sector as an attorney. The loan she is requesting will be used to pay for an upper-level course in civil law. Yola lives at the house of her parents in the September 14th District of the city of La Paz. She is married and has two children.

This is the first time Yola has obtained a loan from IMPRO. Since this a higher education loan, it is being referred to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to pay for a course in civil law.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 31 years old and single. For the past 11 years, she has operated a salon and she earns a monthly income of 40,000 KES. 

Rose is requesting a loan to buy hair weaves, hair pieces, and massage oils. This will be her first loan with KADET LTD.  She will use her anticipated profits to diversify her business by keeping poultry. Rose’s dream is to have a high-class salon that will increase her income and raise her living standards.

loans.use: to buy hair weaves, hair pieces, and oils

loans.name: Mbuzi Tukorrehamu Group

texts.en:
John owns and operates a retail shop. He is a hard-working young man who has been running this business for five years. John faces a primary challenge in people taking a long time to clear their debts. His business goal is eventually to own a large wholesale shop. 

John lives with his wife and three children in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children and to construct a high-quality, permanent house. 
 
John needs the loan to buy salt, sugar, and soap to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, and soap to offer for sale

loans.name: Hureltulga

texts.en: Hureltulga is 27 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger (a Mongolian yurt/ nomadic tent) in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business and his son goes to kindergarten. Hureltulga operates a photography studio. He started his business in 2009. He is very talented for a local photographer, however, his camera is broken, therefore he needs to buy a replacement part. He is a talented young man who says "It has been horrible since my camera got broken and I have to do everything I can to fix this". He is requesting 800,000 MNT to repair some other piece of his reducer machine - copy machine that alters the size of pictures, which is broken.

loans.use: To repair a piece of his reducer copy machine

loans.name: Wendy

texts.es: Wendy, tiene la edad  de 28 años, está en unión libre y vive con su hijo y su esposo que es son su mayor prioridad. Ella pretende con el crédito comprar una máquina para la confección de ropa. Ella actualmente cuenta con un equipo de trabajo ya establecido y necesita esta máquina para facilitar aun más su trabajo. Ella con esta máquina pretende darles a sus clientes un trabajo más eficaz y rápido atendiendo las necesidades de los clientes. Ella querer seguir creciendo con su proyecto cada día y mejorar su estabilidad económica  teniendo así un mejor bienestar familiar para ella y su familia. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Wendy is 28 years old and in a common law marriage. She lives with her husband and son, who are her main priority. With the loan, she intends to buy a sewing machine to make clothes. At present, she already has work equipment set up and she needs this sewing machine to facilitate her work even more.  With this machine, she hopes to give her customers quicker and more efficient work to attend to their needs. She wants to keep growing with her project every day and improve her financial stability in order to have more wellbeing for her and her family. This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. She hasn't had any other loans before in government banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with better conditions and much lower interests.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Steven

texts.en:
Steven, 55, brings two decades of business experience to the table. He holds it as his trump card in the tough and cutthroat meat business in Kyenjojo. His tenacity, prolific hard work, ethics, and purposefulness have been his stocks in trade. Short of that, the father of seven says his butcher shop would have probably gone belly up.

Prior to his establishment in the butchering trade, he was inclined mostly to food sales. Steven says that, week in and week out, this business generates sales returns to the tune of UGX 150,000. Steven says he will use his loan to expand his butcher shop by buying more animals for meat to resale.

loans.use: to buy more animals for meat.

loans.name: Menard

texts.en:
Menard is 40 years old and lives in Solangon, San Juan, Siquijor.  He is married with four children.

Menard has a construction supply business through which he earns approximately 2,500 PHP per month.  He has requested a loan of 6000 PHP to purchase coconut trees to use for house construction, and to deliver to his buyer.

Menard has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one month.  In the future, Menard hopes both to improve his living conditions and to be able to send his children to school.

loans.use: to purchase of coconut trees to use for house construction, and deliver to his buyer.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de restuarant,ella prepara platos como cuy al horno,pollo al horno y sopas,la socia atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia tambien vende gaseosas y cervezas,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el local de restaurant.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como carne,pollo y verduras y tambien para comprar cerveza y gaseosas al por amyor.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This member is still running her restaurant. She prepares dishes like roasted guinea pig, roasted chicken and soups. She works from 8 am to 6 pm. She also sells soft drinks and beer. Thanks to this business she can bring up her children. Her dream is to expand the guests' area of her restaurant. She applies for this loan to buy ingredients for her dishes, such as meat, chicken and vegetables, and also to buy beer and soft drinks in bulk. She is happy for the loan and promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her dishes, such as meat, chicken and vegetables, and also to buy beer and soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn works hard to support her family. Arlyn is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Arlyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing nets for her business.

Arlyn has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Arlyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets for her business.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: José Luis de cuarenta y nueve años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol y café, tiene varios años de dedicarse a la agricultura y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia que le permite mantener la calidad de su labor y a la vez obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de siembra es apto para el desarrollo y crecimiento del cultivo, además está cerca de su vivienda, comercia en todos las zonas aledañas a la localidad y ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad a precios accesibles pero sobre todo con un servicio excelente; José Luis es un hombre de metas, muy seguro de lo que desea en la vida siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que lo lleven al éxito, en la última cosecha debido a las lluvias tuvo pérdidas y en esta temporada de siembra quiere recuperarse necesita comprar insumos por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol,  café, fertilizante, herbicida, insecticida etc. José Luis es muy responsable y tiene buenas referencias de pago por eso asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez le dará a su familia una mejor vida.

loans.use: semilla de maíz, frijol,  café, fertilizante, herbicida, insecticida

loans.name: Esarah Kurnia

texts.en:
Esarah Kurnia is a student from Cipanas. Actually, she comes from Arya Karnia Vocational High School.

To handle school costs, sometimes she sells products to her friends and sometimes she works part-time in some shop, but that's all and it isn't enough to cover her school costs. So she choose to get an education loan from Komida to solve her problem. Thank God, her choice came true and now she can focus on her education.

loans.use: to pay for school costs

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a poor rural, smallholder crop farmer in the Kenyenya area of Kenya. She does dairy, poultry, and crop farming besides horticulture, and she is looking to improve the efficiency of her cows by buying animal feeds to increase milk productivity. 

Alice is seeking a loan to buy animal feeds. With the borrowed money, she plans to buy high quality animal feeds that will increase milk productivity in her farm.
The impact of this loan will be increased milk production and hence improved living conditions.
Alice dream is to be able to give her five children a good education and make her children realize their goals. You can be part of this dream by making a loan. Be inspired and support a Kenyan smallholder woman!

loans.use: To buy animal feeds

loans.name: Inés

texts.en:
Ines has owned her clothing store for twenty years. When she first began at the age of 18, she was looking to support herself when her husband left her. She sold fast food, household items, clothes, and women’s accessories, so now she is mature enough to be considered a seasoned salesperson. Ines wanted to sell clothes because they were her favorite products to sell, and she thought she could make a decent living selling quality products door-to-door. She did that for a period of time, marketing her items mainly to friends and family, as well as local neighborhoods where she knew most of the people. Ines has been able to save enough money to rent a space to store all of her clothes, but she is hoping to use part of the loan funds to rent a location where she can sell her products. 

Ines wants this loan so that she can buy inventory that is seasonal like jackets, sweaters, and pants. This 37 year-old entrepreneur has four children, all of whom still live with her. Two of the children are working and help Ines financially with necessities for the house. Her husband has been working in a factory for the last 15 years, and whenever Ines has to attend to her children or visit her distributors, her husband is able to watch over the business which is open from 8am until 11pm every day.

loans.use: Ines wants this loan so that she can buy inventory that is seasonal like jackets, sweaters, and pants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Alice intends to buy clay, ochre and employee 5 more workers

loans.name: Fanice Wabwile

texts.en: Fanice is married with six children who are both in primary school.  She has not undertaken any formal training, but she learned the business through observation.   She started the business in 2005 after she saw there was a need for such a business in the area.  Her main customers are market women and men. Though the business is doing well, she needs a loan from PEMCI to renovate the place in order to attract more customers.  Through the business, she has been able to bring services to the market people and employment to two young men.

loans.use: To increase her business

loans.name: Nut

texts.en:
Mr. Nut S. is a 34-year-old widower and has 3 school-aged children. 
To cover all the family’s expenses, Mr. S. works as a trailer driver transporting passengers (his trailer is attached to a motorcycle) and typically makes up to $6 each day. He has worked diligently to manage to support his 3 children, since his wife passed away a few years ago. At present, Nut S. needs to replace his old trailer, but he has insufficient money. He  hopes this loan will allow him replace it and then be assured of the earnings that ensure his family's well-being.

loans.use: To purchase a new trailer for his business

loans.name: Nap

texts.en: Mrs. Nap V., 40, lives in the Siem Reap Province of Cambodia with her husband (pictured) and 4 children. She supports her family by making traditional Khmer bowed-string instruments called a 'Tro'. She would like to use the loan to purchase new tools for this business. In the future she would like to buy a shop to sell her instruments from.

loans.use: to purchase tools to make their instruments

loans.name: Timun Kebonsari Group

texts.id:
The cucumber farmers led by I Wayan Wisnawa consists of 5 members: I Made Muliawan, I Wayan Sudartana, I Ketut Mundra dan I Nyoman Bading. As cucumber farmers, they need about a month, from preparing the land for planting cucumber seeds till harvesting. Before the field is ready is the preparation process to ready the land for planting. Thereafter commences the care prior to harvesting. Their efforts generate profit of Rp 3.500.000,00 (about USD385) per person. This amount they earned after 3 months of farming. Besides cucumber, they also grow hot peppers. They agree upon which substitute crop to grow through mutual consensus. This loan will be used to purchase seeds, manure, pay care and working expenses.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Para Petani Timun yang diketuai oleh I Wayan Wisnawa ini beranggotakan lima orang yaitu: I Made Muliawan, I Wayan Sudartana, I Ketut Mundra dan I Nyoman Bading. Sebagai petani timun mereka membutuhkan waktu kurang lebih 1 bulan, mulai dari persiapan lahan untuk ditanami bibit timun sampai dengan saat panen. Sebelum lahan siap untuk diolah ada proses persiapan untuk menjadikan tanah tersebut siap untuk ditanami. Pada masa-masa berikutnya merupakan masa perawatan yang berikutnya masa panen tiba setelah melewati sekian masa untuk siap dipanen. Usaha yang mereka lakukan tersebut memberikan keuntungan sebesar Rp 3.500.000,00/orang. Nilai ini mereka peroleh setelah 3 bulan penantian. Selain timun mereka juga menanam cabai. Pergantian tanaman ini mereka lakukan sesuai dengan kesepakatan bersama. Pinjaman yang mereka peroleh akan mereka pakai untuk membeli bibit padi, pupuk, biaya perawatan dan ongkos kerja.

loans.use: Purchase seeds, manure, and pay for care and working expenses (Membeli bibit padi, pupuk, biaya perawatan dan ongkos kerja)

loans.name: Yessenia

texts.es:
Señora Yessenia began her business 8 years ago with a startup amount of C$200.00, contributed by her husband. This gave her the opportunity to start her business, to continue forward and to help support her three children in their studies, nutrition and health care.

Currently she has obtained a space in the central market near the edge of the meat section. Little by little her business has grown with loans from CEPROD. that have been a vital strongpoint for the growth of her business, and have helped her increase her inventory.

Señora Yessenia has achieved better living conditions in her home, as her business generates sufficient income to give her family improved conditions, thanks to the financial assistance she has received from her friends at CEPROD., who are always there to give a hand to their clients. It is notable that she has had 10 loans in 2 years.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Yessenia inicio su negocio hace 8 años con un monto inicial de C$200.00 producto D. aporte D. esposo, teniendo la oportunidad de comenzar con su negocio que le ayudaria a salir adelante y ayudarse al mantenimiento de sus 3 hijos en sus estudios, alimentacion y salud

Actualmente ha logrado adquirir un tramo en el mercado central en el sector de ventas de carne a la orilla D. anden. Poco a poco a crecido con los creditos de ceproD. que ha sido el punto de apoyo vital para su crecimiento en su negocio y que le ha ayudado a crecer en su inventario.

Ha logrado adquirir mejores condiciones de vida en el hogar ya que su negocio le genera suficientes utilidades para darle a su familia mejores condiciones gracias a la ayuda que recibi de su financiera amiga CeproD. que siempre va de la mano con el cliente. Cabe señalar que ha tenido 10 creditos en 2 años .

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Otajonova

texts.en: Otajonova D. lives in Spitamen (Soghd oblast, Tajikistan), and she is married and has 3 children. Mrs. Otajonova D. applied to MicroInvest in 2007 and recommended herself as a serious and executive client. The business stability and income increases she has had have helped her to return the previous loan funds on time, and to improve her business situation. Mrs. Otajonova D. is experienced in business of livestock and has the appropriate knowledge of livestock. She has been engaged in the livestock business from her early years when she helped first her mother on the farm with cows and sheep, and then she heldped her husband. It is the family business that brings the general income. Now she is an accountant in the JSC “Tagayak” as a profession, but most of the time she is engaged in the family business. She helps with livestock raising and selling, the milk production and other work. In time she dreams of purchasing a horn pedigree milk-cow for to produce more milk-sour (cultured milk) products. Now Mrs. Otajonova D. requests a loan for business development that will allow her to increase significantly the family income and to plan for more milk-cow purchases.

loans.use: For a milk-cow purchase

loans.name: Tujikomboe Group

texts.en: Ashura J. is 25 years old. She is married and the mother of 2 children. They live together as a family. Ashura is a food vendor, and her plan for the loan is to develop her business.

loans.use: To develop her business

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mrs. Mao S., age 47, is a cleaner in the company and earns approximately $2 a day. Her husband, Mr. Has Sivon, works as a motor-taxi driver and normally makes on average $5 a day of profit. They have three children, two of whom work in a garment factory; the other one is student. Mrs. S. plans to use the loan from Kiva to open a small business by purchasing pigs to breed. The remainder of the loan will be used to buy a motorbike for her son to ride to school. (Mr. is pictured because Mrs. Mao S. is not available).

loans.use: To buy pigs and a motorbike.

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: Ros S. is 50 years of age and a widow. She works as part of the local staff at the Ministry of Transportation in Phnom Penh. She has a total of eight children. Three are married and five remain single and in the family home. Two of her children are currently employed as low-earning garment factory workers. She needs a loan to build a better house for her family. She also hopes to have enough left over to invest in pigs for breeding.

loans.use: To build a new house and purchase pigs for breeding.

loans.name: Nom Oam Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nom O. is the group leader of a four-member group in Chro Moh Chrouk Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a cook who has been hired to cook for workers and she generates a small income to support the family. Because she and her family still live in poor conditions, however, Mrs. Nom O. would like to start breeding pigs in addition to her cooking business. She has therefore requested a loan to buy pigs.

Mrs. Nom O. is 48 years old and a widow. Her child is a construction worker who earns too little money to improve their standard of living.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To start a pig-breeding business

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel O. is 30 years old and married with one child. He lives in Benin City with his family, and has been in the business of selling garri, a popular food, since 2003. He trained in this business for 12 months, and needs a loan of $600 to buy more garri to sell to his customers.

loans.use: To buy more garri, a popular food made from cassava tubers, to sell

loans.name: Toghanro

texts.en: Toghanro L. is 38 years old and married with 4 children; she lives in Benin City with her family. Toghanro sells timber. She learned this business in 3 years, and she started her own business in 1992. She has been a LAPO client for 5 years now, and she is requesting the loan amount of $1,200 to buy more timber for sale.

loans.use: To buy timber for sale

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Mrs. Sina U., 25, a divorcee with no children, lives with her widowed mother along National Road Number One about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Her mother has been a cotton scarf weaver for many years.

Sina has woven scarves for 15 years, a skill she learned from her mother, and sells her finished products to wholesalers at markets in Phnom Penh City. She and her mother have saved some money from their business to repair their old house but lack the funds to complete the repairs. Therefore, Sina is requesting a loan of $1000 to repair her house and bU. materials for her cotton scarf business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for scarf-weaving and repairing her house.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa Maria is 40-years-old and lives in the Sabana Grande region in the city of Managua. She is a single mother of two children, who are 12 and 16, whom she fights for every day to be able to take good care of them and above all to give them an education so they can be worthy people in society. Rosa Maria has sold used clothing and phone cards for 18 years. She started this business with her own funds and much effort. This loan will go towards purchasing a package of assorted clothing, since the price of it increased she doesn't have enough capital to acquire it.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Rosa Maria tiene 40 años de edad, habita en la comarca Sabana Grande de la ciudad de Managua, es madre soltera de dos niños de 12 y 16 años de edad, por los cuales lucha diariamente para poderlos sacarlos adelante y sobre todo para darles estudios, para que sean personas de bien para la sociedad. Rosa Maria se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y tarjetas telefónicas desde hace 18 años y empezó este negocio con fondos propios y con mucho esfuerzo. El destino del préstamo será para la compra de una paca de ropa variada, ya el precio de ésta subió y no cuenta con suficiente capital para poder adquirir este producto.

loans.use: Purchase of a package of clothing

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe tiene 48 años. Ella tiene una tienda de productos comestibles, además por las noches tiene un puesto ambulante de comida, que le genera ingresos extras. Su esposo es taxista y esta fuera de casa todo el día. Guadalupe tiene un hijo que asiste al colegio y cuenta que es buen estudiante.
El último crédito que Guadalupe recibió lo empleo en el mantenimiento del auto de su esposo y en su negocio ambulante de comida.
Sin embargo ella necesita otro crédito que le permita comprar productos para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a 48-year-old woman who has a small grocery store. Additionally, she sells fast food on a cart every night, which generates extra income for her. Her husband is a taxi cab driver, so he is away from home all day long. Guadalupe has one son who still attends school. She tells us that he is a good student. The last loan that Guadalupe obtained was used for maintenance on her husband’s cab and for her street food business. However, she now needs another loan that with allow her to purchase products to restock her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock grocery store

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar baji is a wife of M. and lives in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 6 years. She is the mother of two daughters. Both of her daughters stay at home and do household work. Kosar baji’s husband has a lath work. He makes nuts of vehicles by lath machine. He has been in this business for the past 12 years. Kosar baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and taking care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy another lath machine to make more parts for vehicles to sell in the market and earn more profit.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more businesses. Naziran baji and Arshan baji each want a loan to buy fruits for their fruit selling business. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes. Another group member, Parveen baji, wants a loan to buy wood to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another lath machine to make parts for vehicles

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is married with a grown son. Six years ago she realized that her best opportunity would be to have her own business. Today, Marina is in the business of selling footwear in the local market.

Marina is very sociable. Her friendliness and respectful attitude have given her a good reputation at the market. She has also proven to be a good manager of her finances. She has received and promptly repaid all of her loans from Nadiya Ukraine. Loans have enabled a gradual expansion of Marina’s business. Currently, she has about 7,000 Grivnas in inventory. Her gross income per month is about 4,500 Grivnas. Her monthly net profit amounts to 1,800 Grivnas.  

Marina would like to get a loan to increase the assortment of inventory in her kiosk. She believes the loan will be beneficial to her business by promoting its expansion. Profit generated by her business will give Marina a chance to help her cover some necessities at home, and improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
This 40-year-old member from Palayan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental is expanding her business with a meager capital of PHP 3,000. Maricel D.
