J. has 5 children and has received various loans from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, being a member for almost 8 years. Her 1st loan was used in fish vending and ran for 7 years. She got a micro-housing loan for the completion of their home. Her husband manages a blacksmithy and repair workshop where the capital was also financed by Paglaum MPC.

All these loans were repaid in a timely manner, and Maricel remains until present a member in good standing. The loan windows of Paglaum MPC helped the couple send their children to school. Recently, Maricel is hooked on the idea of putting up a little "sari-sari" (variety) store. She thinks their daily needs can be supplied by the income from the store. She said it's not a losing battle facing everyday hardships, having her husband by her siD.. And she is truly thankful to Paglaum MPC for keeping them company in all their financial needs. What they focus on is taking care of their existing businesses.

Maricel has applied for a loan in the amount of PHP 40,000 which shall be used for expanding their blacksmith business. A portion of the amount will be for her little store and a fraction will be for the educational needs of her daughter who is in college.

In the future, the couple wishes to operate a real grocery store and wants to acquire a "videoke" machine. They aspire to support their children through their chosen courses and until they establish their own careers. Maricel said all the reason for their sacrifices is their children.

loans.use: additional capital for blacksmith, stock for "sari-sari" (variety) store & education of her children

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua A. is 42 years old, divorced and the mother with two children. All her kids are in school. She has been selling food for the past 3 years to take care of her family. She sells gari and beans with ripe plantains in the community school at Nkawkaw. Gari and beans is enjoyed by many Ghanaians because it contains lots of protein and is affordable.

Akua's business is doing well due to her social skills. Her major challenge is that when the students are on vacation she has to break for a while. In order not to be idle during school vacation she wants to expands her operation while students are on vacation.

Akua would like a $400 loan to buy food stuffs like gari, plantain, beans, charcoal to restock her inventory. Her dream is to save more from her business proceeds to take care of children's school expenses. Akua belongs to a village bank called ‘Asetenapa’, meaning Good Living.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs like gari, plantains and beans

loans.name: Subon

texts.ru: Субон энергичный мужчина 47 лет , отец шестерых детей.Жена подрабатывает продажей козьей шерсти.Сам Субон имеет 40 белых красивых коз.Которых пасёт сам на горных пастбищах.Которые расположены вблизи гор.Козы питаются на пастбищах различными травами.И только вечером Субон пригоняет их домой.Во время мониторинга мы увидели коз очень далеко и на смогли их запечатлеть.Субон узнав что Микроинвест выдаёт займы на расширение бизнеса животноводства решил тоже стать кредитором Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Subon is an energetic 47-year old father of 6 children. His wife sells goat wool. Subon owns 40 goats which graze during the day on mountain hills. During monitoring we saw Subon's goats but did not take a picture. Having learned that MicroInvest gives loans for expanding livestock businesses, Subon decided to apply for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: El señor Jesús es albañil desde hace 2 años para una constructora, su esposa la señora Claudia lo apoya con los pendientes del hogar y lo motiva a salir adelante ya que son una familia muy unida y responsable, ahora el esta solicitando este préstamo para la colocación del vitropiso de su casa para darle un estilo diferente y mas cómodo.
texts.en:
For two years, Jesús has been a bricklayer for a construction company. His wife Claudia helps him with household tasks and motivates him to get ahead. They are a very close and responsible family.

Jesús is requesting a loan to install tile floors in his home. This will make the home more comfortable and will give it a different style.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of tile floor

loans.name: Eddy

texts.es: Eddy tiene 34 años, es viuda, vive en su casa propia con su hijo y su madre. Comparte su tiempo entre su trabajo como enfermera en un hospital y el cuidado de sus animales, esta última actividad la viene realizando desde su niñez, aprendió lo necesario a lo que respecta a las actividades agrícolas, su madre y su hijo son su brazo derecho para realizar estas  labores mientras está en su trabajo. Pero por las tardes, es ella quien se dedica a cuidar de sus animales, que principalmente son ovejas. Cada día se levanta temprano para no descuidar sus labores, cada mes acude a la feria ganadera de su zona para vender lo que ha criado y nuevamente comprar ovejas pequeñas. Eddy no descansará hasta cumplir con lo que se ha propuesto, que es tener un establo grande donde pueda albergar a mayor cantidad de ovejas, y así tener más capital de venta. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, y está muy animada de empezar este trabajo solidario con su grupo, por lo que promete ser una de las socias más activas de su  banco comunal. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de más ovejas, caca una está valorizada en 150 soles aproximadamente.
texts.en:
Eddy is 34-year-old widow, who lives with her mother and son in her own house. She splits her time between working in the hospital as a nurse and looking after her animals. She learned all about agriculture as a child and she's been caring for animals ever since. Her mother and son step right in for her while she's at work, but in the afternoons she is the one taking care of the animals, mainly sheep. She gets up early every day so she doesn't neglect her chores. Each month she goes to the livestock fair in her area to sell the sheep she has raised and buy new young ones. Eddy won't rest until she has achieved her goal of having a big stable where she can keep more sheep, which she can sell to raise more capital. This is her first time seeking a loan from MFP and she is very excited about starting to work in solidarity with her group; she promises to be one of the most active members of her village bank. She plans to use her loan to buy more sheep, which cost about 150 soles each.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy young sheep

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie T. a 45 ans, mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour s’activer dans la vente de crème et  de glace, très rentable en cette période de chaleur. Elle a pour objectif d’assurer les dépenses nécessaires aux études universitaire de son enfant.
texts.en:
Marie T., 45, is married and the mother of 4 children. She is requesting this loan to sell cream and ice, a lucrative business in this hot weather. Her goal is to ensure that she will have the necessary funds to pay for university studies for her child.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: preparing and selling cream and ice

loans.name: Suma Sartawi Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Suma Sartawi” forma parte de la familia de  Pro-Mujer, esta  se encuentra en la zona de Villa Exaltación, de la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha  cuenta con doce miembros que  han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito y actividades internas.
Dentro el grupo la mayoría son casadas y con hijos, casi todos en edad escolar. El comercio es la actividad principal de la asociación Suma Sartawi,  por ejemplo Asencia vende variedad de golosinas, Esperanza se dedica a la venta de mantas tejidas, Lidia vende abarrotes, todos en general adquieren productos de mayoristas para luego venderlos al detalle. Quieren invertir capital para realizar estas compras al por mayor para mejorar sus ganancias y cumplir con las obligaciones que todos tienen con sus familias
texts.en:
The group "Suma Sartawi" is part of the Pro-Mujer family. It is located in the Villa Exaltacion area in the city of El Alto. To date, it has twelve members who have proven to be an organized group in their credit assessments and their internal activities. Most members of the group are married with children, nearly all them school-age. The main activity of the association Sum Sartawi is trade. For example, Asencia sells a variety of sweets, Experanza is dedicated to the sale of woven blankets and Lidia sells groceries. All of them generally purchase products wholesale and then re-sell them. They want to invest capital for these wholesale purchases to improve their earnings and meet all the obligations they have to their families.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to purchase products wholesale

loans.name: Milaz

texts.en:
Milaz S., 54, is married and has three children. He lives in the small village of Sabirabad City and works in the agricultural industry. More than 20 years ago, he decided to begin to cultivate land that he owned. He did so to generate more income that would enable him to support his family.

Milaz grows wheat, corn, and vegetables, which he must give the proper care so that he can produce a full, healthy harvest. He will use the loan money to buy materials that will enable him to improve production yield. Milaz has discovered over the years that he enjoys doing this job, which is why he is grateful for this access to loans that allow to improve his farm and become a better farmer.

loans.use: To buy materials to improve production yield

loans.name: Munana

texts.en:
J. is married and has five children. Living in Mbingo, Belo, Cameroon, he has two sources of income: farming plantains and raising goats. With this loan, J. would like to purchase four goats, some fencing, plantain suckers (for planting) and some salt.

This is J.’s second loan from GHAPE since he became a beneficiary on Valentine’s Day in 2008. He has experience using loans and knows that his products will sell because “people like plantains” and goats are used in traditional ceremonies, as well as eaten regularly.

J. has been through times where he was sick or he could not afford to pay his children’s school fees. With the profits from this loan he plans to pay those fees and purchase more food for his family. J. takes out GHAPE loans because they are a transparent organization and he sees that the members “love one another.”

About GHAPE

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community in its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Four Goats, Plantain Suckers, Salt, Fencing

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam C. was born in 1968 and is a mother blessed with five children, one of whom is married and lives separately, while the others are still living at home. Her second and third children are single and employed.

Sam C. is married to Lay Souet, age 50, and they both earn a living by cultivating rice in the village. To alleviate the hard physical labor in the farm work, Sam C. will be using half of the loan to buy a water buffalo to plow the farmland. With the rest she will buy a boat in order to fish in Tunle Sap Lake. This will provide them with additional income.

loans.use: To buy a water buffalo and a boat

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Luisa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Pomata, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 53 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y es madre D. 05 hijos (01 a su cargo).  Tiene estudios D. primaria completa, vive en la av. Panamericana s/n.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 04 años,  con un préstamo inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para invertir en su negocio D. venta D. comida. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra D. fideos, arroz, papa, chuño, aceite y condimentos para la preparación D. comida.

Su deseo es comprar una casita en Puno.

A ella le gustan las charlas, los encuentros y las reuniones entre Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luisa is a member of the Medalla Milagrosa (Miraculous Medal) village bank located in the Pomata district of the Chucuito province of Puno, Peru. She is 53 years old, married and is the mother of 5 children (one of whom still lives with her). She completed her elementary school education and lives on Panamerican Avenue. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for the past 4 years with an initial loan of ~$100 which she used to invest in her business selling food. Now, she is requesting a loan of $675 in order to purchase noodles, rice, potatoes, oil and condiments to prepare her food. She hopes to one day purchase a home in Puno. She enjoys the discussions, the interactions and the meetings of the village bank.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase noodles, rice, potatoes, oil, and condiments to prepare her food

loans.name: Reoun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Roeun S. leads a loan group with six members, all of whom live in Tranh village in Takeo province. She is farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows rice. She is facing problems because she does not have enough money to buy gasoline, plow her field or purchase fertilizer. She has applied for this loan to meet those needs. Mrs. Roeun S. is a 44-year-old widow with three children who are in school. 

All the members of this group have applied for end-of-term loans which do not require them make any payments on the principal until the end of the loan's term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they benefit Cambodia’s poor by allowing them repay portions of the principal when they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term, and almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: To buy gasoline, plow her field and purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Grupo Pasacguin Group

texts.es: El grupo de mujeres pasacguin son originario de paraje pacana del Municipio de Sancristobal Totonicapan ser un grupo de doce personas humildes y sencillos que cada dia ven la necesidad de progresar para el bienestar de su familia. su actividad principal es la crianza de aves hoy necesita de un credito para comprar mas aves ya que dicho grupo cuenta con cinco mil pollos ponedoras dicha actividad lo vienen realizando mas de doce años  y cuando iniciaron  con diz pollos para cada persona  hoy necesitan el apoyo de ASDIR para poder desarrollarse economicamente para mejor el nivel de vida de cada persona.
texts.en:
The women of Pasacguin Group are from Paraje Pacana in the Municipality of San Cristobal, Totonicapan, Guatemala. They are twelve humble and simple people who see every day the necessity of progressing for the benefit of their families. Their principal activity is raising farm fowl. They have been involved in this activity for more than twelve years, beginning with just 10 chickens apiece. Now they have more than 5,000 egg-laying hens.

They need this loan to buy more chickens. And, now, they need the assistance of ASDIR to develop economically, in order to improve the standard of living of each person.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: CAPITAL TO BUY MORE CHICKENS

loans.name: Edith Abigail

texts.es: Edith de 40 años de edad es soltera, tiene 2 hijos, pero con ella viven 2 sobrinos los cuales estan a su cargo, labora en el MISA SILAIS Chontales desde hace 9 años como responsable de proyecto Fonsalud, esta solicitando su 8vo credito para mejorar su vivienda terminando la construccion de su porche y poniendole el piso ya que actualmente ni siquiera esta embaldosado y con las lluvias se le hace lodo, cuenta con el apoyo de compañero de vida quien asume los gastos del hogar.  El mayor sueño de Edith es poder tener una vivienda bonita para sus hijos y con las condiciones basicas para que puedan desarrollarse en un ambiente estable y alegre.
texts.en:
Edith is 40 years old and single. She has 2 children, but she also has 2 nephews and nieces living with her, of whom she is in charge. She has worked in the Chontales branch of the Ministry of Health’s Comprehensive Local Health System (SILAIS) for 9 years, and has been responsible for the Fonsalud project. She is requesting her 8th loan to improve her house, finishing the construction of her porch and putting in the floor because it is not currently tiled and the rain creates mud. She has the support of her life companion, who assumes housing expenses. Edith’s biggest dream is to be able to have a nice house for her children with basic conditions so that they can develop in a stable and happy environment.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a porch

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter K. is 23 years old and married to Scolar Wambui.They have two children both under the age of two. He has been employed as a motorcyclist, offering taxi services within and around Naivasha for the last year.

Peter got to know about KADET through one of his group members and was happy to join. This being his first loan, Peter plans to add to his savings and buy his own motorbike. This will enable him to increase his income hence improve his living standard.

In future Peter hopes to own his own cab and offer taxi services in and beyond Naivasha.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Purchasing a motorbike

loans.name: Madinah's Group

texts.en: N. Madinah is a 45 year old female and married with 6 children aged 25 – 3 years as she takes care of 5 dependants. She is a business lady involved in the sale of cereals fresh from the villages and she sells from Owino market for 20 years. She is able to make 200,000/= a week as profits and this is mostly attached to her good customer care skills and having loans that increase her capital base all these years. Madinah has a dream of having to see her business boom as well as having an educated family that will be self reliant in future. Madinah needs a loan to help buy more produce like beans, Irish potatoes, cabbages and so on for resale.

loans.use: Buying more produce for resale.

loans.name: Baby Khode Group

texts.en:
Nabela, Pari Gul and Zakia want to receive loans for tailoring. Pashton wants to take out a loan for cleaning vegetables. She buys vegetables and cleans them so that her husband can sell them in the market at a higher price.

Nabela is the leader of Baby Khode Group. The four members of this group plan to buy essential materials and expand their businesses. They would like to take out a group loan of 40,000 afghanis. They are all happy with the loan process.

loans.use: To purchase business requirements

loans.name: Vong

texts.en:
Mr. S. was born in 1974. His wife, Sor Mom, is 30 years old. They live together in Kampong Chhnang Province. This couple was married many years ago and they have four school-aged children. Mr. S. is a goldsmith. His wife stays sells groceries to neighbors from their home.They typically earn an average of $5 per day, which they use to better meet their family's financial needs. 

S. has been working as a goldsmith for a long time, but his business still requires more material. Thus, he decided to seek a loan to buy extra equipment for his business.

loans.use: To buy extra equipment for his goldsmithing business

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan T. is currently in the business of selling groundnut paste and charcoal and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Juan is 23 years old and is married with a husband who is a shopkeeper. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to send her children to school by paying school fees.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia A. is from the village of Aurora. She is 55 years old, married and has two grown children. Delia has been selling her homemade foods for over five years. As her main source of income, her business generates approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Delia joined ASKI to access their financial services and improve both her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous ASKI loan of 15,000 PHP. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients for her food preparation business. Delia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Delia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Talita Kurmi Group

texts.es: “Talita Kurmi” es un grupo de 11 señoras que asisten a sus reuniones en el Centro Focal “Alto Lima”,  se agruparon por  la necesidad de acceder al préstamo ya que todas necesitan incrementar su capital de trabajo dedicándose a la venta de verduras, masitas, hilado de lana, atención de tienda de barrio y artesanía en joyas. Ellas están concientes de que tienen varias competidores y tienen que ser mejores que ellos, atendiendo a las clientas de la mejor manera y ofreciendo productos de calidad. Un claro ejemplo es Maria P. de 48 años, casada y madre de 4 hijos, tiene su tienda de barrio y lo que más le ha llamado la atención de Pro Mujer es la atención en el consultorio y el ahorro, además con el crédito comprará aceite y fideo al por mayor.
texts.en:
“Talita Kurmi” is a group of 11 women who attend meetings in the “Alto Lima” Center. They meet to secure access to the loan that they all need to increase their working capital for various enterprises including the sale of vegetables, cookies, spun wool, operating neighborhood stores and creating jewelry crafts. They are aware that they have many competitors and need to be better than them by having excellent customer service and offering high quality products. A clear example is Maria P., 48 years old, a married mother of 4 children who owns a neighborhood store. The thing that most caught the attention of “Pro Mujer” is the attentiveness in the store and the ability to save. With the loan, she will buy mostly oil and noodles.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Product purchase

loans.name: Phea

texts.en: Mrs. Phea S. is 31-year-old widow without any children. She is a farmer living in Kdei Tnaot village in Takeo province. Although she works hard, she still does not earn enough income to support herself. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding.  She would also like to build a piggery and to buy food for her pig breeding.

loans.use: to buy more piglets for breeding

loans.name: Sabenti Group

texts.en:
Above in the photo are members of the Sabenti group. They are petty businesspeople in the northern city of Makeni in Sierra Leone. They have applied for a group loan of 3,000,000 from SMT/Kiva in order to expand their businesses, both in size and in quality. In this way, they can make more sales; earn more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living.

The leader of the group is 37-year-old Abdul K., in the left in the photo. Abdul was born in Makump village about 5 miles from Makeni. He is married to a businesswoman and they have 5 children – 2 in primary school and 3 in secondary school.

Abdul sells rice, salt, and palm oil. He has been a businessman for many years now. With his share of the loan, he will expand his business by buying wholesale the above-mentioned items.

loans.use: Buy rice, salt, and palm oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase grocery items in bulk.

loans.name: Françoise

texts.fr: D. Françoise est née le 18 mars 1983 en Côte d’Ivoire.  Il y a quatre ans que Françoise s’est installée au quartier Dogoudo à Allada, ville dans le département de l’Atlantique au Bénin.  Françoise est mariée à NONVIGNON Aubin, un instituteur.  Françoise a sept enfants à sa charge, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont ses propres enfants.  Françoise vit ensemble avec son mari et les enfants.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Françoise n’a jamais fréquenté l’école.  Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Françoise vend de vivres au marché de Allada. Françoise a sept ans d’expérience dans ce domaine et s’approvisionne à Ouéssé.  Françoise a déjà obtenu un crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé.  Françoise désire élever le niveau de son activité afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients, mais elle manque suffisamment de moyens financiers pour y arriver.  C’est la raison pour laquelle Françoise sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Françoise D. was born on March 1983 in Côte d'Ivoire. Four years ago she settled in the Dogoudo neighborhood in Allada, a town in the Atlantic province of Benin. Françoise is married to Aubin Nonvignon, a schoolteacher. Françoise has seven children in her care, two of whom are her own, and all of whom go to school. Françoise lives together with her husband and children. The couple takes care of the household expenses together. Francoise never attended school. In order to support herself, she sells foodstuffs in the Allada market. She has seven years of experience in this business and buys her stock in Ouéssé. In the past, Françoise already had obtained a loan from ALIDé and duly reimbursed it. She wishes to expand her business in order to better meet customer demand, but lacks the financial means necessary. This is why Françoise is seeking a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing a stock of peanuts and corn

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice for her husband to mill for re-selling

loans.name: Mina Saheda Group

texts.en: Bebe Zahra is a member of Mina Saheda group. She lives in the 11th District of Kabul, Afghanistan. She lives in a household of six members. She is a tailor who sews all kinds of clothes, both small and big sizes. She needs the loan to purchase a new sewing machine because she has problem with the old one. She hopes to expand her business and to open a shop of tailoring to attract more clients and to support her childern get better education.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Anne Njoki

texts.en:
Anne, aged 34, is married and has three children, She resides in Mwiki, a locality outside Nairobi town. She operates her business in Mwiki, a place with a majority of low income earners who buy embroidery for resale in other markets. She has done this for the last four years. 

With this loan, Anne plans to buy a stock of materials for embroidery to boost her work output. She has never borrowed from other financial institutions. In the future, she hopes to set up an embroidery school.

loans.use: To buy a stock of materials for embroidery

loans.name: Aminda

texts.es:
la señora Aminda P. D. tiene 50 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Efrain Cruz quien trabaja en una salinera, tambien se dedican a la cria de cerdos.
Aminda tiene una pequeña pulperia, negocio con el cual ha podido salir adelante.
el credito lo utilizara para surtir el negocio, sus clientes son muy exigentes y necesita cubrir con todas las exigencias de ellos.
las ganancias las necesita para tener ella y su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminda P. D. is 50 years ago, she lives with her significant other, Mr. Efrain Cruz who works at a salt maker. They also breed pigs.

Aminda owns a small general store, which has made it possible for her to get ahead.

The loan will be spent on supplies for the business. Her customers are very demanding and she needs to fulfill all their demands. She and her family need the profit to have a better life quality.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase egg, soda, cookies, bread, rice, bean, sugar, churros, candy, juice, salt, condiments, corn and wheat flour.

loans.name: Santa Catarina

texts.es: Santo es de 20 años de edad, es soltera, se dedica a confeccionar prendas de vestir, actualmente necesita una máquina para mejorar su producción, vende en los lugares aledaños a su localidad, solicita su primer préstamo para adquirir una máquina de coser, sus referencias personales indican que es una persona responsable con muchas ganas de superar.
texts.en:
Santa, 20, is single and manufactures articles of clothing. She needs a sewing machine to improve production. She sells in places neighboring her location and is asking for her first loan to buy a sewing machine. Her personal references indicate that she's a responsible person who very much wants to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Seham

texts.en:
Seham S. is the mother of four daughters and one son. She is married to a construction worker and the family lives in Bethlehem. Seham's husband doesn't have stable employment, so it is hard to take care of a family.

In an attempt to help her husband Seham, sold all of her gold accessories to get the money to start a small grocery store. Recently, Seham wanted to expand the store and purchase more goods in order to increase her profits and attract a larger number of customers.

In the photo, Seham appears in the store with her son.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en: Moustafa is a 22 year old man from Lebanon. Since 2006, Moustafa has been working as a car seat repairer. His clients can be anyone from his region and its surroundings. For the first time, Moustafa is asking for a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua to purchase fabric to repair car seats. Moustafa is proud of his experience in this field of work. He hopes to keep improving his skills as well as his financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase fabric to use in the repair of car seats

loans.name: Bufunda United Women's, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
Operating an agricultural farm has been an adventurous and challenging business venture for one Sam T., a 36-year-old from Ibanda. Being a determined, energetic and hardworking young man, he worked tooth and nail to start selling bananas, which are commonly used to prepare a local dish by customers here in Uganda, alongside his teaching profession.

He is so fond of his enterprise; thus, he is always able to earn 300,000 Ugandan shillings monthly. This loan is to help him do the mulching and buy stake poles and pesticides for his plantation. Expansion of the project to a larger scale is his main motive for this loan. This will help to improve on Sam's yields and production and lead to an increase in sales revenue which will enable him enjoy a self-sustainable livelihood. Sam has on a black jacket  in the photo.

loans.use: To help with mulching, buying stake poles and pesticides for his banana plantation.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy M. is from the village of Usocan. She is 53 years old and is married with three adult children. Daisy owns and operates a business selling personal home products to tourists and local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Daisy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Daisy is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth M., a 21-year-old resident of the town of Natete in the Kampala West region of Uganda, is single and has two children, both in school. Elizabeth has a beauty salon that she has operated for nine years.

To help expand her business, Elizabeth has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase more dryers. With the help of the loan, she hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to own a training school for catering, tailoring and hair dressing. Elizabeth is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future.

Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills. Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses. These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance. Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To buy more hair dryers

loans.name: Ernesto Luis Novela

texts.pt:
Ernesto luis Novela U. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, pai de 4 filhos de idades entre 5 a 12 anos de idade, os 3 mais velhos vão a Escola. Fez somente 6ª classe, não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras pelos progenitores. Vive na casa própria cedida pelos pais, com a sua família e sustenta seus pais que vivem com ele.

Saiu da sua cidade natal para Boane com seus pais, é pedreiro de profissão ha mais de 15 anos e trabalha com 3 ajudantes. Consegue um valor de cerca de 3.500.00mt por mês depois das despesas dos seus ajudantes, onde consegue poupar algo em casa para eventuais situações.
 
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de vizinhos que também são clientes da instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, cimento, portas, barrotes e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. O empréstimo anterior foi no valor de 7.000.00mt e foi para a aquisição de bens.

No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua casa e oferecer melhores condições de habitação a sua família.
texts.en:
Ernesto Luis Novela U. was born in the city of Matola, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. He has four children between the ages of 5 and 12; the 3 eldest go to school. Ernesto only finished sixth grade and did not continue because of his parents' financial troubles. He and his family live in his own house, which his parents gave to him, and he supports his parents, who live with him. He left his hometown to come to Boane with his parents. Ernesto has been a stonemason for more than 15 years and works with three helpers. He earns about 3,500 meticais per month after paying his helpers, and he manages to save some money at home for unforeseen circumstances. He has never had loans with other banks. Ernesto learned about Hluvuku through neighbors who are also customers of this institution. This is his second loan. He is asking for 10,000 meticais, and he intends to buy construction material (iron, cement, doors, beams, and other items) to continue building his home. The earlier loan was for 7,000 meticais and was for purchasing property. In the future he intends to ask for more loans to finish his house and offer his family better living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material (iron, cement, doors, beams and other items)

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia P. is from the village of Balila, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 50 years old. Emelia is married and has three adult children. Emelia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Emelia has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Emelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Emelia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Emelia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
This is Natividad F., 47, resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Fidel F., a groomer, and a mother to three young hard working adults, one of whom is still in college. By the grace of God, Natividad has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their every day expenses.

Natividad operates a variety store and a canteen. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale price and selling in piece rate.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 9, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Natividad dreams to be able to renovate her house soon, with some of the savings from her business. She also hopes to be able to continue supporting her youngest child who is still studying. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE COMPONE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Izcuchaca, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Angelica; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con enseñanza a niños del nivel inicial y primario, ella es profesora en la ciudad de Cusco, la socia quiere mejorar y tener más material educativo para enseñar. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar material educativo para la enseñanza de los niños.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to community bank “SAN ISIDRO DE COMPONES”. This bank is located in Izcuchaca district, in the Anta province and Cusco department.

She alternates her daily activities with teaching pre-school and primary school children. She is a teacher in the city of Cusco. She wants to improve and to have more educational materials for teaching. She is requesting the loan in order to buy education materials to use with the children.

Angelica is grateful for those who form part of her dream and she promises to repay in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy educational materials for teaching children

loans.name: Munhbat

texts.en:
Munhbat E. is 26 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His eldest child attends a local secondary school.
Munhbat's wife operates a grocery trading business while Munhbat drives a taxi to supplement the family income. His wife sells flour and rice from a shipping container at the local market. They started this business in 2008 by first renting the container and then purchasing it with their business revenues. Over the years they have worked hard to build a stable business operation and their working capital has reached up to 5,000,000 MNT. With their business profits, they have been able to buy a a new car, which is used as a taxi. In the future, they plan to increase their working capital and improve the car. Munhbat is a very open-minded and friendly man and is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more flour and rice to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more flour and rice

loans.name: Etelvina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC PURIRISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Etelvina; ella tiene 34 años de edad, conviviente  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurante, ella sola lo administra ya que su esposo se dedica a la construcción de obras (maestro obrero) la socia es una señora muy emprendedora y con ganas de seguir adelante.    

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más productos para su negocio como son azúcar, arroz, menestras entre otros.
 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the community bank "Sumac Puririsun".  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.
The member is Mrs Etelvina, she is 34 years old, lives with a partner and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily family activities and a restaurant business.  She runs it by herself because her husband works on construction projects (master builder).  She is a very enterprising woman with desires to get ahead.

The associate is requesting a loan to buy more products for her business, such as sugar, rice, mixed vegetables among others.

The associate thanks all that are part of this dream and promises to comply with the loan payments within the time established.

loans.use: The associate is requesting a loan to buy more products for her business, such as sugar, rice, mixed vegetables among others.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 30 years old and in business. She operates "Unique Salon" in a residential estate of Nairobi. She employs three people and serves the estate residents. She is requesting for a loan of 90,000 Kes, to renovate her business premises and purchase more dryers. 

Aileen is single and very hardworking with a five year plan of opening more outlets in Nairobi. She has been in this business for four years.

loans.use: To renovate her business premises and purchase more dryers

loans.name: Delie

texts.en:
Delie D. R. is from the village of Rizal West, San Isidro. She is 32 years old. Delie is married and has two children: one is in school-aged while the other one is in the infant-aged. To make a living, Delie owns and operates a retail store, selling a variety of products in the local community. Delie has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Delie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Delie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Delie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which also will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Delie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Sun D., 31, sells mangoes and chickens, earning an income of 4 USD per day. D. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. The family spends 120  USD on food, 5 USD on electricity and 40 USD on other necessary expenses every month. Dadene is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase more mangoes to resell. This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy more mangoes to resell

loans.name: Saeda

texts.en:
Saeda is married to AbulHadi who owns a toy store in Jenin city. Saeda has one daughter and three sons, she works in farming, growing herbs and seasonal vegetables in a small farm that she has, next to the house.

Saeda's husband has a small toys store selling children toys and gift items which is the family's main source of income. Saeda took a loan from FATEN so that her husband can pay for the toys he bought recently to increase the income earned from the sale of the items in his store.

Saeda's husband AbdulHadi appears in the picture here as Saeda is a conservative woman.

loans.use: Purchase toys and childrens gifts to sell in his store

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is separated form her spouse and lives in Bago City, Negros Occidental, where she earns a living by buying and selling rice. She has a child who is 26 years old. She joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she wanted a better life for family. With the help of 17 previous loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Emma has been slowly lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) helped increase her monthly profits to PHP 10,000, and that meant a higher living standard for her family. She is applying for her 18th loan, for PHP 19,500, to buy more rice to sell because this will allow her to save more money and create a prosperous future for herself and her daughter. Emma is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) woman who is following an honorable path to the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through its poverty-alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending group on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To buy more rice to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mburu

texts.en: Mburu is 73 years old.  He is widowed and have four children.  For more than twenty years, he has been operating a retail shop.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has improved his business and bought a piece of land.  He has also seen his children through school.   He hopes to fully establish his business and leave it to his family to continue running it in the future.  Mburu has requested a loan for 70, 000 Kes to buy sugar, rice, beans, wheat flour, cooking fat and salt.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, beans, wheat flour, cooking fat and salt

loans.name: Rasiya

texts.en:
Rasiya E. is 51, married, and has two children. Rasiya works as a librarian in the local administration of  Keper-Arik village, and her husband, Shukurbek, is a stockkeeper/clerk.  In order to add to their income, Rasiya’s family is engaged in cattle breeding. They started this activity with initial capital of 10,000 KGS, and now they have a farm with one milk cow, one horse, twenty sheep and bull calves. Also, Rasiya is engaged in cultivating the land  with sugar beets, a profitable activity. 

Rasiya has applied for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase cattle, which will allow her to increase milk product sales. With the revenues, she plans to hold her son’s marriage and give a good dowry for her daughter. Rasiya’s family is very tight-knit and makes every effort to make their dreams of a prosperous future come true. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Micro-finance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Emanuel

texts.en:
Emanuel is a resident of Kitale Town in Western Kenya where he does his mixed farming,producing maize and beans and selling to local middlemen. He is married with four children of school-going age. Emanuel runs a cereals retail shop which generates additional income.

Emanuel has requested a loan of 31,200 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes the loan will improve his productivity hence income so as to enable him to feed, clothe and educate his children. He is also focusing on owning good quality dairy cows.

He laments adverse weather conditions which destroy produce and fluctuating market prices.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 30 years old, married to Sheila M., a business lady, and they have two children aged six years and two years old.  For the past 10 years, James has been growing passion fruit on his farm in Kabirirsang;Kapsabet,and earns a monthly income of Ksh 10,600 from sales.

James has applied for a loan of Ksh 60,000 from KADET LTD for his second loan after having repaid his previous one. He will use this money to pay for the passion fruit seedlings.  


The subsequent profits will be used to extend the farm and plant more passion fruit. His dream is become a major supplier of passion fruits in the market.

loans.use: to pay for passion fruit seedlings

loans.name: Fatou Kiné

texts.fr: Madame Fatou  Kiné D. est une femme mariée de 41 ans. Elle habite dans la localité de Yoff. Elle est mère de 5 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 8 et 24 ans. Elle a aussi en charge un de  ses petits fils. Elle est vendeuse de sandwich et de ragout. Elle a une expérience de plus  de 20ans dans cette activité. Son mari est chauffeur et elle a choisi cette activité dans le but de l’aider dans les charges quotidiennes. Sa maman l’a aussi beaucoup influencé dans son choix car cette dernière exerçait  cette même  activité qui lui a permis d’acquérir une maison. Madame D. est membre du guichet de Yoff depuis novembre 2003. Elle a déjà remboursé 7 prêts antérieurs   au sein de l’institution. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus destinés à la vente. Elle souhaite diversifier son activité de commerce. Son objectif est  d’accroitre son épargne.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatou Kiné D. is a 41-year-old married woman. She lives in the town of Yoff. She is the mother of five children, aged 8 to 24.  She also has one of her grandchildren to support. Fatou is a seller of sandwiches and stews. Ms. D. has over twenty years of experience in this business. Her husband is a chauffeur, and she has chosen this work with the goal of helping him with day-to-day expenses. Her mom has influenced her a lot in her choice, since her mother used to do this same work. It has enabled her to acquire a house.

Ms. D. has been a member of the Yoff branch office since November 2003. She has already repaid seven previous loans with this micro-finance institution. She is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs for buying cloth for resale. She wishes to diversify her commerce. Her goal is to grow her savings.

loans.use: to buy "thioub" cloth

loans.name: Gandorj

texts.en:
Mr. Gandorj is 39 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His two children go to a local secondary school. Gandorj’s wife, Otgonbayar, used to run a transportation business carrying people using her family minibus. But recently city authorities toughened the requirements for public transport and as a result, she lost the permission to carry people in her minibus. She is a professional chef and currently she is looking for a job in the kitchen. 

Batbayar is man of ambition. Batbayar is building a house, garage, fence and shed to install a heating system. Currently the garage, fence and shed are almost done; he needs to install the big doors to the garage and fence. He is planning to complete the house next year. The loan Gandorj is taking will be used to buy metal doors for the garage and fence.

loans.use: to buy metal doors for the garage and fence.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 29 años de edad es un hombre amable y trabajador que vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Motupe- Lambayeque. Jorge vive en la zona urbana de Motupe, esta es una zona que cuenta con una gran actividad comercial que está en constante crecimiento. Además, la gente de este distrito se le caracteriza por ser gente pujante.

Desde hace 4 años Jorge trabaja de operador en una embotelladora que provee a la empresa cervecera más grande del Perú. Además, como una ganancia adicional, Jorge se dedica ala comercialización de animales menores (ganado ovino – caprino- porcino y aves de corral).

 Jorge desea mejorar su calidad e vida y con sus dos trabajos ha logrado ahorrar un poco de dinero para construir su vivienda. Sin embargo aún le falta presupuesto para hacerlo. Es por eso que solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito  de 1000 nuevos soles, que destinará en la construcción de su hogar.

Jorge es un cliente recurrente de nuestra entidad y estaría muy agradecido, de concederle el crédito, porque lo ayudará a su desarrollo como persona.
texts.en:
Jorge is 29 years old.  He is a kind and hard-working man who lives with his parents in Motupe district - Lambayeque.  Jorge lives in the urban area of Motupe.  This is an area that has a high level of commercial activity and is constantly growing.  In addition, the residents of this district are noted as being strong people.

For four years, Jorge has been working as an operator in a bottling plant which supplies the largest beer company in Peru.  In order to make additional income, he also sells animals (sheep, goats, pigs and poultry).

Jorge would like to improve his quality of life and, through his two jobs, he has managed to save a little money to build his own home.  However, he still lacks the overall budget to do so.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles that he will use to build his home.

Jorge is a repeat client of our institution and he is very grateful for this loan as it will help him to develop as a person.

loans.use: to build his home

loans.name: Sangita

texts.en:
This is 42 year-old Sangita.  She is married and has three children (24, 20 and 17).  In 2003, she established her poultry farming business. In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business.  Sangita works seven days a week and five hours a day to support her family.  She has successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW, and her most recent loan was used to buy small chickens.  In the future, Sangita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.   

Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy.  Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buy small chickens

loans.name: Noupagagnon 1 Group

texts.fr:
NOUPAGAGNON 1  est un groupe de femmes mariées du village de Kafono   dans la préfecture de SAN région de SÉGOU quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 31 ans et au moins 4 enfants.
Elles cultivent essentiellement de l’arachide. Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe NOUPAGAGNON 1 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne.
PORTIO, qui est la présidente et la première debout à gauche en foulard vert, compte acheter, des semences d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants, au grand marché de kimparana. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, essentiellement en détail au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 21000 à 23000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courant de la famille.
texts.en:
Noupagagnon 1 is a group of married women from the village of Kafono, part of the San prefecture in the Ségou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families and are on average 31 years old with at least four children.

They mainly grow peanuts. To make their farming profitable, members of the Noupagagnon 1 group decided two years ago to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program. Having successfully repaid the previous loan, they are now on their second agricultural loan.

Portio, who is the president and is the first person standing on the right with a green scarf, wants to buy peanuts for planting, small farming equipment and agricultural inputs at the general market in Kimparana.

After the rainy season, crops are stored for a while so that they can gain value before being resold at the general market in Kimparana and in surrounding markets, mainly retail for cash to customers usually from large cities.

After selling their agricultural products each member of the group hopes to achieve profits between 21,000 and 23,000 FCFA, which will be used to repay loan interests and cover ongoing family expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, seeds, and small farming equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more freezers

loans.name: Merced

texts.en:
Merced is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.

Merced has a retail shop that sells breads, biscuits and canned goods. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Merced is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Merced hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Abla est une femme âgée de 58 ans. Elle est mariée à un secrétaire à la retraite. Elle a deux enfants.

Elle travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1986.Elle achète des pagnes au grand marché de Lomé puis les revend dans divers  marchés comme celui d’Assiyéyé, d’Avéta puis de Tsévié.

Elle a requis son premier crédit  de WAGES afin d’acheter plus de pagnes pour satisfaire les choix très variés de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Abla is a 58-year-old woman who is married to a retired secretary. She has two children.

Abla became a reseller in 1986. She buys pagnes (colorful West-African cloth) at the Grand market of Lomé, and sells her merchandise at various markets such as those of Assiyéyé, Avéta and Tsévié. 

She is seeking her first loan from WAGES to stock up on pagnes and meet her customers’ very diverse requirements.

loans.use: to buy pagnes for resale

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 26 years old and married to Mariam. He has practiced farming for six years.   

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He plans to use the loan to buy a dairy cow.

In the future, he hopes to become a leading supplier of milk in his area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor tiene 28 años, es una joven soltera alegre y trabajadora con ganas de triunfar en la vida, vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es obtener mejores ingresos para así darle una estabilidad económica a su futura familia. Flor con el apoyo de sus padres abrió una tienda de abarrotes, en donde ofrece variedad de productos de primera necesidad, su puesto le genera buenas ganancias económicas, ella abre las puertas de su negocio desde muy tempranas horas en espera de sus primeros compradores. Menciona que la clave de captar mayores consumidores es atender amablemente y apoyarlos en sus compras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es quedar bien con sus clientes, pues lleva 04 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer de pie todo el transcurso del día. En su negocio le va muy bien y gracias a ello apoya en los gastos de alimentación de sus padres. Con el dinero del crédito comprará suministros en cantidad para su puesto de ventas, pues su mayor deseo es ampliar su vivienda y así agrandar  su  bodega. Este será su primer crédito de Flor y esta muy contenta de saber que contará con el apoyo de todos ustedes para que pueda continuar con su trabajo. Con el crédito comprará mercadería como: sacos de arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en: Flor, 28, is a young, cheerful, hard-working single woman who wants to be successful in life.  She lives in her own home and wants to improve her income so she can give her family a more stable economy.  With the support of her parents, Flor opened a grocery store which offers a variety of basic needs products and generates a good profit.  She opens very early in the morning to receive her first customers.  She says the key to attracting more customers is treating them kindly and helping them with their purchases.  What she enjoys most about her work is keeping the customers satisfied.  She has been in business for four years and feels the hardest part is having to stand all day on the job.  Business is doing well and allows her to help her parents with food costs.  She plans to use the loan to buy bulk quanitities for the store.  Her goal is to add on to the house and expand her store.  This is Flor's first loan and she is happy knowing that she can count on you for help to continue with her work.  She plans to buy merchandise for the store such as sacks of rice, sugar, oils, and detergents.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, sugar, oils, and detergents to stock her store.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel es madre de dos niños estudiantes de primaria, ella se dedica a vender zapato por catalogo desde hace un año y dice que emprendió ese negocio para tener su propio dinero ya que desde pequeña siempre le gusto trabajar y ahorita lo hace para darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Maribel vende sus zapatos a personas de su confianza ya que los vende en pagos y surte sus zapatos en distribuidores autorizados de su población, a diario ella sale a ofrecer los zapatos por catalogo y dice que se le hace un buen negocio ya que si le deja ganancias, ella esta pidiendo un crédito para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio ya que ahorita tiene varios pedidos pendientes y por falta de dinero no los ha podido hacer y dice que gracias al crédito podrá comprar los zapatos que le hacen falta. La meta que tiene Maribel es más adelante también vender ropa y accesorios ella dice “las mujeres somos muy vanidosas y nos gusta siempre andar al ultimo grito de la moda es por eso que quiero también invertir en accesorios como bolsas, aretes, lencería etc. por que nos gusta vernos bonitas y se me hace un buen negocio”.
texts.en:
Maribel has two children in primary school. She has been selling shoes over catalogue for a year. She started her business to have her own source of income. From an early age she liked to work and now she's doing it to provide her children with a better quality of life. 

Maribel sells shoes to people she trusts, as she sells them in instalments. She buys the shoes from authorised distributors in her town. Every day she goes out to offer the shoes over catalogue. She says it's a good business and that it leaves a neat profit. 

She is requesting a loan to continue to invest in her business. She now has a number of pending orders which she hasn't been able to process due to lack of cash. She says that thanks to the loan she will be able to buy the shoes she needs.

Maribel's goal is to also sell clothes and accessories. She says: "Women are vain and we like to wear what's in fashion. That's why I'd like to invest in accessories such as handbags, earrings, lingerie and other goods, because we like to make ourselves look pretty and it's a good business".

loans.use: to sell shoes over catalogue.

loans.name: Salomie

texts.en:
Salome is 28 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She is married and her husband is a taxi driver. They have 3 children, aged between 3 and 10 years, all of whom live at home and are presently in school. 

For the past 9 years Salome has been selling slippers. She started the business with help from her husband. She makes a lot of profit. She has requested a loan to purchase more slippers for her business. Salome plans to sent her children to school and she would like to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Fils

texts.fr:
Fils est né au Rwanda et il a 25 ans. Il est marié avec 1 enfant de 1 an et 7 mois. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de primaire. 

Fils est transporteur (il a un taxi moto). C’est son quatrième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter une moto pour son business. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’augmenter les nombres des motos utilisées pour augmenter la capacité.
Dans les prochaines années, Fils voudrait acheter des voitures utilisées comme taxi et devenir. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’aider sa famille de se développer et la soigner.
texts.en:
Fils was born in Rwanda and he is 25 years old. He is married with 1 child aged 1year and 7 months. His education reached the 6th year of primary school.
Fils is a driver (he has a motorcycle taxi) this is his fourth loan with ACB.He is going to use his credit to buy a motorbike for his business.
His strategy for the growth of his business is to increase the number of motorbikes to increase his capacity.
In the next few years, Fils would like to buy cars to use as taxis and become a taxi driver. With the profits, he plans to help his family to develop and look after them.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for his business.

loans.name: El Zapotito Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama el zapotito. La  historia es acerca del señora Arcenia, ya que es una de los integrantes que conforman este grupo, ella cuenta con 30 años de edad, está casada con el señor Manuel y tiene 1 hijo, Lizbeth de 4 años la cual está cursando el segundo año de preescolar, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ropa artesanal, como vestidos, blusas, servilletas y manteles.

Dice que eligió este negocio, ya que quería buscar la manera de apoyar a su esposo e hijo, para así mismo tener una mejor solvencia económica y excelente calidad de vida, aparte de que dice desde pequeña su mama le enseño a elaborarlos aparte de que es una muy buena fuente de ingresos, es por eso que decidió empezar con esta actividad, el préstamo que recibió lo va a invertir, en la compra de mas material como son: telas, cuadrille, hilos, agujas, armazones y chaquira, para continuar con sus ventas.


Doña Arsenia dice que su meta es la de hacer que su negocio crezca empresarialmente, ya que quiere construir un local, puesto que lo que ella mas desea es poner su tienda de ropa artesanal y así dar a conocer un poco de lo que hacen en su comunidad, también para de esta forma tenerlo bien surtido, con más variedad de prendas, para así obtener más y mejores ganancias.  

Ella dice que conoce muy bien a sus compañeras y comenta que son personas muy responsables, gente trabajadora, confiable que tienen ganas de salir adelante y superarse, por lo mismo le están echando muchas ganas.

Da las gracias a FRAC y a los prestatarios de kiva, por darle la oportunidad y confianza, pero sobre todo por creer en él, ya que gracias a su ayuda pudo invertir en su negocio y asi tener una mejor calidad de vida, junto con su familia y un mejor futuro.

Las personas que conforman el grupo de el zapotito son las siguientes: blanca, Isabel, Arsenia y Emilia, quienes se dedican a la elaboración y venta de ropa artesanal.
texts.en:
This group is called El Zapotito.  This story is about Arcenia, one of the members of the group.  She is 30 years old and married to Manuel with one child, Lizbeth, 4, who is in her second year of preschool.  Arcenia makes and sells handmade traditional clothing such as dresses, blouses, napkins, and tablecloths.

She says she chose this business because she was looking for a way to support her husband and child, to have greater financial dependability and an excellent quality of life.  She also says that her mother taught her to make clothing when she was a little girl, and that it is a good source of income.  This is why she decided to begin with this kind of work.

She is going to use the loan she received to buy more material such as fabric, needlework fabric, thread, needles, frames, and embroidery beads to continue with her sales.

Arcenia says her goal is to make her business grow, because she wants to construct a place, since what she most wants is to have a store of handmade clothing as a way to let people know something of the work that is done in her community.  She also wants to have it well stocked, with a greater variety of articles, to have more and better profits.

She says she knows her friends very well, and they are very responsible, hard-working, and trustworthy people who want to get ahead and improve themselves, for which they are working very hard.

She thanks FRAC and the Kiva lenders for giving her the opportunity and self-confidence, but above all for believing in her, since thanks to their help she managed to invest in her business and so have a better quality of life, along with her family, and a better future.

The members of the El Zapotito group are Blanca, Isabel, Arcenia, and Emilia, who make and sell handmade clothing.

loans.use: to buy more materials such as fabric, needlework fabric, thread, needles, frames, and embroidery beads.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: El Señor José Francisco tiene 31 años es padre soltero, además se dedica una desgranadora de maíz, hace ocho años. Anteriormente el negocio lo tenía su Papa que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mantenerlo y decidió establecer a José como responsable del negocio. El motivo del crédito es para mantenimiento de la maquina, su meta es ver crecer su negocio y lograr el sueño de seguir manteniendo a su familia que son su mayor prioridad. José está muy agradecido con el crédito otorgado ya que con esa oportunidad cumplirá sus desafíos propuestos.
texts.en: Jose Francisco is 31 years old and he is a single father. He has also been working at a corn production plant for the past eight years. The business which he had previously belonged to his father; he maintained it with a great deal of effort. He later decided to establish Jose as the responsible person of the business. The reason for the loan is to carry out maintenance repairs to the machine. His goal is to see his business grow and to achieve his dream of continually supporting his family. They are his greatest priority. Jose is very thankful for the loan granted to him. With this opportunity he will attain the goals he has set for himself.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance repairs to a machine.

loans.name: Abdou-Bariou

texts.fr:
Abdou-Bariou est un homme âgé de 42 ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse et n’a pas d’enfant.
Abdou-Bariou travaille comme frigoriste et vendeur de frigidaire et congélateurs depuis 2001. Il vend à ses clients dans un quartier de la place après achat au port autonome de Lomé.
Abdou-Bariou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter 04 congélateurs et 20 compresseurs. Il désire rendre sa famille heureuse avec les bénéfices réalisés sur la vente de ses marchandises.
texts.en:
Abdou-Bariou is a 42-year-old man. He is married to a retail merchant and has no children.

Abdou-Bariou has been working as a refrigerating engineer and seller of refrigerators and freezers since 2001. He sells to his customers from the local neighborhood after buying from the Autonomous Port of Lomé.

Abdou-Bariou is requesting his first WAGES credit loan to purchase four freezers and 20 compressors. He wants to ensure his family's happiness with the profits from his sales.

loans.use: Buy freezers and compressors

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна замужем. Ее супруга зовут Петр.  У них двое детей. Татьяна имеет свой бизнес.Она имеет свою торговую точку на центральном рынке города. Продает Татьяна твердый сыр, масло подсолнечное, масло сливочное , маргарин и колбасу. На рост бизнеса повлияло качество продукции и хорошая цена. Татьяна обладает нужными качествами: она трудолюбивая, целеустремленная, открытая и искренняя. Она ставит для себя цели улучшать благосостоянии семьи.
Татьяна просит предоставить ей кредит на сумму 10,000 гривен на закупку товара: масла и сыра.
texts.en: Tatyana is married.  She and her husband Peter have two children.  Tatyana has her own business.  She has a retail outlet at the town's central market.  Tatyana sells hard cheese, sunflower oil, butter, margarine and sausage.  Quality of products and good prices positively affected the growth of her business.  Tatyana possesses the necessary qualities: she is a hardworking, goal-oriented, open and honest person.  She sets goals for herself of improving her family's livelihood.  Tatyana is requesting a loan in the sum of 10,000 hryvnia for the purchase of products, such as butter and cheese.

loans.use: to purchase products, such as butter and cheese

loans.name: Baktybek

texts.ru:
Бактыбек родом из села Кум-Арык (Панфиловский район, Чуйская область, Кыргызстан). 
Бактыбек родился в 1980 году в простой семье фермера.  С детства Бактыбек, будучи старшим братом двух сестренок, помогал отцу по уходу за скотом и мечтал в будущем иметь свое собственное хозяйство. После окончания школы, Бактыбек пошел учиться в автодорожный техникум на водителя сельхоз техники, а затем устроился в местный колхоз  в качестве тракториста - комбайнера. Спустя год у Бактыбека, в результате болезни, умирает отец. Эти были тяжелые времена для него, так как он стал единственным мужчиной и кормильцем  в семье, мать нигде не работала, сестренки были еще маленькими.
