Проработав в колхозе несколько лет, Бактыбек решил уехать за границу на заработки. За несколько лет он проработал в Алмате (Казахстан) и Москве (Россия), в качестве охранника, водителя, строителя и других профессий, не требующих соответствующего образования. Бактыбек отправлял заработанные деньги домой, на которые мать покупала скот и выдала замуж дочерей.
В 2010 году Бактыбек решил жениться. В этом же году у него случилось несчастье - умерла мама. Эту утрату ему помогла пережить его жена, которая стала его опорой во всем.   Бактыбек твердо решил заняться животноводством  и на данный момент, благодаря упорству Бактыбека, в хозяйстве у него насчитывается 2 дойных коровы, 2 бычка и 30 голов баранов. Ежемесячная прибыль от продажи молока и молочных продуктов составляет около 10,000 сом.  В целях дальнейшего увеличения, Бактыбек обратился в компанию «Бай Тушум и Партнеры»  за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров.  В дальнейшем Бактыбек планирует увеличение поголовья скота и мечтает построить большой дом.
texts.en: Baktybek is a native of the Kum Aryk village (Panfilovsky region, Chuyskaya oblast, Kyrgyzstan). Baktybek was born in 1980 to a simple farming family. From childhood Baktybek, the older brother of two sisters, helped his father care for the animals and dreamed of having his own farm in the future. After high school, Baktybek studied at an automotive technical college to be an agricultural equipment driver, and then settled down at a local farm as a tractor-combine operator. A year later, Baktybek's father died of an illness. This was a difficult time for him, as he became the only man and provider for the family; his mother did not work anywhere and his sisters were still young. Having worked on the farm for several years, Baktybek decided to go abroad for work. For a few years, he worked in Almaty (Kazahstan) and in Moscow (Russia) as a security guard, driver, construction worker and other jobs that did not require an education. Baktybek sent his earnings home and his mother bought cattle and got her daughters married. In 2010, Baktybek decided to get married. In this year something unfortunate happened- his mother died. His wife helped him survive this loss, who became his support in everything. Baktybek resolutely decided to raise livestock and at this time, thanks to his perseverance, Baktybek  has 2 dairy cows, two bulls and 30 heads of sheep. His monthly income from selling milk and dairy products is around 10,000 som. In order to further increase this amount, Baktybek has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners to request a loan of 100,000 som to buy dairy cows. Later Batybek plans to increase his amount of livestock and dreams of building a big home.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
Сергей женат, у него взрослые дочери. Сергей – из села Приветное. Он занимается выращиванием ранних сельхозкультур и каждый год высаживает 20 000 голов капусты, 15 000 перцев, 20 000 баклажанов, 10 000 кустов клубники, 1 000 головок лука, 30 000 кустов помидоров и засаживает 30 соток картофелем. Фермерством Сергей зарабатывает на жизнь вот уже 15 лет. В свое немалое хозяйство он вложил 50 000 гривен. Чистая прибыль составляет 4 400 гривен в месяц.   

Сергей хотел бы вложить сумму в 15 000 гривен в закупку семян и удобрений, а также проведение отопления, ремонт теплиц и перетяжку полиэтиленовой пленки в них. Сергею нравится заниматься любимым делом и в то же самое время зарабатывать при этом достаточно средств, чтобы содержать семью. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Sergei is married and has adult daughters.  He is from the Privetnoye village.  He is involved in growing early agricultural crops and plant 20 000 heads of cabbage, 15 000 peppers, 20 000 eggplants, 10 000 strawberry plants, 1 000 heads of onions, 30 000 tomato plants and uses 30 sotkas to plant potatoes every year.  Farming has been earning a living for Sergei for 15 years.  He invested 50 000 hryvnia into his large business.  His net profit amounts to 4 400 hryvnia per month.  Sergei wants to invest a sum of 15 000 hryvnia to purchase seeds and fertilizers, and also to install heating, repair greenhouses and re-installing the plastic in them.  Sergei likes to be involved in his favorite business and also likes to earn enough money from it to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers, and also to install heating, repair greenhouses and re-installing the plastic in them

loans.name: Toch

texts.en: Toch, 50, resides in Prey Veng Province. Toch and her husband are farmers. Toch is requesting a loan of US $1000 to purchase a mechanical plow to help plow the rice field and to transport rice from the field. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, Toch would like to use any additional income to purchase a rice harvesting machine. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a mechanical plow to help plow the rice field and transport rice from the field.

loans.name: Katherine

texts.es: A sus 19 años, la joven katherine es madre de un bebé de un año de nacido, buscando generar recursos para el sostenimiento de su hija, inicio hace seis meses con la venta por encargo de mercancía como zapatos, camisas, jeans y ropa interior. Gracias a esta actividad puede conseguir los ingresos necesarios y estar a la vez al cuidado de su hija. Debido al invierno, las ventas de la joven Katherine han disminuido, por lo que necesita de la compra de surtido con el cual pueda reactivar su negocio, mejorar sus ventas y así la calidad de vida de su familia. El sueño de la joven Katherine es ver crecer a su hija y tener su propio almacén de ropa.
texts.en:
At 19 years of age young Katherine is mother to a one year old baby. Six months ago, looking to generate funds for the sustenance of her daughter, she started selling by order merchandise such as shoes, shirts, jeans and underwear. Thanks to this activity she can obtain necessary income and care for her daughter at the same time. 

Due to the winter, young Katherine's sales have dropped. For this reason she needs to buy assorted clothing to be able to reactivate her business, increase sales and thus improve her family's quality of life. Young Katherine's dream is to see her daughter grow up and to have her own clothing warehouse.

loans.use: buy assorted men's and women's clothing.

loans.name: Ana Elizabet

texts.es:
La socia anteriormente se dedicaba al negocio de venta de colchas y lanas pero no le fue muy bien,ahora se esta dedicando al negocio de venta de repuestos para computadoras,ella tiene un tienda en la ciudad de Cusco,la socia tambien se esta dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes y gallinas,por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar la tienda de venta de repuestos de computadora.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos para las computadoras y tambien para comprar animales como cuyes y gallinas.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ana Elizabet used to work in the business of selling bedspreads and woolen yarns, but it didn’t go well for her. Now she is in the business of selling replacement parts for computers. She has a store in the city of Cusco. She also is working in the business of raising animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. Via these businesses, she is able to provide for her children. Her dream is to expand her computer parts store. She is requesting the loan to buy replacement parts for computers and also to buy animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. 

She is happy because of the loan and she pledges to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for computers and also to buy animals such as guinea pigs and chickens

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the group called Trabajando para el futuro (Working for the future), located in the city of Samana. This is her 14th loan, which she will use to improve her house. She has had her business for over seven years, starting when she took her first loan from Esperanza Internacional. Since then she has paid back all her loans and expanded her business. 

After her last loan, which she invested in her business, Isabel realised the need to improve her home by building a decent kitchen as the one she has is very weak and not safe. This is the reason why she talked to other members of her group and they recommended her for a Housing loan to improve her home kitchen. 

Esperanza Internacional runs a programme for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their business and who have shown fidelity in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their house at the same time as running their business and attending their group meetings.

Isabel is the mother of five children. Two of them live with her and her husband in their simple rural home. Isabel will use this loan to buy wood, zinc, nails, cement and other construction materials. With these, she will build a kitchen for her house, including the doors, walls, floor and a zinc roof. 

Isabel thanks God, Esperanza Internacional and all of you for this opportunity. In her name and that of her family she thanks all of you for your support! 

In the picture we can see Isabel next to her old kitchen.

loans.use: to buy wood, zinc, nails and other construction materials.

loans.name: Dagbemabou 2 Group

texts.fr: DAGBEMABOU 2 est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, nommée Ablavi Félicité (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 36 ans est mariée à un certain Félix. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Ablavi Félicité vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Ablavi Félicitée et son mari. Ablavi Félicité a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face aux besoins de sa famille, Ablavi Félicité vend des feuilles de bissap et des boucles d’oreilles à son domicile depuis sept ans. Ablavi Félicité s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Ablavi Félicité sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DAGBEMABOU 2 un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des feuilles de bissap et des boucles d'oreille.

loans.name: Fifa Group

texts.fr: FIFA est un groupement composé de seize personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupement sollicite pour la troisième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Marie (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 49 ans. Marie n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Marie est mariée à un certain Paul. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et un à leur charge. Marie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Marie et son mari. Pour cette raison, Marie vend des beignets, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Marie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Marie sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe FIFA, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des sacs de farine de blé et de levin.

loans.name: Chynarkul

texts.ru: Чынаркул 41 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Чынаркул - среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав 6 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Чынаркул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 2 лошади, 2 теленка и 20 овец. Также Чынаркул работает в школе уборщицей, ее ежемесячный совокупный доход от заработной платы и ведения бизнеса в среднем составляет чуть более 8,000 сом (KGS), супруг Чынаркул работает преподавателем. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Чынаркул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец и телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Chynarkul is 41 years old and married.  She and her husband are raising three children.  She has the equivalent of a high school education. In order to provide a main source of income for her family, she started raising livestock six years ago, buying her first cattle for 10,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently owns two cows, two horses, two calves and 20 head of sheep.  She makes a monthly income of about 4,000 som (KGS) from her business.  In order to further grow her farming business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) which will be used to buy sheep and calves and increase her cattle headcount.  Chynarkul is planning to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further increasing her number of farm animals.  She also intends to save some money to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy additional sheep and calves in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Gulshoda

texts.ru: Гулшода, 23 года, замужем, 2 детей. У Гулшоды среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается полеводством. На 0,45 Га она выращивает рис для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулшода обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян, удобрений и обработку почвы для выращивания экологически чистого риса. Доходы от кредита Гулшода планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса и улучшение финансового состояния.
texts.en:
Gulshoda is 23 years old, married, and has 2 children. Gulshoda has a secondary education, and she raises animals and grows crops as a way to provide income for her family. Thanks to Gulshoda's hard work, her farm now has ___________. She grows rice for resale on 0.45 hectares of land. 

In order to further expand her farm, Gulshoda has approached Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy seeds, fertilizer, and to cultivate her land to grow organic rice. Gulshoda plans to use the proceeds from her loan to continue growing her business and improve her financial well-being.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and to cultivate her land in order to grow organic rice.

loans.name: Rukhsat

texts.ru: Рухсат 52 года. Она замужем и мать 4 детей. Она работает медсестрой в больнице,  а ее муж работает сантехником. Тех денег которые они зарабатывают не хватает для обеспечения семьи.  Поэтому они решили  заняться животноводством у себя дома. Рухсат очень целеустремленная женщина, и всегда доводит до конца все начатые дела. Поэтому мы даже не сомневаемся, что и в этом деле она преуспеет. Доход полученный от животноводства, они хотят вложить в образование своих детей. Она хочет, чтобы ее дети не нуждались не в чем и устроились в жизни, нашли хорошую работу. Поэтому она обратилась в МДО "Арванд", в надежде что мы окажем финансовую помощь. Заранее благодарит за понимание и поддержку.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Joyce would like to buy African Attires-curios, textiles, beads and baskets for Exhibition Shows

loans.name: José

texts.en: José began his business in 1983 with a business capital of $50. He has been selling beauty body lotion, small and medium sized radios, padlocks, shoe polish, batteries, etc. He’s had much experience in his business. The 1990s were very tough for José because of the political and economic instability in the DRCongo, which caused the collapse of many companies and businesses.  José started to demonstrate his talents in 2000 by using various methods of developing his business. He keeps trustworthy, permanent relationships with his suppliers in order to gain discounts through bulk buying and update market prices according to his suppliers.  José makes sure his his clients understand each time he must change the prices for things to keep good customer relations. He also tries to save a little each day. Before joining a loan group, José had $400 in business capital. Currently, he has $850. José is requesting a loan of $500. He intends to diversify his business by adding fresh food and beverages which are in high demand in the community. José is married and a father of two children.

loans.use: To increase his business by adding beverages and fresh foods

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
N. Matluba has had her business for 3 years. After finishing secondary school, financial difficulties in her family prevented her from continuing her education in the medical institute. As a result, her goal became earning money for daily expenses, and she became engaged in the retail trade. She is not married and lives with her parents. 
Thanks to her first loan, she had a successful summer season, and expanded her goods in broad assortment, which allows her to be more competitive. With the new loan, she plans to rent a shop so she can sell a large variety of goods, hire a salesman, and realize her dream of completing her education at the university.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en:
Fanta K. is forty-four years old and married with three children. Her husband is employed as a driver but his income alone cannot meet the family expenses. Fanta therefore supplements her husband’s income with the income from her soft drink business which is based in Makeni town in Sierra Leone.

Fanta distributes some of the drinks to small shops in a nearby village and collects the income on a weekly basis. Fanta would like to expand her overall inventory volume and is requesting a loan of $175 to do so.

loans.use: Expand her rotating stock of soft drinks

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Description of Business

Jesus Maria has a business selling clothing and cosmetics from a shop set up in her home. She also sells empanadas in a school nearby. She began her business with the support of her cousin, her loaned her $80. She depends on her business to provide food and education for her children. She feels very proud of the fact that she can support her family in such an important way.

Use of Loan

She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise, as well as to fix the floor of the shop. Right now there is only a dirt floor, which not only affects their health, but also the image of the business.

Personal Information

Jesus Maria is 40 years old and has three children, one of whom is a student. They have a stable family life and live in a simple cement house. Her main goal is to finish what is needed on the house, and grow the business.

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Jesús se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos además vende empanadas en una escuela de su localidad. Comenzó su negocio por motivación de su prima que le presto $80. Ella depende en su negocio para proveerle comida y educacion a sus hijos. Ella se siente muy orgullosa del hecho que le puede apoyar a su familia en una manera sumamente importante.

Uso del Préstamo

Ella quiere el crédito para comprar mas mercadería y además arreglar el piso del local que ha acondicionado en su domicilio. En la actualidad el piso es de tierra y esto afecta no solamente a su salud, pero tambien a la aparencia de su negocio.

Información Personal

Ella tiene 40 años y tres hijos de los cuales 1 estudia su casa es de cemento y tiene estabilidad familiar. Su principal meta es de terminar su casa y mejorar su negocio

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Fix the shop floor and buy merchandise

loans.name: Julián

texts.es:
Julián is a native of Pukará- Juliaca and is a very hard-working and responsible father. Since he married his wife Mari he has dedicated himself to breeding livestock and to ceramics, work that he carries out with great professionalism and dedication. Thanks to the income that he has obtained through his work he has been able to meet family economic expenses and provide schooling for his eight young children with satisfaction. Currently, the work that is producing the best economic return is that of artisan. Along with his wife and children, Julián makes beautiful pots of different sizes and models out of clay, in order to then sell them in the markets of various towns in his country. Julián and his wonderful family hope to increase their income and quality of life through this work. In order to begin that journey, Julián already purchased a dump truck for clay, a raw material that is used in the production of pots. However, Julián still needs a certain amount of money in order to buy wood to finish processing his excellent pieces. For this reason he is asking for a loan of $100 dollars. With your support Juan could very soon have the opportunity to make his dreams into reality.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Julián es natural del distrito de Pukará- Juliaca, es un padre muy trabajador y responsable, desde que se casó con Mari siempre se dedicó a la ganadería y a la cerámica, trabajos que desempeña con sumo profesionalismo y dedicación, gracias a los ingresos que obtiene con estos oficios ha podido solventar los gastos económicos familiares y los estudios de sus ocho hijos menores con satisfacción.Actualmente, el oficio que mayor ingreso económico le está generando es su trabajo de artesano con el que elabora junto a su esposa e hijos hermosas ollas de diferentes tamaños y modelos basado en barro (arcilla), para luego ofrecerlos en las ferias de los distintos pueblos de su país.}El deseo de Julián y su encantadora familia es incrementar su economía y nivel de vida con este trabajo y para iniciar su travesía ya adquirió un volquete de arcilla, materia prima que utiliza en la elaboración de su producción sin embargo aún requiere cierta cantidad de dinero para comprar leña para terminar de procesar sus excelentes enceres, es por esa razón que solicita un préstamo de100 dólares.“Gracias al apoyo que puedes otorgarle en corto tiempo Julián podrá convertir sus deseos en realidad”.

loans.use: To buy raw material in order to increase the quality of merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more kitchen supplies at wholesale price

loans.name: Ruzimatova

texts.en: Ruzimatova F. lives in Spitamen (Soghd oblast, Tajikistan). Mrs. Ruzimatova F.  applied to MicroInvest in 2007 and recommends herself as a serious and executive client. The business stability and income increases she's had have helped her to return the previous loan and to improve her business situation. Mrs. Ruzimatova F. is experienced in business of livestock and has the appropriate knowledge in the livestock because she has been engaged in the livestock business from her early years when she first helped her mother on the farm with cows and sheep, and now she helps her husband. It is the family business that brings in the general income. She is engaged in the home of livestock raising and selling and milk production. In time, she dreams of purchasing a horn pedigree milk-cow for the milk-sour (cultured milk) products and selling. Now Mrs. Ruzimatova F. requests a loan for business development to increase significantly the family income and to purchase another milk-cow.

loans.use: For business development

loans.name: Kireka A2(Iii) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Annet M.. She has a bar and pub business, and is requesting a loan to purchase more beer and drinks. Annet is 37 years old and is married. Her husband is a businessman. She has 4 children ranging in age from 11 to 16 and her children go to school. Each week, Annet makes approximately UGX 200000 (~ $116 USD) in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a piece of land.

Annet has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before, in the amount of UGX 1000000 (~ $583 USD) to invest in her business, and she paid the loan back on time.

 Annet is joined in her small group by Suzan M., Aminah N., Nelly N., and Shakira N..  Suzan M. has a beauty salon and wants to buy more weaves and braids. Aminah N. has a beauty salon and wants a loan to buy a hair dryer. Nelly N. operates a poultry farming busines and wants to purchase more poultry feed. Shakira N. sells cold soft drinks and is requesting a loan to buy another refrigerator.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer

loans.name: Thi Hai

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hải, 42 year old, has two school age children. Her income is 4.50USD a day. She’s never had a loan with anyone, now she would like to apply for a loan of 150USD with Binh Minh because it required no credit and has a weekly repayment plan. She’d use the funds of the loan to invest in her livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Hải, 42 tuổi, có ba con nhỏ còn đi học. Chị vay 2006000 đồng để chăn nuôi thêm tại nhà. Thu nhập trung bình của gia đình chị là 70000 đồng/ngày. Chị chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu. Chị thích vay theo chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì được trả góp hàng tuần và sẽ được vay lâu dài.

loans.use: Poultry

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 39 year old man who works and lives with his family in the Beirut suburbs. Ali has one child.

Ali sells paint for a living. This is the first time he has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. He needs a loan to buy merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his paint shop

loans.name: Kluvi Esther

texts.en:
Kluvi Esther A. sells food. She is married and has 3 children. Business is doing very well, and she wishes to increase sales. She is running out of stock.

She is asking for additional capital to buy more food items for sale.

loans.use: This loan will be used for additional capital to buy more food items for sale.

loans.name: Yuber

texts.es:
For 16 years, Yuber worked in a restaurant she had in her home. But ever since she was a little girl, she had always wanted to study cosmetology and start up a beauty salon. In 2003, her dream became a reality, and she was able to install a small salon in her house. Even before opening the salon, however, she had clients who sought her out for her services.

Yuber has applied for a loan to buy the supplies she needs for her salon and to buy perfumes and cosmetics which she also offers to the public.

She would like to study physiotherapy and massage therapy, so she can expand her beauty salon into a spa.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Yuber trabajó por 16 años en el restaurante que tenía en su casa. Pero desde que era niña, ella siempre quiso estudiar cosmetología y poner un salón de belleza. Fue así que en el 2003 su sueño se hizo realidad, y pudo instalar una pequeña estética en su casa. Sin embargo, ella tenía clientes que la buscaban por sus servicios antes que abriera la peluquería.

Yuber ha solicitado préstamos para la compra de los materiales que necesita en su peluquería, y para adquirir los perfumes y cosméticos que ella también ofrece a su público.

A ella le gustaría estudiar fisioterapia y masoterapia, para así ampliar su salón de belleza a la categoría de spa.

loans.use: Buy supplies for use in her beauty salon.
